review_body: Hotel, good location, staff,front desk,maid, maintenance, all very friendly and polite. I would come back again, in the future. Thank you for a wonderful experience !!! It's a hard thing the world is going through now.

Terrible! Awful! Dirty! Horrible! Hot! Small! And 0-NONE % CUSTOMER SERVICE Sloppy! Out of Date, Air Conditioning was a joke! It Took over three hours to even feel some kind of air/ wind in the hotel room

The place seems humble and a bit old but for the price and the location it is worthy. The rooms were super clean as well as the bathroom. I have to say that the sink could a longer faucet because it was hard to wash our hands. Our room had a nice balcony were we could rest and our room offered a kitchen and a fridge really convenient in case you want to cook and also just to mingle a bit together. It has a small swimming pool which is convenient if you do not want to go to the really close Waikiki beach. But if you prefer to go to the beach it is less than 2 minutes walking. Staff at the hotel were really nice and helpful too. Besides being super close to the beach is near many Waikiki attractions as well as a shopping area. I believe for the prices they offer if you only need a place to sleep this is the prefect place.

The Royal Grove Waikiki, has excellent accommodations, quality customer care and great amenities. I will be happy to book a reservation in the future and recommend the Royal Grove Waikiki to my friends and business associates.

Everything you need is within a 5 minute walk including Wakiki beach. Hotel is old and dated and probably 1/2 the price of the larger updated high rises that surround it. We enjoyed our stay and spending time by the quiet pool area. Nothing fancy here but was clean and staff were there to assist you with your needs.

Just stayed at the Royal Grove Hotel. The staff is very friendly and the location is very convienient. Unfortunatly, thats the only positive about the royal grove hotel. We had room 425 and I would recommand you avoid this room under all cost. We tried to do but it was the last avbl. The room is facing the big street and with old/broken windows, we could hear every car/bus and could not sleep the entire night. Rooms were also very old and not in a good shape. Finally, the shower was not working properly and we could not take a shower in the morning. After one night, we decided to go somewhere else...

Hotel is old and showing its age. No parking so for the added cost of parking we could have stayed in a nicer place. Even with us just wanted a comfortable room to stay in as this was a special trip, and this room barely met those needs. The beds were far from comfortable and pillows were way too old. Do yourself a favor and book a nicer room.The staff was very friendly, about the only plus there was to staying here.

The whole stay at royal grove was wonderful. Central to everything including bus service. Really nice staff. My holiday generally in Hawaii has been a great experience. We tried out two rooms. Even the small room was quite sufficient. The larger room was overall cleaner and very tidy.

This hotel is very old and run-down. You could see it from the street, in the hallways, etc. I find it dirty (not in a sense of not cleaning it up, but just very old, who knows how old are the stains on the spring boxes). The building sits at the very busy Kuhio avenue and it is low-rise, so you can hear all the noise, so if you have a weak sleep - you will have a bad time. There is a eat-out/in place downstairs as well as convenience store (with alcohol). Apart from street noise, this area is known for homeless people, so you could hear screams outside. Also, there is notice on the wall - do not leave valuables in room, safety box at front desk. Security seems to be an issue. Advertised as a non-smoking hotel, but cigarette butt almost hit my head while it was dropped from the hotel balcony. This is a walk-up building, easily accessible from street, particularly during daytime. Some positives - there is a daily housekeeping for making up beds, refreshing towels. Our unit had a fridge, stove, hot plate, toaster, microwave and coffee maker and some utensils, pots, glasses. It is also in the hearth of Waikiki, 5 minutes from the beach, with plenty shops and restaurants within walking distance. Front desk borrows beach towels and staff is friendly. Based on other visitors I could see in this hotel it seems that some (senior) like to return. A/C in room worked. But paying almost $200/night (with taxes) for 3 people (high season) for a very run-down hotel, it is not worth staying. I feel sorry not only for guests but also for housekeepers and the staff working in here, who really tried to keep it running.

On the outside is looks passable. On the inside it is a different matter. Very old furnishings in the rooms, to the point of dilapidation. Rooms are accessed through long, gloomy corridors. The rooms don't have Wifi (!!!), almost unheard of in the 21st century. No security safe in the rooms. The AC is ancient (window type). The hotel desperately needs a thorough refurbishment indeed.

SINCE the new management took over, the rates have skyrocketed and it’s all about making money. It used to be a family oriented hotel with some guests coming here for 50 years. They don’t accommodate returnees with a lower price. Probably be the last year we can afford to come here for 7 weeks. Positive note, 5 minutes from beach, friendly front staff, Gina and Donna.

This hotel needs a complete renovation. Very dilapidated and overall outdated feel. Staff was nice and I had no issues with check in. The room was clean but again very old feeling. AC in room worked very well, comforter was very thin though which made it too cold. Location was fine but there are other budget hotels in the area I would stay at over this one due to quality.

If you've been looking at hotel prices you'll be wondering why this one is reasonably priced. This is an older hotel that could use some upgrades and there are no frills. We had a basic room with a small kitchenette stocked with dishes, pots, pans, silverware, cleaning supplies and a small (full) size refridgerator. The room was decent size for 2 adults, a family of 4 may need more space. The bed was ok, bedding was clean. The bathroom was basic sink, toilet and tub. Overall, the place is clean, no bugs of any kind were spotted. However, the cleaning staff had overlooked dusting some areas for awhile. Our room was on the ground floor near the pool, but we heard very little noise. The pool is very small and in need of some maintenance, but clean and functional, and Waikiki Beach is only 1 block away!! WiFi is only available in the lobby/reception area. A designated unsheltered smoking area is located about 25 ft. from the side entrance along the street. As there is no smoking in all of Hawaii you're at the mercy of what area is available. We don't smoke, but even we thought it was inconvenient. The front desk staff was very nice. Beach accessories are available to the quests at no charge; chairs, umbrellas, boogie boards even a surf board! A public parking garage is across the street for a fee ($30/day). If you're not looking for anything special and not going to be in the room much, this place can save you a lot of money.

I figured we were only staying one night, so we could deal with it, for the price, it should have come with a pillow for each occupant. Only 2 provided, and we had signed up as 3 guest. Asked for some and was told they couldn't find any. Finally got another one around 9 pm. Bathroom door wouldn't close, needs some work to be reasonable and expect you to pay 150 + per night.. I thought some were being too judgmental on the review, but I think I agree.

Despite looking rather old and being quite simple, the hotel is absolutely perfect in terms of cleanliness, location and staff friendliness. It's only a block and a half from the beach and close to all types of shops. There was a stove, microwave oven, toaster, kettle and kitchen appliances in the room, which might be very helpful for those who decide to stay longer and actually cook there.

The location was fantastic and staffs were very friendly. I also had great fun time with other guests and musicians at kani ka pila night. I want to come back again and dance with them. Only thing I might need to mention is that the street noise is a bit annoying because of the windows couldn’t tightly closed. But it’s rather not a big deal compared with all the good things.

Was not clean. Felt unsafe in the room AC did not work .hasn't been upgraded since the 80s . Cost way to much for what you get . Parking is horrible no SUVs, only place to park is at the Zoo . The only good thing they have is the location.

Great experience, clean room, friendly staff. Our room was on the smaller size and had a little traffic noise at night but not terrible - for the price, it was an incredible value and we were very happy with our stay!

Been staying here a long time. Great location! Close to the beach and the bus. Full kitchen. Alas, prices have gone up, so not the bargain it used to be. Everything changes! Local entertainment on Mon. nights. Great Kanikapila!

We first heard about the Royal Grove from Frommers back in 2006. This is a family owned retro hotel that’s all about ohana (family). Absolutely beloved by locals and hotel guests that keep coming back like us.

However owner really should pay up to clean the very dirty staff areas down the stairs. Some countries would close them down for this. They were even making food there. Owner family make loads of money. How can they ignore the below stairs dirt. Floor, tiles, yuck. Bet their home is very different. Staff were lovely despite this and location excellent and money saving.

Very handy location, so close to the beach, restaurant, shops etc... Really lovely staff.The pool was just being finished as we left, it looks great, wished we could have tried it!!! Ask for a room with a balcony given to the pool to avoid street noise on the other side.This is an old hotel so dont be too picky on the cleanliness and the style but it has just what you need.

This hotel is our home away from home. stayed here many times over, this is my first review on it. This hotel is retro Hawaii, it is older. BUT What this hotel lacks in stars they DEFINITELY make up for in hospitality. Our room was super clean. Beds comfortable. 2-3 minute walk to the beach. Monika at the front desk is the BEST!!! Her hospitality is one of the reasons we will definitely be booking this hotel again.

What can I say, but this was another great stay at our favorite home away from home in Waikiki!We arrived early, a couple hours before the guaranteed check-in time, and Monica was so genuinely nice, accommodating, and she was able to get us into a room early...this was SO VERY helpful for us so we could drop our luggage off, and start our drive around the island. (Thank you Monica!)The room has everything we need, and is always clean. We love the balcony, fridge, stove top, coffee pot, microwave, plates/utensils/glasses, hair dryer, bathroom amenities, etc. And they put in new larger HDTVs and upgraded their TV content...and the WiFi is now available in the guestrooms...and it is complimentary. And the WiFi works famously as we were able to steam movies on Netflix/Hulu.This hotel's location is only 5 minute walk, at most to the beach! And there are so many ABCs close by for food/shopping, and Mitsuwa/Whalers General are really close as well for any food item you might need.We Will be BACK!

If your looking for luxury then your in wrong place, luxury here costs a lot more than you pay for this hotel.If your looking at something well priced and in good access for Waikiki beach and safe then this is for you. Its literally across the road for the buses to pearl harbour (No 42 and 20 i believe) its a 3 minute walk to the beach and has food and drink availability around it.Wifi worked well in the room, this may be essential for many travellers and i can confirm it worked well for us.The pool was being refurbished, but why do you want a pool when waikiki beach is 3 minute walk away.The Beach location at this hotel is perfect for sunset photos, there is also a huge spectacular tree at the beach that comes alive with bird noise as sun sets. If you want to learn to Surf, then at the beach turn right and walk a few yards down and ask for Dave. This man does cheaper surf lessons than the ones next to him and a real good teacher. So room was clean but smelt a bit musky or damp, we sprayed some perfume around to make it better. Staff seem friendly and helpful.They phoned taxi for us to airport, Cost is around $30 -$40 each way, dependant on traffic. Shops in the area go from soverneirs to high end shopping and its all just one block away.So if your on a bit of a budget, need a hotel close to beach and many things like shops and buses, then this is perfect hotel.I am not sure if they improved wifi, but can confirm in December 2019 the Wifi worked perfectly in our room. Safe is at main deskHope this helps

We stayed here twice while on a stopover to Australia and it was adequate for that purposePros:Price Location short walk to beach and towels supplied.Great staff smiling and helpfulQuietCleanConsDated and a bit beat up...but what do you expect for the priceRooms vary...the first night our room was small and cramped and we would not want to stay any length of time in it.Second night on our return the room was bigger with a balcony overlooking courtyard .While I would not want to be based there for a week it was perfectly adequate for a couple of nights.This is a budget hotel so manage your expectations.
This place was a dump their pool was out of action and not notified before we arrived the fridge blocked half the bathroom door. So very tight squeeze doors didnt lock on balcony .Dont bother booking

To be honest, we arrived late so we were tired . We were actually worried about what our room would be like once we saw the front desk. Lighting was bad so it sure looked worse then it actually was but even in daylight it was not as nice as the pictures on the sight. The room was clean but lacked of care and love. And the furniture is very, very old, but not quaint old, more like cheap , rundown old! The fridge had been changed and was bigger then the space needed so it blocked 1/3 of the bathroom door. If, like me you get up in the dark to go pee..you would probably do what I did...walk right into it.The room is clean but the air conditioning unit definetly dad not been cleaned recently..Glad it was a one night thing because it was a bit depressing as first night ever in Honolulu..glad we had a condo rented the next day.It’s well situated and the people working there were nice. The pool is closed for reparations.

***I was awoken in the middle of the night by 2 men on my balcony very stealthily trying to get into my room***I have travelled extensively on my own and in all types of accomodation - I have never felt unsafe and am in no way super fussy - this is actually my first ever bad review. I was really excited about the retro look of the Royal Grove but this place is not safe and I highly recommend solo females not to stay here. Although I was offered another room and did receive a refund for my next 2 nights when I confirmed I would be leaving and asked for a refund, the staff didn’t seem all that shocked by the situation. This leads me to believe that this is not all that unusual here. If you have already booked here or are going to anyway, I would be asking for a high floor - but there is also a door beside the elevator in reception just left open 24/7 so.....It was worth the extra money spent to book somewhere else and get the hell out of there.

An older style hotel but kept clean and fresh by daily housekeeping. The staff are very friendly and eager to help travellers. Our room had a large refrigerator, microwave, stove and all the utensils. Its only a couple of minutes walk to Waikiki Beach where all of the hop on/off trolley buses stop. Also only minutes walk to restaurants, take out meals and bars. We stayed here for seven nights and will certainly book here on our next visit to Hawaii.

We like that and the location is great ...........we enjoyed our 6 days here.We were on the 5th floor in a corner room with a wrap around balcony and a glimpseOf the surfers in the ocean.We always had a breeze and the room was bright.Our room was large with a kitchen which was a real bonus and had all other necessities to make our stay comfortable.The lift was next door but not at all noisey.The pool seemed very popular although we didn't use it.Wifi was only available downstairs but at the time of our stay it was being installed in all rooms.Only a 5 minute direct walk to Waikiki Beach and all the action, surrounded by eating places and bars we thought it was very good value for Waikiki.The staff were very pleasant and very helpful.We would definately stay again.

I recommend this reasonable priced hotel, to customers looking for a great location, with kitchens, air conditioning, and a lovely Hawaiian musical program. Staff was great, room was clean, and it was reasonably priced. Mr. Fong, the owner, & his son were also in attendance at the Hawaiian program. I'll return again.

The hotel changed price after I arrived. Also, I only could use wifi at the front. I expected that I can use wifi from room. I didn't get any bad experiences besides those two. I'm not sure that I'm going to use this hotel next time though.

We only stayed one night due to a special event in Honolulu. The room met our needs - a place to sleep and an effective air conditioner. It is definitely an older property, and paint and bathroom grout could use a freshening. Still for the price, it was OK.

everything was fine it served our purpose for our stay it seamed to be close to everything the room was all it needed to be slept fine was quiet internet worked fine as good as at home maybe even faster thank you

Rooms aren’t amazing and a lot is in the original state, which is cute. But it’s much cheaper than other hotels so you get what you pay for. It’s clean just a bit run down. We would recommend staying for sure though if your not worried about old/dated rooms as the position and price is great. The pool is an oval simple one and missing tiles but they have boogie boards, chairs, balls etc to use for the pool/beach

This is a 2-star hotel, so don't except too much in the way of service or amenities, but it is good value for money and in a great location. For example there is no restaurant but there are plenty nearby in a wide range of levels.

This Hotel should be shut down as it is completely dirty and run down. Everything in the room was dirty including linen on beds. Hairs in beds. Mildew in bathroom. Kitchen area dirty and cupboards broken. Carpets and floors dirty. Old Bra hanging in closet. So bad that we did not even stay at all.

It is right in the heart of waikiki! Very convenient. Everyone that works at the front desk, especially Brigetta, were super helpful... they would advise you in the best way possible to have a great time on the island. Good price. Value for money. I would definitely book the same place if I would visited waikiki again..

While older than some hotels, the amenities were perfectly acceptable. The staff was friendly and responsive. The ability to cook our own meals was a God send! Check with your air carrier about bringing an ice chest (I wish I had known!) because food even at the grocery on the island is more expensive than you'll find at home!

Don't expect too much but you will be rewarded for staying. Clean tidy rooms furnishing maybe outdated but comfortable.A great little gem in the middle of Waikiki's towering apartment buildingsLocation perfect walking distance to all Waikiki attractions.

We saw the pictures and reviews before booking this place. We understood it was a lower end hotel. But, upon arriving, it was much worse. First, the room had rust colored mold along the electrical wiring covers (see photos). Second, the locks on the door were a issue. We were handed a physical brass key and the room had three locks on the inside. We had a chain lock, a door knob lock, and a door stopper that we felt the need to secure on the backside. There was two signs in our room, one near the door and one above the bathroom that read "DO NOT LEAVE ANY VALUABLES IN ROOM SAFE DEPOSIT BOXES AT FRONT DESK". Which is not inspiring to safety. The bathroom was tiny, without a vanity and a broken toilet. After one use the toilet would not flush and the chain was still attached inside the tank. We then sat down and started looking for a new hotel. When we went downstairs to cancel our reservation, the staff was not phased at all. Which leads me to assume, this happens all the time. Please save your money and book a place that has better accommodations with a key card locking system. Good Luck.

If you are looking for new and flash, this is not the hotel. If you are open to the old Hawaii of the 50's and 60's then this place is super cool. Unpretentious and helpful staff. Location is a 2 minute walk to Waikiki Beach. Lots of shops, restaurants within steps. Rooms are not perfect, but they are clean and neat. Overall, for the price this place is Excellent.

The good days of this place are long gone. The rooms are old and disgruntled, you even need a broom stick to secure the window closing. At all times they are warning you to leave nothing even medianly valuable in the room, which is made us feel really unsafe. There is no wifi in the rooms, need to go down to reception to connect. The infrastructure is old, cracks in the wall, cockroaches, etc. It does not have parking facilities, so if you have a car you must spend $30 per day on the parking lot across the street. Beach towels are sparse, VERY slow in coming (mid morning), and at times incomplete ("sorry we just have two, not three"). On the good side, the place is very well located, a block from Waikiki beach, have plenty of beach toys left by other guests (boards, umbrellas, etc.).

Do you want to go to Hawaii and see old vintage Hawaii? This is the place. They have a music night and it isn't paid musicians, it is locals jamming to Hawaiian music. I didn't know any of the music, but it was definitely obvious that they were doing it for the love of their music. You could go anywhere in town and see a paid performance, but it would NOT be the same. I chose to stay here because I was solo traveling so trying to keep costs as low as possible. I chose it for the location. I knew it would NOT be fancy. With that said, it was a place that had a lot of charm. The location is VERY close to the beach. Not just any beach, THE BEACH of beaches. There are restaurants and shopping to cater to all budgets within very close proximity. The place was clean and had charm. The hotel wifi is in the lobby.

This is an older building, but the room was very clean and all the utilities worked well. All the staff were very friendly and helpful at any time. Construction works across the road was noisy during the day, but completely outside the hotel’s control - all the more reason to tour the island!

We stayed for 5 nights before our cruise.Barely 5min walk to the beach. ABC on every corner. TRY the BBQ next door. Delicious! Huge shareable portions. Bus on the corner.Everything close by!Small TV in room. Hot water was hit or miss.This is a very dated hotel in need of TLC, but clean, friendly staff.Construction going on in front so bring ear plugs!Bed pretty comfy. Thin sheets and towels.Our room had a new heat/air conditioning which worked very well and no noise.Room had new carpet. Had fridge, microwave, dishes. No dish soap. Housekeeping doesnt do the dishes.No blow dryer.Wifi only at front desk area so a pain as you always have to go down if you just want something quick.Pool missing a lot of tiles, but the water was perfectly clear.Toilet was noisy. Room was cleaned every day.Monday night local musicians play in the foyer. No elevator to our room.We got a ridiculous price for 5 nights so we put up with the quirks!

This place is awesome Inexpensive, 2 block walk to beach, beach chairs available, and awesome entertainment on Monday. Second yr of staying here Can't beat it. Kitchenettes are fully equipped. Ac works well. Flat screen with good amount of channels. All electronics work in room but have to be in lobby for wifi to work.

We enjoyed our studio with two beds and kitchenette. Our first room was a corner with a wonderful ocean view, but my travel partner was bothered by the noise of the street construction out front (now completed) so we moved to the back, overlooking the pool. No view, and no direct sun, if that is important to you.We used the in suite kitchen daily - there is the Food Pantry a block away to purchase meal fixings, and the pineapple chop shop is just around the corner. Lots of fresh papaya and pineapple, so the fridge and kitchen were valued. Morning coffee on the balcony was a great start to our days.Easy walking to the shopping mecca, and lots of restaurants are 5 to 10 minutes away. The Bus is right at the corner.The pool noodles and beach towels are available on the main floor for beach use, as are surf and boogie boards.The hula night filled the library area with both traditional and modern hula and songs. A friendly and welcoming atmosphere. The Royal Grove is looking a bit dowdy, but our room was clean and overall the cleanliness of the interior was acceptable. We arrived just as the new management team was taking charge. We have booked our stay for this fall, and will update our review.

We booked the hotel online as there was no resort fee and it was a cheaper place to stay before our flight home.The hotel is small and only 5 storeys high, so instantly you are given a warm homely feeling. The staff are very welcoming and helpful. They helped us find the cheapest way to keep our room for the following day before our midnight flight (Turns out booking another night on expedia was cheaper than the day rate.)The room was very clean, and had a small kitchenette. No view from the room, but the wonderful pool and patio area made up for this. There are beach (boogie boards, buckets and spades, folding chairs and parasols) available to take with you to the beach, at no extra cost.I would definitely stay here again should we return to Honolulu, you are only a block from the beach and a couple of blocks from the international mall (if shopping is your thing).It's definitely not as swanky as some of the hotels, but has a way better atmosphere for this.

As a long time guest for many years I've found Royal Grove a comfort and place of the familiar. Recent NEW Management has made changes and attempted to spiff up the lobby. Removing weekly rates and increasing prices too which is making it no longer a good value for the price. Location is now the only selling point. Short timers seem to be their target audience these days. I miss seeing many of the snow birds that called RG home for many years. Its always a clean with KIND staff. The vent from the restaurant on the ground floor vibrates along the wall to the roof making it an automatic alarm clock at 530am with NO snooze button. Its still a great place if they'll review room rates or tell price themselves out of the market...it's just an old worn out hotel with lots of character and good memories for me!Robert

This is the place for fun. It cost us less than $100 a night. The tiles were falling off the wall of the pool but the rooms were clean and they made sure everything worked. We walked to Waikiki and spent long wonderful days there in the sun. We also used our senior bus passes to travel throughout Oahu day after day. This was a dream vacation and very reasonable.

The hotel looks like an old converted apartment complex. It is old and a little nostalgic. I got a studio, it was fine by me. Don't expect anything too high and you won't get disappointed. It is very close to Waikiki beach and next door to the Hyatt, from where they do a lot of pickups for tours, so that was great.

Check-in was swift and very welcoming. It is convenirntly located about a 5 minute walk from the beach and a central location to shopping and restaurants. Yes this means you are near a busy a noisy street, so without an AC room your open window will let in all the city noise during the day. The facilities are quite old and run down but relatively well kept. I booked the superior studio which is much tinier than I expected, it is essentially the size of a small bedroom with a bathroom attached. For one traveller it may be good, for 2 a bit cramped. Although the room was RELATIVELY clean, on a scale of 1-10 for cleanliness I would give it a 7.5. Lost points because the furniture was worn, the box spring and bed sheets had old stains on them, there were moldy ice trays in the mini fridge, some old dirt behind the sink handles, the terrace fence was broken, and mold spots on the shower curtain. Overall it is a decent hotel if you get a good price, want a great location, and dont mind the worn condition. My advice is look for a bargain for a bigger "deluxe" room.

Let me first say, that I didn’t have much time to research this last minute trip and needed more budget accommodations for our one night in Honolulu. I regret that deeply. First of all, I booked a room without an AC which was my fault for booking too quickly and the front desk staff was happy to accommodate if we needed AC. They did have 2 wall fans which we decided would be fine. I was prepared for “run down” and “budget” but not prepared for dirty and dingy. The place was just not clean. The trash cans in the hallway were overflowing. The pool was NOT what the pics looked like and appeared to have green algae/slime on the walls. The room towels were stained and two were just dirty. The sheets were thin and stained and the pillows were not much more than sleeping without one. The shower curtain was ripped up and dirt on the shower and curtain. Hair was in the sink and shower as well as crumbs on the chairs in the main area. Dirt and dust was caked on the baseboard and around the furniture. There is NO parking at the facility and having to pay $30 to park across the street in a tiny garage was very inconvenient. The staff there was VERY friendly and accommodating but in no way could have made up for the dirty, ill-kept room.

I personally have never stayed here. But I wanted to point out that on Monday evenings starting at 7pm a jam session takes place by local musicians. In addition to listening to great music, there is hula dancing by both men and women. And everyone gets into a circle and sings a song when the performances end. My husband and I are always welcome to stop in. The location is great for walking around Waikiki. The bus stop is a short walk away.

We stayed at the Royal Grove for 8 days this November, and we are complete fans of this amazing little hotel. The staff are some of the friendliest we have met in our travels and really contributed to this being our favourite trip yet. The hotel is very kitschy and has lots of character. If you are looking for the blandness of corporate hotels then you may not be as happy as we are with this lodging. The Royal Grove fosters a strong sense of community - one we have not experienced in our travels to date. There is a music night (think it was Wednesday) that is a lot of fun. We just missed the American Thanksgiving potluck that was taking place on Sunday night, but looked like a good time. The hotel is spotless - the cleaning staff are among the best there is, and friendly. The rooms are quite big - they are the old style rooms, reminiscent of a time gone by. The lanais are nice size with a full kitchen in most of them. The water pressure in the shower is great - really strong, and the bed is comfortable. Wi-fi is available in the lobby, which is a bonus because when you are in the lobby on your laptop or phone, you are also interacting with the residents of the hotel. Even the laundry room is a social space and connected to the pool/social area. It is so much fun it is hard to describe. Support this small, independent business and book early. This place is not a hidden gem; it is well discovered so you need to plan ahead if you want to stay here. We will also point out you are 2 blocks from one of the best parts of Waikiki Beach, and there are many restaurants and places for coffee near by, including an ABC store 1/2 block from the entrance. Highest rating for the Royal Grove, and a special thank you to the front desk staff - I'll likely spell this wrong, but Battita (apologies if we got that wrong), the hard working Scottish lady we had the pleasure of getting to know a little bit on the front desk. Thank you for making our stay fantastic.

has been a great hotel for us in the past ,have stayed probably 6 times or more,next year in september we are planning a family vacation and will need 8 or nine rooms,but the online booking has me baffled and the rates are increased.any comment there jerry l.

I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. We visited Hawaii the second week of September and stayed for a full 7 days. I would not recommend anyone stay anywhere but here. The two main factors were location and price, however everything else about our stay was excellent as well.If you’re the kind of person who plans to spend most of their vacation on Waikiki Beach and at the hotel itself, you may want to look elsewhere. However, for our purposes, this hotel was perfect. We had a large, clean room with a full kitchenette (oven, stove, microwave, toaster, full fridge, and plenty of cooking and eating utensils) and a balcony with a view of the ocean for under $650 for the week, which is ridiculous compared to other hotels in the area. We easily made breakfast in the mornings and ate on the balcony before heading out for the day. Royal Grove is just a two-block walk from Waikiki Beach, and very close to plenty of shopping, convenience stores, and restaurants. The hotel is also just a couple blocks from bus stop. To add further convenience, there are beach towels and accessories (floaties, noodles, chairs, etc.) you are able to use for the day and return (at no additional charge). Our sleep quality was good; there is a little bit of noise from the street, but you are in a city so it’s to be expected. The air conditioning worked well. The staff was helpful and polite, and other guests were pleasant as well. The only downside might be the lack of WiFi except for in the lobby, but who comes to Hawaii to sit on their computer/phone? The hotel is a little older, but we found it more charming than anything, the pink building reminiscent of old Hawaii. I feel like my review really can’t do this hotel justice, as it was exactly what we were looking for and turned out to be such a hidden gem. If we ever visit Honolulu in the future, we will definitely stay again!As an extra tip, if you are renting a vehicle, look for free overnight parking (after 6PM and before 7AM) at the metered streets over near the Honolulu Zoo. We utilized this during our stay, and it was wonderful compared to spending $30+ per night parking in a lot or garage.

Stayed 7 8 nights in June, our first time here but not the last. Spent most mornings at the Waikiki beach and explored by bus in the afternoon. The bus is 50 metres and the beach 5minutes. We had a room above the Korean BBQ, small kitchen spare bed no balcony or a/con. Great value booked direct on hotel website , good discount for 7 days or more. Nice pool, friendly people from all over the world.

The royal grove is an awesome old school hotel tucked away surrounded by modern plastic apartment buildings and hotels. If you want the real Waikiki of days gone past oozing with aloha spirit and genuinely friendly staff - this is the place for you!Just one block back from the beach with its own fresh water pool and clean yet simple family rooms with multiple bedrooms for parents and kids to all have their own space and full kitchen facilities and huge fridge - it’s awesome!Very highly recommended for people wanting to experience the genuine Hawaii of times gone past! And you won’t beat the awesome value either! Mahalo!

I stayed at this cozy hotel for the 3rd time last April 2018.I really enjoy its Hawaiian atmosphere !It is old but well maintained and clean. Just 1 1/2 block walk to Waikiki Beach.Walking distance to many restaurants, stores, food trucks, Market, malls. You name it !My room was really large with 2 lanais (balconies), one double bed and one single bed. The kitchen has everything one needs to prepare meals.The bathroom is good with a nice shower.No wi-fi in the room, only at the Front Desk area where the living room is. That´s where you mingle with other guests !!! I love it !There is a laundry for guests to use for a minimal fee. Very convenient.The Front Desk staff is absolutely wonderful, friendly, smiling, helpful (they do go beyond the limit) Thank you Debbie, Donna and Karen !If you stay a minimum of 7 nights there is a special rate. You can only book your room through its website.Most guests keep coming for decades !!! For me, it is a home away from home, indeed !Once a week the owner gives an evening party for the guests. He has a band and some hula dancers perform and teach the guests how to dance.it. I never miss it ! Thanks Caroline !If you want to stay in a nice place but not paying a fortune, that´s the place for you.Location and rates are unbeatable.I will definitely be back !!

As everyone knows,I love the Waikiki Prince, but eith them still not reopen,I stayed at the royal grove this year.I hate to not be loyal but I liked this one just a bit better. Full size appliances in kitchen,full size coffeemaker,laundry more convient. The only draw back was no WiFi in arms. Also 24/7 front desk. Same price.

Love this hotel. Four wonderful factors:a) Fun, family-oriented and authentic (Monday nights are such fun!)b) Location to Kuhio Beach -- just two blocks/five minutesc) Amenities -- comes with kitchenette and refrigerator, which is great since the only grocery store in all of Waikiki is only about a 7-minute walk from the hotel and we love to purchase fresh pineapple, breakfast foods, and salads to enjoy at our convenienced) Fantastic rates, particularly when you stay for a week or longer.Plus they have beach chairs, umbrellas and such you can borrow. We often pick up dinner to go at the delicious take-out place next door and bring it back up to the room/patio to enjoy. There's internet in the main lobby (but honestly I enjoy mostly being away from that when on vacation). Finally, with the great location it's a short walk to many wonderful places in Waikiki Beach, including the Starbucks Reserve (maybe 10 strolling minutes away)!Love coming here!

I rented a class 3 room as I figured I would only be there for sleeping. Good room, the rates are a bonus and the bed were comfortable. I did spend more time in the room in the evenings \, very nice experience. I will be going back this August for 10 days in the class 3 rooms. Easy access to the Bus and all of the good places to eat. I had a late evening flight and they allowed me to check out late with no extra cost. The staff is great. I really loved the 60's feel

My wife and I have travelled widely for a great many years and shortly will be staying for the 5th or 6th time at our Pink Palace  It is and has been over the years the hi light of our travels——the whole experience is a delight.Thank you Royal Grove and staff——also fellow guests  Allen Moore

We last stayed at the Royal Grove in April, 2016 (reviewed it at the time). Returning earlier this month (for one week) was like coming home. The Royal Grove, in our view, is still the best deal in Honolulu--the prices haven't changed since we were last there and the rooms are just as clean and neat as we left them two years ago.Part of that is has to do with their clientele, who tend to be older and not inclined to partying. And part of it is because of the exceptional housekeeping service by people like Besita, who, like everything else at the Royal Grove, is reliable, dependable, and always courteous to guests who need an extra bar of soap or roll of toilet paper! We were lucky to have the same room we had during our original visit in 2016--Room 506--and it was just as neat and clean this time around. The lanai (patio) still provides both great tropical bird sightings and views of Waikiki (both street side and ocean). Now for a reality check re: amenities: There are few. And the bathroom is small--very small. There is no fan, so the humidity tends to build-up and leave clothing hung in the adjacent closet a bit damp. The bathroom fixtures are small--do not expect a huge shower (although since we were last there, they have installed a handheld shower head which is convenient for those want to shampoo their hair or just rinse off sand) or sink area. Water pressure leaves a bit to be desired--but given there are probably close to 100,000 people showering every morning in the hotels that line Waikiki, that may be more typical than specific to the Royal Grove. The beds were basic, but comfortable And the kitchenette is great for dining in after shopping at the nearby Farmer's Market (M-W-F-Sat, 4-9 p.m.) or grabbing carry-out from one of the many neighborhood eateries.The air conditioner tended to shut off automatically, which was a bit of a problem because noisy garbage trucks roll down Waikiki around 6:30 a.m., and without any white noise to block out the trucks--well, consider the garbage caravan your alarm clock and make the most of the day! For whatever amenities it may lack,The Royal Grove more than makes up with vintage charm, a quirky personality, and extremely budget-friendly prices.

We stayed at the Royal Grove for the first time in April 2018.There were no surprises, and we knew what we were signing up for before booking a room there.As others have said, it is vintage 60's/70's in decor, and we were okay about that.The location is excellent, 2 blocks to the beach, with many dining and shopping options close by. We had a street facing room on the 5th floor with an L shaped balcony that had a large table and 2 chairs. We used it every day to have coffee in the morning and a cold drink at night to review our day. It had a view all the way down to the beach. We are city people, and live downtown, so street noise is not a big deal for us. The air conditioner was loud though. It did keep the room comfortable for sleeping.There was a kitchenette, with large fridge and utensils that we used several times. The pool area is convenient, and even the pool itself was perfect to cool off as you sun yourself in one of the many seats around the pool.Wi-fi is available, but only in the lobby/pool area. I do wish it was usable in the room.The only real negative is no room safe. They use an archaic bank safety deposit box which doesn't hold much. So I had to take my expensive camera with me most of the time, even when I didn't want to.The staff were very friendly, and helpful. Other hotels could learn a great deal from them about customer service.Best of all, no resort fees.We would stay at the Royal Grove when we return to Waikiki without any hesitation.

We didn't want generic, tower block, I could be anywhere in the world accommodation. We wanted Waikiki or what's left of it and here it is. The salmon pink building is straight out of the 50s/60s. The hotel lobby is cluttered with artefacts from another era, like my old Nan's sitting room. The welcome's personal, we're treated like old friends although it's our first time there. The room's a good size with a kitchenette, oversized fridge and a slightly cramped bathroom. It's 70s/80s decoration. We've got a balcony (lannai) with a table and 2 chairs. It's looks down on the pool and other guests sunning it. The bed's a bit small but comfortable. It's a 50 metre walk to Waikiki beach. There's a Mexican cantina on the corner, a Japanese eat-in/ takeaway opposite, a Korean next door and a Poke place on the corner. The Bus can be caught 50 metres away on Kuhio St. All this and it's about A$100 a night. Oh and the Monday night performance including hula dancing is a bonus.

We stayed for almost two weeks but at a condo across the street that they owned in a more upscale hotel with rooftop amenities that included a hot tube and gorgeous outlook of the Waikiki harbour. If you are looking for the five star experience - look else where- but if you want an affordable, friendly, and retro experience - this is the place.

I've stayed with my family at the Royal Grove Hotel twice and have nothing but positive things to say about the hotel. For the price of staying at another hotel mere footsteps two nights, you can stay at the Royal Grove for a week. Rooms are cozy and have kitchenettes to reduce your food bills while in Waikiki. Staff are excellent and the location is only two minutes by foot from the beach. I will definitely be back in the future.

This was our second time staying here and will stay here again. We stayed in a higher floor. For a budget family run hotel, you can't go wrong. Staff are very pleasant, even security was available when we heard a domestic issue happening next door. Unfortunately the full size fridge was a bit close to the door, but the layout of each room is slightly different, otherwise we had no complaints. Make sure you put your requests in at time of booking (aircon, queen bed, non smoking etc) otherwise it will be a lucky dip on what you get. I will say, the TV's still need updating (still on old box tv's). The best part about the location is it's only a short walk to waikiki beach and kalakaua avenue (the main strip of shops and tourists). There is no parking available, but you can park at the waikiki banyon for $20 per night (we scored a weekly pass for $80).If you after cheap and cozy, this is the place for you ($550 per week). If you're after over priced opulence, try the marriot or hilton.

A friend and myself stayed here for a week and had a wonderful time. The staff was very helpful and answered all of our questions. We stayed in room #325 and we had a good breeze with the windows open. Barb helped me find the right bus and the other guest are very friendly. It's a short walk to the beach and shopping. I will be going back this next year and I think I will stay for two weeks. The rates can't be beat. If you want a true Hawaiian Vacation, stay here. G.D. Bennett Portland Oregon

Not cold,clinical, white, like many of the big name chain hotels. This place has a comfortable homeyness about it. Very friendly, helpful, people and a location just two blocks off the beach makes it perfect for us. Lots of shopping and good food within easy walking distance.

We had a wonderful two weeks in what must be the best bargain for accommodation in Waikiki. It is a hotel without pretensions but with great heart and a family feeling. It is not at all fancy but it has all one needs. It has kitchenettes for cooking, lanais, a courtyard with a pool, a location close to the beach as well as the only decent-sized food store in Waikiki. The staff are friendly and helpful. Beach chairs and other equipment are available for use by guests. On the two Monday nights we were there, there was Hawaiian entertainment in the lobby with singers, useless, percussion and hula dancers. What fun!

Location: The hotel is only 2-3 minutes away from Waikiki Beach and there are several ABC stores in the vicinity to buy food, drinks and other necessities. For car rental needs there is a car rental nearby as well as an Alamo around the corner. Perfect location.Rooms: The rooms are pretty old-fashioned and very basic but generally clean. I started out in a room without AC but this option was not feasible in the heat so I changed to a room with AC. The mattress was pretty soft so I had some problems sleeping as I prefer harder mattresses and the air in my room was pretty stuffy and warm as soon as I turned of the AC, but for the price compared to other hotels in Waikiki that was acceptable to me. Booking this hotel I knew I wouldn't get any luxury.Staff: Hit or miss. Some of them were absolutely great and lovely, others not at all. Still, if I had any questions I always got a proper answer.Loved the option to wash my clothes in the laundry for a good price and the beach towels to use.If you're on a budget this hotel is a good choice in a good location, would book again!

Booked in for four nights was surprised how clean the room was and the best of all was the bed a great nights sleep kitchen was clean and had a coffe maker had a room on the top floor no noise facing the pool a good choice

Stayed here & is one of the worst places I have stayed in. It was not presented as the brochure claims rooms where sub stand, dirty & manager not a very pleasant person.Would not recommend this as a holiday accommodation destination

Read about it in lonely planet guidebook and also read review from trip advisor. Exactly as advertised. Not exactly modern but have all the amenities required. Slightly cheaper rate if book 7 nights, only 2-3 mins walk to beach. Accomodating as arrived early in the morning, contacted the hotel 2 weeks prior to arrival to ask if I could leave bag before check in time, and was told I could check in early if room is available. Old world charm when I got a receipt at check out that was typed on a typewriter!!!

All we wanted was a clean safe place to stay and we got what we asked for! The hotel is a little outdated and nothing fancy BUT it's clean the staff are very friendly and it's very close to the beach. All that for a very cheap price per night too. There is no parking at the hotel but there is one just a short walk away and costs us 80 dollars for a week. I highly recommend this place if you are on a budget and want to be close to most things! We will be back for sure <3

We had an 8-day holiday in this hotel just 2 blocks from the beach. It is old world but clean and very friendly and helpful staff. The pool was a nice place to cool off in the heat of the day, if we weren't out doing other things. The room was a good size with cooking facilities, oven, frig, microwave and sink so we could self cater if we weren't enjoying one of the many eateries nearby. Monday evening was music evening and thoroughly enjoyable.

Attended with a bunch of friends playing at the annual ukulele festival. Very family-run style hotel quite old and tired but more than adequate particularly if on a budget, and only one block from the Duke statue. Front desk friendly and always helpful. Great Kanikapila on Monday evening with Mr Fong and friends.

Our room was basic but had everything we needed. The beds were comfortable. The air conditioning was quiet and worked well. We made use of the cooking facilities while we were there and these were adequate.The staff were very friendly and helpful but the best part of the stay was the location. This hotel is 1 block from the beach - grab a towel and some beach chairs provided by the hotel and go and relax on Waikiki beach or dip into the warm ocean. Very convenient for buses and shops.This hotel does not have any parking facilities and parking can be very expensive in the surrounding car parks, so leave your car home.

What can I say? Four generations of my family have stayed at the Royal Grove. Yes it is older, smaller, and doesn't have wifi in your room. It's not the Hyatt. Doesn't have Hyatt prices either. What it does have is friendly staff, clean rooms with all the needed cooking essentials, and great prices. People return year after year to this hotel. That says something.The atmosphere has a home town feel to it. Don't run to the nearest ABC store to buy a beach chair, book or floatie. These are all available at the hotel, free of charge, as departing guests leave these items for others to use. Concerning that wifi: it is available free of charge in the hotel lobby. We used this but also used roaming wifi from Rogers at $5.00 per day for convenience at times.Kudos to Donna, Debbie (front desk) and Nelson (maintenance man) for their friendly helpful service!

Everything about the place is straight from the 1960's. The furniture, the decor and the tired old bathrooms. It is however, only one block away from Waikiki beach though which is its only redeeming feature.

This was my first time to Hawaii, and if I based it on my experience at this place it would be my last. Where do I start, well, you get what you pay for and buyer beware. $70.00 a night rooms should have been my first clue. But I was assured that the people were "really nice". No, not at all. In fact we were told to go to bed at 9 pm, yes I am telling you the truth. So, we upgraded after taking a lot of sleep aids the first night so we could sleep in our room. It was going to cost $100.00 more a week. Why you ask, I'm guessing to cover the costs of me requesting the room be cleaned and the tub and toilet be un plugged, the grease, dirt and grime be cleaned out of the vents and toilet paper. As for friendly, if it's being based on the lady that I asked some questions in regards to navigating the area, that's just plain BS, she had a hard time giving information because she "bought the place 40 years ago and had no need for information". OK, well you also haven't used a paint brush, passed an health code or updated the technical services in 40 years either. And did I tell you that they told us to go to bed, twice, at 9pm. No lie. But on the plus side, there is no shortage of Drug Dealers within an arms throw, bikers making sure the business across the street is running well, sirens, yelling (not happy vacationers coming home kind) and screaming right out your window. The cleaning and sheets are a joke, I guess they don't know about black mold and assume it is just another foliage in the room. The beds are not beds, they are pads with metal support clearly visible so you know that they are there. And did I mention the managers/owners/front desk attendants, no, because you get a better reception from the Dealers and Homeless that are right out front. Don't bother with a laptop the signal is weak at best. TV is a "reto" tv with lots of News stations. No toiletries, the hand soap is a throw back to the white bars that were hip before the hotel was built and be prepared to ask for toilet paper. The staff were quite annoyed to have anyone there. Except the return guests that have been returning since woodstock and go to bed regularly at 9pm. So, take your $70.00 per night parlay it into a few more bucks and go the the Outrigger down the road and really enjoy the Hawaiian experience. That place is worth every penny.

Comfortable beds in a great budget hotel in an expensive city. The front desk and staff are very very nice and helpful. I stayed march 11th till the 28th of this year for my 2nd time to this hotel and 6th time to Oahu. The kitchenette was wonderful and had plenty of utensils, pots and pans, a toaster and a coffee maker a full fridge and nice oven and sink and plenty of counter space to make your own food and save money. A good microwave also. A glass table with a couple of chairs to chill out. I was in room 222 and it was fine. No air conditioner in my room which I had a choice to save some money and the fan was fine for me since I like the warm weather myself. The shower was good and there was a closet in the bathroom and hangers to put clothes on. The TV was on a dresser with extra pillows and blankets and plenty of space to put your clothes. There is an elevator and a big lobby with couches to chill out and the wifi works in the lobby only not in the room but I only was in the room to sleep and shower since there is SO MUCH to do on this island. I have been to 4 islands in Hawaii and each one has its own personality. Waikiki is very nice but you can explore the island by car or bus and if you do some research you can find some good bargains on car rentals. there is no parking lot but they will refer you to the Waikiki banyan which the price is 20 a day or 180 a month but to get the monthly rate you must do that at the office on a weekday 9-5 and Saturday is tricky since the office closes by 11am and on that day sometimes they close early or the one person who works that day might step out of the office, so I recommend doing it Monday thru Friday. anyway the hotel is an older hotel and smaller then most in this city but its well worth it to stay here. A great neighborhood and so much to do in this city and the north shore is an hour away and its so pretty there. Explore the east coast with Hanauma bay for great snorkeling & makapuu beach for fun waves in the winter which is about 20-25 minutes away and is one of the most beautiful beaches on the island and Waimanalo beach is just amazing also and is ten minutes north of makapuu. just remember there is traffic at rush hour most days. . There are so many beaches on this island on the west and east, south and north shores. Explore this island because it is amazing! I highly recommend this wonderful hotel and I hope to get back one day soon. Oh the pool is small but cute and nice chairs to relax there.

It's my home. I feel like home there. It's not the best place and not the worst. I just feel like home in Royal Grove and that's it. Not a lot of people like it and other people, like me, feel like home there. You need to try or maybe not. It's my secret, my place, my ohana ! Aloha

This isn't a high-budget, posh location. But what Royal Grove lacks in hotel chain amenities, it more than makes up in old Hawaii charm and prices that allow you to spend more on entertainment or to stay longer! Rooms are spacious, clean and comfortable. Location is super convenient, two blocks from the beach!

I spent 6 nights at the Royal Grove Hotel recently while vacationing in Waikiki. There were a few things that really appealed to me about this hotel. First of all, my room was only $70 a night. Secondly, it's a small hotel (compared to most of the other hotels in Waikiki). Third, it's family owned which I feel gives it more of a personal touch. I was pleasantly surprised when I saw that my room had a kitchenette with a stove, full sized refrigerator, microwave, toaster and a coffee maker. I was able to eat breakfast every morning in my hotel room rather than spend money eating at a restaurant. The staff at the desk were very friendly and helpful in giving me directions to several places, since I didn't know my way around the area at all. The hotel is only about 2-3 blocks from Waikiki Beach and also within walking distance to the zoo and the aquarium. It's also a few blocks away from a supermarket. On Monday nights, the hotel has a music jam with local musicians, and hula dancers. I do have one piece of advice though, ask for a room with a/c. My room had a ceiling fan and another fan that sat on a table and I was still hot much of the time. But other than that, I enjoyed my stay. Another plus was a couple of the nearby hotels have farmers markets a few evenings a week with very fresh, delicious, inexpensive food.

We love it here! This year all the guests got together and had a potluck Thanksgiving meal, what fun. We love the music/hula sing along too. The staff are friendly and we appreciate how close we are to the beach. The Royal Grove is one of the last true gems left in Oahu. We cannot wait to return.

Every time I go to Hawai'i, I stay here. I've been four times to the Royal Grove. It is family owned and operated. Now, if you are looking for 5 star, this is not your place. Maid service is twice a week. Rooms are spacious and have small kitchenette with fridge, stove, microwave, sink, and your dishes. You can't beat the price for a 7 day stay of just over $500. Pool is very nice and the staff is so friendly. They also have jam session of Hawaiian music and hula. Two blocks away from the ocean. Ask for an interior room on an upper floor. The city noise can get to you if you are on the outside, All suites are on the outside, but we stayed and as long as we left the slider closed, we didn't have too much trouble with noise. My sister passed away in 2014 and in 2015 my family went and I laid some of her ashes there at Royal Grove. She loved staying at this quaint hotel. Many places are within walking distance with shops and diners close by. If you rent a car, you will have to park in a parking garage nearby by. No on street parking available for 24 hours. Maximum is 2 hour meter fed parking .

We are delighted to stay in this back to the 60s hotel. If you love 5star hotels this is not your place but for Value, convenience, and hospitality you can't beat the Royal Grove we look forward to returning sooner then later

When my wife and I were planning our trip for the Waikiki Rough Water Swim ocean race on Labor Day, we asked a friend who works for United Airlines for lodging suggestions. Her number one choice, for personal travel to Waikiki, was the Royal Grove. I then read all the great reviews fellow travelers wrote. Now, having stayed in the hotel for 3 nights - we enjoyed the most excellent no-frills vibe, the perfect location, the friendly staff and regular guests - we agree with all the reviewers. Especially for our active weekend - we were always in the water, on the beach, or just out and about - the Royal Grove had everything we would need. I even enjoyed siesta by the pool side on a couple of occasions. And yes, the sweetest part of the stay was the Monday night community music night. We really enjoyed being in the audience. All in all, we knew what to expect and really appreciated the best deal for lodging around Waikiki.

View from my lania!! Love this placeSuch friendly staff! It's a three star in my book! Two blocks off of Kalakakau!! It's my second stay and it's better than last year! It's older hotel but has such lovely charm! Stay away it's mine lol!!

It's difficult to write a review when all you are doing is rehashing what everyone else has already said, but that is all I can do for the Royal Grove. Thirty-plus stories? Panoramic view? Bright, shiny, sparkling new? Fancy restaurant? Concierge? None of the above.So why stay here? Because it's a throw-back to the way things used to be. It's family-owned - no faceless corporations here. It's clean. It's comfortable (not that you'll be in your room much, except to sleep). The a/c works, and it's quiet. There's a pool, if you don't want to swim in the ocean. Some rooms have kitchenettes, so if you're on a tight budget or just get tired of eating out every night, you can eat in. Beach towels and mats are available, and beach toys can be borrowed. There is a Hawaiian music jam Monday evening which is worth attending.Location, near the east end of Waikiki, is excellent. Kuhio Beach Park is a five-minute stroll. TheBus is only two minutes away, and you are close enough to the end of the route that you will probably get a seat and not have to stand all the way to Ala Moana. Waikiki Trolley stops nearby. ABC store one minute away. Other convenience store and Korean barbecue restaurant in the building.The staff are excellent, very friendly and most helpful. No wifi in the rooms, but it's available in the lobby, where it is free and fast. No "resort fee" covering a bunch of stuff you won't use. You'll meet and talk to other guests.Maybe that's what it's all about - family. Ohana.

I stayed at the Royal Grove from October 7-14. This hotel is a hidden gem. Okay , so it's dated . This hotel is clean , the linens are clean , full size fridge very clean , oven clean . The bathroom was small but clean. There was an outdated larger tv , it worked. The pool was clean , they had towels for you. Very quiet hotel. The front desk all of them very helpful. Negative part , safety deposit box was at the front desk . A pain to go there , they could spend some money and put a safe in the room . That was the only negative comment . Other wise everyone should give this gem a try.this the view from room 404. The water is the famous Waikiki beach

Nothing fancy in this hotel but who goes to Hawaii to stay in the room? Employees are very friendly and always helped us when require. The only thing was that we found our room very noisy so next time I would pick a room on the pool side.

We stayed at the Royal Grove again this month, we stayed there some years back. It is a great budget hotel, very close to beach and shopping. The staff are friendly and helpful. It is nit a fancy hotel but you have everything you need. Great to have the small kitchenette, so you do not have to eat out all the time.

Considering the location of this hotel so close to Waikiki beach and considering the cost of nearby hotels the Royal Grove is incredibly good value. Yes it is old but it is clean, service is good, everything functions as it should,,and there is a swimming pool.

For 23 years, I stayed there three times a year. People keep going back because they truly make you feel welcome the moment you step in. It is in the heart of Waikiki, not on the beach, but two blocks away. Yes, it will get noisy at times, but it is charming in an old fashioned way. When you step in the pool area, you will feel like you have stepped onto the stage of Melrose Place. Everyone is friendly, especially Donna.

I stayed at the Royal Grove with a large group of musician's who were there for the Hawaiian Ukulele Festival. This grand old lady's is just the perfect place to stay when you are a ukulele aficionado. I stayed in room 209 which is a spacious corner suite and had everything I needed including a large fridge and perfectly functioning kitchen. The bathroom was a good size and the bed was very comfortable. It also had a large wrap around verandah. This establishment is dated but it's location and vibe certainly make up for it. The front desk staff couldn't have been more helpful and the cleaning staff were courteous and engaging.The Hotel is surrounded by modern resorts which makes it a gem amongst giants. It is only a 5 minute walk to the ocean pools of Waikiki Beach and the main shopping area. There are convenience stores very close and plenty of restaurants to choose from.There is a nice little pool to swim in if needed and it was kept very clean.There is no wifi in your room but you can get it in the lounge area. I loved this idea as it became very communal and you just never knew who you would end up having a conversation with. It certainly gets you out of your room.If you want luxury, stay at a newer resort but if you want an old style Hawaiian experience stay at the Royal Grove.

We loved this family-run old style hotel, central to everything and 5 mins walk to Waikiki beach. We went with a large group to attend the ukulele festival and all but 1 out of 7 rooms were delightfully clean, large, comfortable, air-conditioned, own bathroom, kitchenette, full-size fridge, balcony and serviced. The odd room out was a cheapy (no air-con and overlooked noisy street). The place has everything, just ask, including a lift, a safe deposit box system and free jam session Monday nights with fabulous old Hawaii'n players and hula dancers. Convenience store and restaurants right next door, supermarket an easy 2 block walk (BEHIND the Pantry Express Coffee Shop). We stayed a week, during which we snorkelled with turtles. attended free hula classes at the Royal Hawaii'n Centre, enjoyed free live Hawaii'n music and dance at The Mound Waikiki Beach, swam at the beach, went to the Pearl Harbour flea market (stadium), toured ukulele manufacturers and really had a ball. The Royal Grove makes Shabby Chic fashionable and desirable. Didn't cost us a lot so now we can afford to go to another festival.

Stayed in one of the condos across the road. Room was well appointed and comfortable. A little shabby and dated but everything worked fine. The desk staff were all very helpful and appeared to give genuine unbiased advice without trying to push any particular operator. The location is ideal only a short walk to the beach and shops.

I lived there for 8 nights as a solo traveler. I checked in the room #309, a spaciouscorner room with lanai overlook the streets and the swimming pool. A very niceroom next to the elevator, so it is very quiet. Like many reviewers mentioned, the room is very clean and room service is every second day. Sometimes I wrote something in the room for hours, I didn't find anything noise from the streets; but if I did I just turn the air conditioner on, which worked fine. I enjoyed my staying very much, thank you Royal Grove Hotel !

Stayed at the Royal Grove for one week, July 12-19. Very homely and comfortable place o stay when on a budget. Centrally located only a block from Waikiki beach. Lots of shops nearby and very good pop up farmers markets at kings Village in next block for excellent fresh fruit and local foods In the early evening. Rooms are clean and comfortable with kitchenette. Some have balconies and not all rooms have airconditioning. Just make request for these when making your booking. If here on a Monday night there is a Kanakapila happening where a group of locals get together and play ukulele and sing even hula dancing....great fun.

If you are looking for a blast from the past with similar prices and an old fashioned Hawaiian style family hotel this is the place for you. We have just arrived back home to Australia after spending 12 wonderful days in Hawaii staying at this hidden gem. No it is not the Royal Hawaiian or The Trump Hotel and if that is what you are expecting for the price the Royal Grove charges you are delusional. This hotel oozes and delivers old fashioned Hawaiian hospitality 200 metres from Waikiki beach. Many of the guests seem to know each other and visit year after year, the desk is manned 24 hours a day, nothing is too much bother and the welcome received is warm and genuine. Everyone knows the staff at reception by their first names and returning guests are greeted like old friends. Yes the place is shabby but it is clean, tidy and very serviceable. You do have a small kitchenette and it is nice to have the option to prepare something to eat in your own room sometimes. The air conditioning was perfectly fine and there was not one cockroach to be seen. Cockroaches however are present in most countries especially those with warmer climates and you need to toughen up if you think seeing one is likely to offend you or stay at home. Every Monday night Hawaiian music and dance is performed for free on the ground floor which is well worth seeing. Wifi is only available in the lobby and while initially I thought that was a problem it grew on me. As a person with a very busy career who normally goes through withdrawal symptoms if I can't check and respond to emails this did me the world of good. Also does young adults who have lost the art of conversation even on holidays as they are continually on social media the same. We also found going down to the lobby to use the wifi created opportunities to say hello and speak with other guests. We have visited Hawaii for four years now and stayed at very expensive hotels but stumbled across this hotel last year on a walk. My husband went in and asked if he could look around and have a look at a room which naturally for the staff was no bother. We decided then to stay there this year and have booked to return next year. It is easy to see why people return year after year. The Royal Grove is for those who have travelled in the Pacific very similar to how Aggie Grey's Hotel in Apia, Samoa used to be. Clean, tidy, warm and hospitable. Both great examples of Polynesian hospitality. I initially had to think twice about writing this review in case others got to hear about this "hidden gem" and it became even more difficult to book but I think I am too late anyway. This grand old lady as I like to think of this hotel is surrounded by newer hotels that probably appeal to the majority but for us and many like us she is representative of a past era that I hope is around for many years to come. Mahalo and we will be back next year!

I really wanted to like the Royal Grove, as I often select budget places and have had great luck following "one-star" suggestions of Fodor's and Frommer's in the US and those of Rick Steves when travelling in Europe. But I was disappointed with this one. The need for paint made it feel unclean and uncared for. Some of the towels and washcloths were very thin and threadbare, the kind I would relegate to cleaning the car. The random collection of items in the lobby area felt tacky rather than eclectic. There was an additional refrigerator on our lanai (balcony) and I'm not sure why. The doors have vents in them, making it hard to keep out noise from other guests. We were lucky the first two nights - it was quiet - but the third night there was a very noisy family with an uncontrollable child yelling even until 11:30 pm. After I reported this, someone did respond and the noise ended. Parking was reasonably priced for Waikiki ($20/day) but it was a couple of blocks away, which wasn't a problem for us but could be for some people. On the plus side, the a/c worked well, the room was a good size, and it was an overall excellent location. We had a view of the ocean in the distance from our lanai, and there were many restaurants nearby. The staff was quite friendly, making dinner suggestions, giving directions, and even helping me glue my broken sunglasses. It would take so little to spruce up the place - a thorough paint job, new towels, updated bedspreads, and solid doors. They could cover those costs by increasing their rates a small amount and still appeal to the budget-minded traveler who enjoys a friendly atmosphere.

Room was as I expected based on other reviews. Yes it is a bit "shabby chic", but the best vale for your money only a short block from the beach. Unless you are coming to Oahu to spend time in your room, this place will more than fill the bill

We had booked this hotel for a week having already spent a week in Vancouver. We chose the Royal Grove because it was well located, cheap and had amazingly good reviews. I'm not sure what I'm missing because I hated the place. It was old, tired and grubby. The air-con was intermittent so the room stiflingly hot. It was noisy, there was a rather strange smell in the room and, all in all, a most unpleasant place. We checked out and upgraded to a different hotel a few hundred yards away. On the plus side, the Royal Grove is well situated and very cheap but, take my word, it won't be to everyone's taste. You get what you pay for!!!

We loved our stay at the royal grove, I can't say anything bad about this hotel and when something is not quite right they are right onto it. The staff are super friendly, and once a week they do an authentic Hawaiian musical night with wonderful talented Hulu women.Restraunts are every where including small cafes with free wifi

location, location, location!!! Our second visit in 4 years and it still is our favorite: for those of us who remember loading up the station wagon and a road trip for Summer vacation, this is our place. Imagine seeing "da local boys" waxing their surfboards from storage prior to walking 2 blocks to go surfing. That just doesn't happen at the corporate prisons (ie., hotels) in Waikiki. No flat screen TVs here, buddy, and Wi-Fi is in the Lobby. If you can't deal with that, PLEASE stay somewhere else and leave this place for the rest of us. The supermarket, Food Pantry, is 2 blocks away, and prices don't astound any longer--mainland food prices have caught up with higher Hawaiian grocery prices finally. Love having our own breakfast without getting dressed using the full kitchenette and lounging on our own private balcony overlooking the lushly landscaped pool. Need a Sunday paper? Just borrow the one from the Front Desk attendant and return nicely intact and folded with a thank you. Still just an hour with carry-on bags from the airport on the city bus and convenient to ALL of Honolulu the same way. A mini-mart, Korean BBQ, and vegetarian restaurant are all on the ground floor of the hotel. Only downside is the garbage pickup which starts about 6 a.m. with the banging of the dumpster lids all over Waikiki---a/c is good earplugs.

Me and my husband were walking on the streets and accidentally discovered this really charming, small paradise with cheaper prises for a room and studio, then the hostels nearby. Our first studio was on the 5th floor, with balcony, from where you could see the famous waikiki beach, and Debbie, the loveliest receptionist, we have ever seen, made everything possible for us. Then we had a studio around the pool, which was a bit dark, but otherwise also perfect. The atmosphere is so relaxing there, you see families, older people, couples, they have pool, live music on mondays and everyone from stuff is extremely nice. Absolutely recommended.

What a delightful hotel. When you walk in you become relaxed right away. In the middle of honolulu they are like they are in the 1950's. The front desk personnel are friendly and helpful. The hotel itself is superbly clean and offer everything you need for a walk to the beach. They have a music night on Mondays that is worth being there on the Monday. They do not charge a resort fee and the price is reasonable. We will definitely stay here again. The lanais were wondeful!

Our room by the pool was very dark and small. Also 2 very large dead cockroaches under the dining table...not sure how housekeeping could have missed that. Nasty. I couldn't sleep knowing I could have them crawling all over! Yikes! No running hot water either and no wifi. Would give this place a pass.

We had a wonderful 10 days at the Grove. Staff is wonderful, so friendly and helpful. Our room was 'vintage' but clean and comfy. Really, really enjoyed the Monday night music Jam Session, the music and hula was so much Aloha. While there, Curtis, began cleaning and replanting some of the plants that surround the pool area, he was such a nice fellow and always made us smile, we look forward to seeing the results of his hard work when we next visit. Bless you all at the Royal Grove and Aloha from Alberta - missing you already.

This is the first time we stayed at the Royal Grove, but have already booked our stay for next year. It's centrally located with a great restaurant around the corner. Front staff very friendly, as are all the people that work there. Mr. Fong, the owner, strolls about and chats with all the guests. Monday nights is Hawaiian entertainment evening, with hula dancers and Hawaiian music. Our room was on the second floor facing the street. We didn't find it noisy, usually had the A/C on or the fan during the night. TV's could be updated, but who watches tv when in Hawaii. We had a kitchenette with a full frig. Breakfasts were on the lanai, where we had a table and 3 chairs. The laundry charges were really inexpensive. They also have things like beach chairs, umbrellas, strollers that previous guests leave behind for other guests. We are looking forward to Feb. /17 for another 5 week stay.

My adult daughter and I spent nine nights at the Royal Grove and have no complaints. We were on the fifth floor and had a view of other high-rise hotels along Waikiki.
