It was a short walk to the beach and all the shops along Waikiki. Couldn't have been more conveniently located. The hotel is older and dated, but that gives it a certain charm. Unlike a lot of more modern, upscale hotels, the Royal Grove has personality. But it's not for everyone.If you are okay with a clean, basic room/bathroom/kitchenette with limited amenities, than the Royal Grove should work. The cost (average $70/per night) is unbeatable, especially for those of us traveling on a budget.Our housekeeper, Becita, did an amazing job in keeping us stocked with towels and soap. The maintenance worker, Curtis, replaced a screen with a couple holes in it (I had put some duct tape, which I carry in my luggage for just such emergencies, over the torn spots when I first arrived) within hours of our arrival, and later fixed a squeaky bathroom door for us.There was noise from traffic and garbage trucks in the early morning hours, but who wants to sleep the day away in Honolulu? Better to turn in a little earlier and be ready to get up and rolling in the morning (this coming from a true night owl). There's just too much to see and do on the island!The Royal Grove has a number of mainlanders who visit frequently and stay for long periods of time, so expect to see a lobby full of 'regulars' conversing and having a good time...interesting folks to chat with.The Royal Grove worked for us and we would stay there again.

I stayed in a room with 2 twin beds and totally zero view on the 2nd floor. The rate of $70 was attractive and I found the room to be quite basic but at the same time adequate. The location is awesome, it's very central indeed. My room had AC and I did use it some and sometimes just left the fan running. The reviewer with the 3 kids needs to understand that having such kids run around without adequate supervision can be off putting to other guests. I am pretty sure I witnessed this and while I would not call the situation out of control, it could be of concern, especially when the young kids would at times run out onto the front sidewalk where cars are nearby (with dad on the chase). I agree that the demographic at the hotel is older (I am 45), who cares; it's a hotel and it's not like you generally get into deep social interaction when staying at a hotel anyways. The place is very clean and you feel well taken care of. Great value for the location - just don't expect luxury.

We stayed here for 10 days in march with our three kids and loved it. It is very casual and does have an older clientel but we never felt looked down upon nor our children in fact many times people went out of their way to introduce themselves. Rooms are basic but very clean and although only serviced a couple times during our visit it was worth it for what you pay. Front desk staff was awesome and we cant wait to come back.

Came & stayed here with our 3 young children for 9 nights recently. Didn't expect too much as it's pretty cheap for its location but felt continually let down as the days rolled on. The room was well equiped but not serviced regularly enough with 5 people staying in it. The staff were unfriendly - except for 1 on the front desk. Our room was not air conditioned & extremely noisy making it difficult to stay asleep most nights. Most people staying here were well over 65 and at times it resembled a nursing home. some people stay for months on end & act as if they have ownership over it which is irritating especially when they tell your children off for being children. It is in a good location though BUT honestly don't expect too much of anything

This hotel is not for everybody, but if you like a great deal and want a premium location, this is the place to stay. This hotel is 500 ft from the Hyatt Regency in Waikiki , which is across the street from the Waikiki Beach. It is an old hotel with a look from the fifties. That said, you have a full size refrigerator, microwave, stove, silverware and dishes , included in the room. Flat screen TV , and a small balcony. The furniture is funky but the hotel is clean. Wifi is free in the lobby and is not available in your room. Management is friendly and there is an ABC store across the street for coffee , and other snacks and food supplies. Bottom line, you have everything that a $350 dollar hotel "might" have at 1/3rd the price but it is old and basic.

we have came here for 7 years and it only gets better. the staff is extremely friendly and u r treated like family till your departure and even after that as they renew your reservation immediately for the next year to insure you get a room if you request it. I would renew the reservation rite away if you plan on coming back the next year as this is a very popular hotel ,loved by many.

I have stayed at this hotel many times. I find it to be the absolute best bargain on Waikiki. Check their web site and if it is unavailable call direct. I generally take the city bus from the airport and the hotel stop is about twenty yards from the hotel. If you have lots of luggage I would suggest a shuttle. Great Korean BBQ place on the corner. The only negative thing I can say is you need to plan ahead because they are frequently full. If you are looking for a Marriott or Hilton this place is not for you. If you are looking for a clean, safe, air conditioned room with a kitchen, this place is for you. Wifi is in lobby

This hotel is just 2 short blocks to Waikiki beach. Located in Waikiki, and all the shopping and restaurants. The hotel itself is of Hawaii in the 60's. Family operated and owned, guest are comfortable and relaxed here. Pool and WiFi available. You can either rent daily or weekly even monthly rates are available. Don't expect anything fancy, but its very clean and the font desk staff, and housekeepers are spot on, and friendly. 60% of hotel guests you will find, come every year and will only stay at this hotel. Rates will usually be half of surrounding hotels. Parking is nearby. I would recommend everyone, family or couples, to stay here and enjoy a hotel atmosphere you no longer can find anywhere now days.

People that read mt review can see that I'm not that picky . That being said say here ! Every thing you want and more ! Had a one bedroom which was great if you have kids they can be apart when they want . Full kitchen , we cooked a turkey in the oven ! And 1/2 block from the beach . If I had to say anything "bad" the front desk guy at night is a little unhappy in life , but NO BIG DEAL . For price , people that work there , and everything you get , STAY HERE !!

After 4 tries I finally got the chance to book at this quiant hotel although they placed us at the nearby Pacific Monarch where they had some sort of an arrangement. People have been raving about the location and the dated rooms but what really made my stay truly wonderful was the warmth of the staff and the atmosphere at the lobby. It was as if everybody was family. Wifi is limited to the lobby area so this becomes a sort of meeting place for the guests and I had a great time mingling with the other guests as well as the house staff on duty. What really impressed me were guests who were checking out but at the same time making reservations for December 2016! That explains why as early as July( the date I made my booking for Dec. 2015), there were already few rooms available.So for those who would like to check out this nice hotel book as early as now.

I'm in love with the Royal Grove Hotel. If you're on a budget, but not into staying at a hostel, this hotel is heaven on earth in Waikiki. Rooms come with a kitchen area, which is awesome for saving money on dining in Waikiki. They also have ocean view rooms, and you're literally steps away from Waikiki Beach. This place is a rare find in Waikiki, and so much more 'real Hawaii' compared to the typical Waikiki resort.

As other posts have stated the property is old but very well maintained. As can happen with any property , we had a few minor problems, but the staff fixed them immediately. If you have a problem, you must tell the staff or they cannot fix it. ( For example we had terrible beds at Disney. The housekeepers cannot tell that by making the bed. We had new mattresses right away.) We stayed for 3 weeks. Great bar b que next door. With a long stay the rooms are cleaned twice a week,, but they bring clean towels every other day. And if you need anything,, just ask at the desk. They have a great laundry and entertainment every Monday night. . We had a full and twin bed. kitchenette. The dishes and pots and pans are very good quality. Also we had a full stove and frig. I had a dental emergency and they referred a dentist also. We would definitely stay there again. It is only 6 stories but we could see the beach from our balcony. If you rent a car, the hotel across the street has parking. We were only a couple blocks from the beach. We did not use the pool, but we did see guests there every day. You can also buy laundry and dish soap at the front desk. There is also a microwave, toaster, coffee maker. Lots of storage for clothes. Good size room. Lots of mirrors. Many of their guests come every year for long stays so book early. They have free wifi in the lobby area. Bed and pillows were very comfortable. And extra pillows and blankets in drawers and closet.. THEY DO NOT HAVE RESORT FEES which is a big money saver. We paid for a week what some hotels charge for a day.

At 2/3 the price, one coud reasonably expect less but they deliver more. The decor is classic 60's or 70's but the sheets, rooms, and common areas are clean, tidy and neat. The free library has a lot of classics of many genres. Pool is small but still has plenty of space for a relaxing float. It is a short walk to many amenities, and is a very relaxing site, for an amazing economical price. The staff are friendly, and full of good advice. Will be returning.

Staff at reception very friendly. Always happy to help. The whole lobby had a really relaxed vibe about it. Located 5 minute walk from Waikiki Beach (unreal). They also accepted travellers cheques, which was convenient.The room was comfortable. A little outdated, but very good for the price (we paid $500 per week (plus tax) for two weeks). One let down was there was no digital tv (confirmed by the staff the entire property has no digital tv. A bit disappointing when you want to chill out after a long day out). Full sized fridge and kitchenette was a real bonus. We stayed on the second floor. The view was not the best (facing the back yard area where the social gatherings are held on Monday nights (can get very noisy). The room was maintained and kept clean. Free wifi was available which helped when making bookings for events. They also had a dedicated taxi service to pick you up and take you back to the airport at a fixed price (this was fantastic).There was no parking available. They encourage you to use the paid parking at a nearby property at a cost of $20 per night (they are not affiliated). Can get expensive. There is free parking during the day if you can find it near parks.Overall, It was a welcoming and comfortable place to stay. Would definitely stay there again. Great place if your on a budget.

Great budget place to stay - friendly staff, clean rooms and just off the beach of Waikiki.If you can get a room, take it. Real value for money as our dollar has dropped and Hawaii is becoming an expensive place to stay for Kiwis. Will stay here again if we return.

We spent a week at the Royal Grove earlier in November. This is our 3rd stay at this hotel. Very clean, friendly staff, close to the beach. A great place to stay. We will continue to come back to this hotel. They are very popular and always booked so planning ahead is a must.

This was my eighth visit to Oahu and my first stay at the Royal Grove. I hope that I did not save the best for last. The RG is great. Clean, friendly, helpful staff, comfortable, convenient location, sizable rooms, kitchens, pool, onsite restaurant, musical entertainment on Monday, wi-fi (in the lobby), well stocked library.... I'm sure I am forgetting something.I stayed here for eight nights in November in room 301. It was a corner room and although I was perhaps three blocks from the beach I had a straight view of the ocean right down Uluniu Ave from my lanai.The quibbles that I have are just that--quibbles: the pillows could have been a little firmer, the tv a little bigger, the ac a little quieter, the lobby a little cooler. But, this is a wonderful place and I hope to return many times. And I hope the Royal Grove never changes.

I've been visiting the Royal Grove for the past several years in the month of February. The front desk people are very helpful and very accomodating. The rooms are large and clean. This hotel is located a few blocks from Waikiki beach and close for shopping, buses and restaurants. It is a small hotel that offers you a Hawaiian friendly ambiance. I love the Royal Grove!......I hope you will love it too.

I stayed here for 7days last summer by myself. Everything in this hotel are old but lovely! I love the vintage interior and lovely little pool of Royal Grove. Staff are all friendly, The blonde lady at reception call me 'Honey!' always and helped me kindly. Room was also old but cozy and clean, well air conditioned. (It was better than the pictures in Trip Adviser and Royal Grove Hotel homepage!) The other good thing to stay here is location. It takes only 3 minutes to the beach, and the famous surfing shop Moku is just 1 minutes away. I really enjoyed staying here, and I would go Royal Grove in my next visit in Hawaii.

The Royal Grove to me had the feeling of a mom and pop hotel. You felt like family the min you checked in. The staff that work there are great friendly people willing to help you any way they can, Room was nice, beds were comfortable, you could stay in and cook if you choose to, which helped a lot. I had room 102 which by the pool,a quite little corner. Be sure to check out music night on Mondays, it was amazing. Take time to get to know the people that stay there to you well make great friends. I plan on returning and hopefully stay in same room. The Royal Grove is the only place for me from now on.

The Royal Grove is a family owned and operated hotel which never changes and never compromises on its basic mission to help it’s guests feel at home.I first stayed here around 20 years ago when I came to visit my parents. They stayed here for 15 years running, same six weeks in April and May, same room, same group of friends, “The April Crowd” they called themselves.Back then, I walked through the door and found a hotel that could have been the setting for a Hemingway short story, a set for a Bogart movie, or a dream home away from home for the dozens of regulars who come here every year to experience the best of what Hawaii has to offer, simple hospitality. Retuning this year I found only one minor change. They have free wifi in the lobby now. It’s okay though. Wifi does not interfere with the pervasive sense of community here. Folks still talk to each other between emails. The staff is helpful as ever. And the owner, Dear Mr. Fong, still organizes a weekly evening of music and homemade food for his guests. Everyone stands for last number and holds hands. I don’t now about you, but when I fall asleep at night, I am completely unaware of my environment, not matter how many stars it has. When I wake up in the Royal Grove, I feel comfortable knowing that all through the day people will be nodding and smiling in my direction, engaging in conversation. There are no strangers here.Thank you, Mr. Fong, on behalf of my parents, and my wife and I.

Arrived September 19th Room was lovely and clean with a small kitchen maid was in every other day air conditioning worked great we had lots of room which was good because we had 2 bicycles with us which wasn't a problem for the hotel staff and we could get them in and out of elevator without issue .We met lots of people in the lobby while we on the internet some where staying for 1 to 2 months and everyone was so nice .There are lots of lovely restaurants by the hotel and the food and drinks are very cheap we found some great ones just stay away from the main stripe .The bus service is amazing and only $2.50 and right by hotel we went to pearl harbour and Hanuma Bay which are both a must if you have time we also walked to Diamond Head from the hotel which is great .Thanks everyone for a great time we will be back Mr Fong

This place will never get many "stars", but I think that is why it has so many repeat customers that love it so much.We were on the third floor, on the road side. Not sure of the category, but we had a one bedroom, double bed, and then two singles in the other room, with the table between the beds. A small kitchenette, and full size fridge. No dishwasher. And you pay $1.00 for dish soap, if you need to wash any dishes. It's the little bottle of Palmolive. There are not a lot of utensils supplied in the kitchen, but we didn't do much more than cut up cheese and boil water! Eating out in Waikiki is inexpensive, and we enjoyed different places in Waikiki for breakfast, lunch, and dinner on our two full days there. Bathroom was small. Very dark, but it does get brighter in time, because of those light bulbs that I hate! The bathroom door sticks a bit, at the bottom. I made the mistake of shutting it all the way the first time I used it, and I could not get out! I had to call for my friend to push the door in, from the other side, so I could get out. It is only at the bottom that the door is tight, because of a piece of wood across the bottom of the door. A good laugh was had about this.Lots of towels are available downstairs by the pool. And make sure you find the room with all the beach chairs as well. Plenty to choose from, and you can take them to the beach. Mats and other "toys" are also there for your use. Front desk staff was GREAT! I could not find the keys to open up the little TSA lock on my suitcase. A very nice gentleman came up to the room with a hack saw and was able to get the lock off for me. Thanks again, for doing that!We had AC in our room, and it worked very well. I had a separate control in the one bedroom, and another control was for the living area. I actually needed a blanket in the middle of the night.Lanai was long and narrow. Noisy at times, but it was a great place for people watching. And we could see the beach! The royal Grove is a very short walk from Kuhio Beach.We never did use the pool, so I can't comment on that.While the Royal Grove will never be a 5 star hotel, it served our purposes and I would stay there again if I was in need of a budget hotel for another trip.

I have stayed here since 1997 at least twice a year. Great place. Like going home. everyone is friendly. Love being there. Some time solo and sometime family. They try to put you together if they can. They have fun things going on during the holidays and the music on Monday night is great.

After having read all the reviews of this hotel I was expecting something a lot better. The decor is very tired and locked in the 60's, 70's Only WiFi was in the lobby and it was exceptionally hot and humid, a ceiling fan at least would have helped. The room was very tired and the air conditioner struggled and was too noisy to have on at night. Pool hours were 9am to 8pm, could well be extended. The staff were lovely and helpful but they do not book any tours etc. I personally would prefer to pay a little extra for comfort.

It wasn't anything killer as far as hotels go, but it was clean and in Waikiki. I could look out the balcony and kind of see the ocean and the location was pretty decent. Near the international marketplace, and only a block or two off of the beach. Good staff too

This was our third time staying at the Royal Grove. Maybe not modern and high rise, but totally adequate, close to the beach and close to the Food Pantry (we have had full kitchen facilities on each visit). I love their little pool and my husband loves the sea so we were both well catered for.All the staff we have dealt with have been friendly and helpful. We didn't realise there was a musical evening each Monday and only got home for the day as it got underway. With our sliding door open, I was beautifully serenaded from the ground floor while I was cooking our dinner.Don't expect posh surroundings, but do expect friendliness and very affordable accommodation close to everything you could need for your holiday.

My friends and I have stayed at the Royal Grove many times. The staff and guest are all so friendly and mostly return guest. The rooms are comfortable and have full kitchens. There are stores and the beach a short walk away. You can enjoy all of the amenities of the more expensive hotels and the free shows that are all over the beach. Bus lines right there for you trips any where on the island for such a great price.On Monday nights the local musicians get together in the lobby to jam and everyone gets up and dances. So much fun with great new friends. Glad to return again and again and always like coming home.

My daughter and I stayed here for 2 weeks last month. The room rate of $500 US (plus tax) per week was fantastic. I wasn't sure what to expect for the price but we were pleasantly surprised with the hotel. Sure it is a little old but the staff are fantastic and we had everything we needed in our room including a kitchenette and cooking equipment. The room was nice and clean and the beds comfortable. The guests we met had been coming back every year. The Monday "jam session" was great and it is close to the beach. If you want value for money, I would recommend the Royal Grove Hotel.

Just back from a 10 night stay,my 3rd time at hotel.Prices still very cheap which means more money to spend,and the way the aussie dollar is I needed it..Cant beat the location,rooms are old yes but clean,staff are very good.The best place if you are on a budget.Like a hotel from the 70's. I wouldn't stay anywhere else.Its a basic hotel with a great feel.Monday night they have a sing along which is very nice..If you are a budget traveller you should like it,has everything u will need except a pillow top bed! LOL

I've stayed here before and every time is exactly what I need at the price that is unbeatable which gives me more $$$ to spend on other things like tours and food ect. as Waikiki is expensive. If you can get in , consider yourself lucky , it is booked well in advance by repeat guests. There are weekly rates as well which can save you a few bucks. Nothing fancy , but I don't spend much time in the room anyways . WIFI in the lobby area .

A Cute family-owned establishment with fair prices for the variety of wonderful rooms that only boast good value. I came here back in June 2013 (not 2014 like i listed below) with a friend and her family and I was shocked to learn of their prices (check out their weekly deals) especially because of how centrally located their are to Waikiki, restaurants, shopping, rental car services and the market. They even have kitchenettes so you can save money by making some meals at the hotel. Not to mention, they have a great Korean BBQ place downstairs and Shave Ice location. The Staff is ridiculously friendly and the hotel itself has that "come-kick it-with-your-chill-aunt-in-hawaii" vibe. Maybe wade in the pool outside, maybe grab a delicious meal from downstairs, or maybe just walk 5 minutes to the beach and go snorkel. If you're on a budget and would rather spend $500 for the week instead of nightly, I highly recommend this hotel.

We last visited honolulu seven years ago, and when the opportunity to have another holiday there, we immeadiately hoped the Royal Grove had a room available for us. They did, not the side of the hotel we would have preferred, but we were quite late getting our bookings done.Our travel had us arriving in the early hours of the morning, and the owner had sat up to let us in. Due to the shuttle we booked not being there (that is another review), it was eventually 3 am when we arrived. The owner was as charming as ever, and we felt bad having kept him up so late. Hope they let him sleep in the next morning.We also wanted a sleep in the next morning, so having cleaning staff banging on the door at 8.30am was not very welcome. And when I yelled out we didn't need anything, they continued to bang, until I got out of bed and opened the door to send them away. We quickly learnt to put the do not disturb sign out every night, to ensure we could slumber as long as we wanted to.Once again, we found the hotel clean, and really appreciate the cooking facilities. We found our way back to the food pantry, just a couple of blocks awy, and stocked up for our 2 week stay. the pantry allowed us to take a trolley back to the hotel, by holding a credit card. This was greatly appreciated, as our initial purchase included whole water melons, rockmelons and honeydew melons, amongst other things.We did have an incident, which at the time was a bit heartstopping, but in hind sight is really hilarious.It was evening , and we were enjoying the sunset, and watching people passing by from the balcony. I went in and showered, and the joined my dh on the balcony, clad only in a towel. He went to go in and fill my wine glass up, and said, "you've locked the door." I said , no I didn't , I just closed it. But it was locked. Ended up having to catch the attention of a passerby,(finding an English speaking one wasn't easy), and getting them to go into reception and ask for someone to come up and unlock our balcony door. The man said they had some trouble with it before. So we were delighted the next day, when we returned from our bus tour, to find the whole door lock mechanism had been replaced.We loved our stay again(cept for the early morning door knocking)) and have recommended it to our daughter and her friends who are visiting in May this year.The location is premium, and the fact that you can do your own meals makes it a really affordable holiday.

A treasure of a find. Very short walk to Waikiki Beach. Clean, but not fancy. Dated, but charming in it's own way. We felt very fortunate to find a room at the last minute. If we ever go back, it will be our first choice for our family. Beds were not super good, but they were comfortable.

I was on a very tight budget and feel fortunate to have found the Royal Grove. The location is absolutely perfect, right in the middle of Waikiki 2 blocks from beach) and I could even see the ocean from my balcony! Rooms are older and not very modern, but exceptionally clean and well-maintained... I literally only showered and slept there and couldn't care less about fancy fixtures and services. :-) Staff was always friendly/helpful and the hula show in the lobby was an unexpected treat. As a budget traveler, I couldn't have asked for more.

Good hotel, good price and excellent location! The staff is really friendly and you have to be there on the Hula shows!The rooms are a little old, but they are clean. There is a kitchen in most of the rooms. I visited this place 4 times in the last 10 years and I would go again at any time!! It's about 1 minute from the beach, shops, groceries, bus, etc.

Older ,not the latest hotel,comfortable ,friendly,central and has a beautiful personal touch.Staff will remeber you and helpful in any way they can be.You wont beat it, in the Waikiki area.1960s style origanalty Hawaian hospitality

I have stayed at several hotels in Waikiki over the past 25 years. The Royal Grove is a place like home if you live a frugal life. No frills, bells or whistles but you can walk to the beach and cook your leftovers. The friendly atmosphere is just the tip of the Aloha vibe present at this location. I've already booked my room for next year… See you there!

I've heard good things about the Royal Grove in my prior visits to Oahu but there had never been availablity on my previous adventures. Even this visit I could only squeeze in for half of my trip, but I'm so glad I finally got the chance to experience the Royal Grove even if only for a short while in November 2014.It's not a 5* property with all the typical resort amenities (or fees!), but there is a small pool, a warm community feel & even entertainment on Monday nights. It is clean, safe and comfortable. I had a mini kitchenette which I really enjoyed.Note: the food pantry in Kuhio can be pricy but there is a SamsClub & Walmart behind the AlaMoana or a Safeway on Kapahulu, also several Costco's in Honolulu.Although not directly on the beach (2 or 3 minute stroll to Duke's Statue) the location is hard to beat.

I was visiting Hawaii by myself and was concerned about having a great location and for good value. Royal Grove hit both location and value. Not even a 5 minute walk to the beach and the main strip for shops/bars/restaurants. It has quirky decor inside and feels very "old Hawaii" - which is great! The rooms are very simple but very clean! All you need is a comfy, clean bed, a TV and a clean bathroom.I had some trouble with my flight being cancelled the day before I was scheduled to leave which put some stress on me and Mr. Fong was kind enough to help me contacting the airport and let me stay in the same room for another night. Overall, I had a great trip and a great stay here.

A block back from the beach, but without the beachfront prices, this little gem of a hotel is run like a home away from home. Filled with wonderful old mementoes of the last 60 years, it is a real taste of vintage Hawaii, complete with 50's pink colour scheme and 60's tropical pool decor like something from an Elvis movie. The rooms are super cheap and unselfconsciously retro in the best way. Don't expect 5 star amenities, decor or room service, but if you like quirky, relaxed and a bit of time travel, this is your perfect spot. Every monday night get out your uke for a fantastic Kanakapila singalong in the lobby with some of Honolulu's best musicians, hula dancers (real, not touristy) and the charming Mr Fong, 92 and still making the girls swoon with his old time Hawaiian songs.Utterly fabulous.My kind of place.

I have stalked trip advisor for months, maybe years in preparation for my vacation to Hawaii. I have posted many topics in the forum and have done hours of research. I debated about hotels for a long time. In the end, I chose the Royal Grove based on the price and the positive reviews. Admittedly, when we walked in I thought "oh no:(" We got up to the room and the door hit the fridge and I thought "oh, no." while wondering what other accommodations we may be able to find. The room was clean and faced the pool on the fifth floor. I decided to give it a chance. There are cracks in the shower, the caulking needs to be redone, etc. The place does show it's age. However, what is also shows is character and the Hawaii you envision in your head. It is not for those who are looking for five star accommodations or for those who want to party and make noise till 2 am. The folks who come here have been doing so for 20+ years. They know each other and you get a feeling of "aloha". The Royal Grove is an incredible value. It is two blocks from the beach. It has a small pool (with hardly anyone in it) that does the job. We did not come to Hawaii to sit in the room or the hotel. If this is your plan, you may want to look somewhere else. This isn't the "resort like" kind of place. We used their beach mats, boogie boards, sand umbrellas, and tubes during our stay. All of this stuff is of no charge to guests. This hotel felt like home after a long tiring day. The folks at the front desk were always helpful and offered us a late check out for free! I can not believe what a value this place is and I almost do not want share this review (but I told the ladies at the front desk I would). We will most definitely be returning to the Royal Grove!!! <3

An aging hotel that is the best value BY FAR in the Waikiki area. Two easy blocks from Waikiki beach, clean rooms, functional kitchenette... Did I mention that this is a great deal? If you want luxury or even ungraded features then skip this hotel, however. The bathroom is small and the walls are paper thin. Still a great value due to the location and helpful staff. This is the kind of hotel where you meet people who have stayed there every summer for 10 + years... Great price. Very basic amenities. Nice owners. Will return next time we are in the Waikiki area!

This is a great find in Waikiki... we stayed for a week for around 72$/day which is absolutely a great value anywhere- and even more as Hawaii is pretty extensive.. You get a full kitchenette, balcony, swimming pool, and chairs and towels for the beach- what more could we want... We actually ended have more money for sightseeing and activities. Cooking some of the meals in our room, really helped us to cut down on our costs on restaurant. Their weekly music performance, i think on mondays was beautiful and very popular ( the owner is a music lover). We got a poolside room on the 3rd floor- hence not noisy.The only complaint we have is our room wasn't fully serviced even once during our weekly stay.. Towels weren't changed frequently either. But considering the cost- we aren't complaining. Most of the time, we were out, exploring the island, anyways. I highly recommend this hotel because of its great location, the BEST value and great front desk staff. But you have to book, several months in advance. I believe its already all booked for the Christmas time and I can totally understand why :)

it is an older looking hotel, everything was clean, and description on TripAdvisor was correct with what you get. nice employees very help full and our kids thought it was the best to have the hotel 2 blocks from the beach and having the pool and it was pink!

I have been going to Oahu for years and we stay at The Royal Grove Hotel. This is a very old hotel that is painted "pink" with lots of old timer charm. If you want luxury, this is not your hotel. If you want a comfortable family type atmosphere - this is the place. The Fong family has owned this hotel for many, many years. The value is incredible for the location. "2 blocks to the beach" The rooms are a good size, but old. They do have refrigerators, stoves and cooking utensils for your use. The pool is small, but still enjoyable.Usually one evening a week, a group performs with their ukuleles and other instruments and guests hear lovely Hawaiian music and songs. There is always some one available to do the Hula which adds to the charm of the evening. Every year, it is like coming back to a second home and with the price being so reasonable, you can easily come back again and again.

I usually stay in a beachfront hotel with a nice view when visiting Waikiki, so I admit I had some skepticism about staying in a budget hotel. But having read the mostly good reviews on TripAdvisor I decided to take a chance. I was not disappointed. If the hotel seems old and dated, well, that's its charm. The front desk staff was friendly without exception. The room was clean, housekeeping service was efficient. The location was fine. No in-room wifi, but good wifi connection in lobby.Five stars (or dots I guess) for exceeding my expectations and for being a great value in an otherwise very expensive place to visit.

Have stayed here at least twice. It's old, and I'm pretty sure the furniture (at least in the units I had) is original. However, it's inexpensive, each unit has a basically equipped kitchenette, the staff is friendly, and it's ideally located. If you're seeking luxury, the Royal Grove won't meet your needs; for others it will be ideal!! The same building also houses Me's Korean Barbecue, another of my faves!

I have stayed at this place a number of times over the years, the last time before this trip was in 2012. Royal Grove continues to be the best budget bet in Honolulu in my opinion. It is more faded than ever-- expects 70's motel feel-- but the location is fabulous (2 short blocks to Waikiki Beach), the staff are friendly, the rooms (I think all) have kitchenettes, and there are rooms to accommodate families. All right next door to the best Korean barbecue place ever (ME restaurant). There is free wifi but only in the lobby, a small pool, things like beach mats to borrow, security boxes at receptions, and they will book a shuttle for you. Great find if you are on a budget. One temporary drawback is they are doing some renovation. They are careful to contain it to two hours in the am and two in the pm, but when we returned on our way home we made sure to book a pool facing room rather than a street facing one. Also, they were shooting Hawaii 5-0 right outside our door which was a hoot.

I'm one of those who like the hotel for all the reasons people have stated that they do, and can see why others don't like it for the reasons that they don't, although I disagree about it not being clean; it is well worn, yes, but still clean. The one clarification or distinction that I can make is that the noise that people mention is not noisy hotel patrons, those I have found are quite quiet. The noise, rather, is regular old city noise, the kind you'd find in any busy city streets: buses, trucks, deliveries, idling taxis, that sort of thing. If you don't want city noise, Waikiki may not be the place for thee.

We have just returned home from a 9 night stay at the Royal Grove Hotel. I must say we were very impressed , the hotel is alot nicer then what the photos show. ( I uploaded a few) Upon arrival at 8.30am our room was ready and we were able to go straight to our room which was perfect for us, that way we could spend the whole day out. It is literally a 1 minute walk to waikiki beach and Kalakaua Avenue, the side where the Duke statue is. The hotels location is perfect we walked absolutely everywhere and you have the trolley stops on either Kuhio or the Duke statue however the statue is closer. It is a very clean hotel , the room is very spacious and well equipped. The air conditioning works very well keeps the room cold. The Staff were all so friendly and inviting we definitely felt at home here. They also provide towels for the beach so no need to pack one. The hotel was locked at night and always someone working it was very secure. I will without a doubt stay at this hotel again. If you are going to Hawaii to spend all day in your room then this hotel isn't for you. If you need a place with a relaxed atmosphere, convenient location , sleep, shower and want to spend your savings shopping then this is definitely the hotel to book ! Thank you Royal Grove for contributing to an unforgettable vacation in waikiki !

It's all about location at the Royal Grove Hotel. It is about a block and a half from beautiful Waikiki Beach. We could even see the beach from the balcony. The hotel staff is so wonderful. They will accommodate any request the best that they possibly can. Be sure and grab a chair and boogie on the way to the beach. There are great restaurants and shopping all within walking distance. We had a rental car and parking is available about three blocks away. Although, the walk isn't bad. The room is nothing fancy, but the location cannot be beat for the price. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Honolulu hotels can be quite expensive and the Royal Grove is definitely affordable but. And the but means that this place is way beyond outdated, it wasn't very clean and it was always so noisy around the hotel.I noticed right away the fire alarm in our room that was ripped off the wall. There were too many drunks and wagabounds roaming in the side street just to the south of the Royal Grove. Next time I would rather spend more money and I will stay at a different hotel/condo. .Most of the clients at this place seemed to be elderly retired people with limited income and so I can understand why they picked this hotel as their winter residence.I think one day soon bulldozers will take care of this old relic.

The location of this hotel is perfect, just two blocks from Waikiki beach. Rooms are spacious with a plenty of storage room, bathroom complete with bath and a well equipped kitchenette. The hotel’s pool is small, but serves its purpose and we found we had it to ourselves the majority of the time. There is wifi available in the lobby area and laundry facilities for those on longer trips. Body boards, beach mats, snorkel gear, beach toys etc are all free to borrow which was great. Reception staff were helpful and courteous, happy to answer any queries. Many of the guests we chatted to had returned to this hotel year after year and I can understand why as it is exceptional value for money.

After 4 fantastic days on Maui our expectations were high, but we were not disappointed.The Royal Grove was outstanding value, so well located, clean, spacious, well-serviced and with a real feeling of warmth.After a morning on the very close Waikiki Beach I could just lie on the bed or sit on the lanai enjoying the sound of other guests in the pool and looking at the sky.The Monday night live music and dancing in which the owner participated was genuine and uplifting.Back home in Sydney, on the same budget, I would probably have been in a backpacker hostel with a shared bathroom.Yes, the fittings might be dated but the full kitchen had more than enough of everything and better knives that I have had in expensive places.!!!!!! AND the room was serviced daily!

Yes,another trip at the Royal Grove! We stayed 9 days and had a great time. To those of you who have never stayed here this is what you are getting....2 blocks away from the beach,a kitchen with everything you need(you provide the food and drinks), right there you are saving tons of $$ which can be spent on other things like the Aloha Stadium flea market,they always have sand chairs,floaties,and other water toys to use all the time-More$$ saved..a small but fun pool with chairs and tables to set at.when you are in the pool area you forget there are tourists by the hundreds and lots of car noise outside of the place.The people at the desk are very friendly and helpful..I stayed at other Big name hotels there and will always go back to the Royal Grove.It is like being in Hawaii in the 50's when you stay there-but thats what we like.I always feel like Ohana when I am there and get sad when we have to leave. Next trip will be for months instead of days.Check them out..Oh and someone put in their review it was noisey..well you are right downtown in a busy city so yes it is going to be..if it is quiet you need-Makaha is for you.

I am amazed by the positves expressed by travelers on this hotel. There are NO customer service skills by the clerks or anyone else. The air conditioner in our room was non functioning. They gave us a SMALL fan to place beside our bed. Every time we had small requests or had interaction, it was a unfriendly tone, unsmiling experience. Nothing even close to unreasonable requests-- We asked where the best location and bus would be to go to Chinatown. The male desk clerk gave a quick point to the back wall and said, " out that direction". We asked if they has a safety pin, they gave us a tiny little pin. We just avoided communication as much as possible after that.The swimming pool experience was very poor. They were doing maintenance and construction work the entire week, so we sat around the pool listening to pounding nails and drills loudly buzzing for hours. Does that sound like a peaceful experience for a vacation? The computer situation was a joke. $1 for 10 minutes on a old computer that kept crashing and slow to respond. By the time you got to the site you wanted, the 10 minutes was over. And they have a dirty little sign written in crayon that reads, "Don't try to sneak on the computer with out paying. We SEE everything you do" How would that make you feel regarding hotel customer service and feeling at home? The sign was a synopsis for the entire hotel and staff: petty, dirty, unprofessional, and leaves you with a bad feeling and experience. No sense of Aloha whatsoever. Be leery people. Go some where else. This place needs to be shut down and torn down.

I still feel this is the best value hotel in Waikiki although I have only actually stayed in one other - the Marriott which is not good value. I had a week at the RGH in a room on the pool side.The aircon was a new whisper quiet one that disappointed me as previously I used the fan on full to mask outside noise from motor bikes and emergency vehicles and noisy revellers or internal door slammers or any loud noise. I have written before on hints how best to make use of the full kitchen, such as taking all your basic food stuffs with you and then replacing the weight of those with all the things you buy and bring home. I also take a bit of dish washing liquid etc so that I don't have to waste time buying basics. There are great markets nearby at the Hyatt (Thurs 4-8) and the Kings Market (Mon, Wed and Fri 4-8), for fruit and other things. The Hyatt especially has some lovely take away food. TheBus stops really close to the hotel. The only complaint I can make this time is that the exceedingly elderly Panasonic TV was impossible to watch. I hope they invest in some new TVs before my next visit.On my last 2 visits both times they have allowed me to have a very early check in for which I was very grateful.

This was our third stay at the Royal Grove in Waikiki, but as always the staff were very helpful, we had a self catering room at the front, bigger than average, think it was 404, comfortable bed, noise not too much of a problem. Very reasonable price for being in the heart of Waikiki and 2 minutes walk from beach. We managed to be there for Monday night music, the band was even better than our last visit and added attraction was hula dancing. I think other people have discovered this hotel as it was very busy. You certainly need to book several months - at least 3 - in advance. We will certainly stay there again if we return to Honolulu.

Best deal in town! Less than 2 blocks from heart of Waikiki Beach. Walking distance to restuarants, shops, ABC convenience stores, McD's, etc. The hotel and staff are definitely old school friendly, smaller building/facility(although 6 floors), laid-back family-like, cozy comfort. Rooms are big, clean, bed is great, great shower water pressure (my #1 criteria), full kitchennette, a/c, small pool with poolside chairs/tables. Special amenities, cheap laudromat available, they will loan (no cost!)beach chairs, mats, umbrellas, and I think they even had bogieboards, Also free lock boxes for valuables. Quick access to room~step off street straight into elevator and up to room~no wait, no fuss! We would go no place else!

We chose this hotel to save money, and we did. Great location 200m from Waikiki and close to bus routes. Our bed was great, room was clean, and had all we needed. But the hotel is old and rugged, lots of kitschy stuff, and was full of old people - it felt like an old peoples's budget holiday place. It does have free wifi in lobby, no problems. Ok to stay here, but just know that it is a bit weird.

Ok, so if you are into 1200TC sheets and room service, this place in not for you!! You are quite welcome to go to the Hyatt down the road and pay 4 times the price! If you want a well priced, large room, friendly staff, 2 blocks from the beach and somewhere to sleep off way too many happy hour drinkies, you are on a winner!! Lots of returning and regular guests give this place a family feel, so does the weekly singalong sessions in the foyer. There is no wifi in your room, but I actually liked that. Yes it is a tad run down, yes the linen is a tad worn, but hey if your like me and like your big fluffy towels, pop down to Ross and buy a couple (we had planned on buying them anyway just did it on the first day and not the last!). Loved the kitchen and full fridge, used the laundry area, and sat around the pool most days, after strolling back from the beach.Looking forward to returning this year!!

Ohh it's terrible, lol going back in May. I don't want it to get too popular or it may change. Affordable, friendly and so close to the beach and shopping. Not fancy but what you save you can spend on tours.the staff are great and the room ladies very friendly. Our room was so roomy no just having to sit on the bed, I feels like home and we are spending three weeks there this year, now who could afford to do that at other Hawaii hotels. One last word Mr.Fong we love you. We love the entertainment on Monday night beautiful family hotel

The good: Everything else. The people were extremely friendly. The sheets and towels were clean & crisp. The building has real character. It feels like it's a throw back to 60's or 70's Waikiki. The location is good -- not right on the beach, but a few short blocks away. The price is also great.The bad: The hotel is old and generally run down. There is also some noise & seedy activity/crime from the nearby cross street at night.All in all, I had a wonderful stay.

On my 5th visit to Waikiki, I opted for the Royal Grove. My Hawaiian friends suggested I stay there. I had an efficiency apartment on the first floor near the pool. Yes, the pool is small, but wonderful! The ocean is 2 blocks away. My apartment had 2 double beds, a full sized 'fridge, a microwave, full stove with oven and a nice lanai with lines to dry laundry. The staff was friendly and helpful. Excellent location, near grocery, sundries, banks, restaurants. I stayed for 14 nights and it cost $540!!

This is the funky hotel that you would see in a movie thinking “wow, if only there was a place like that in real life”, well, it does exist. I have stayed a couple of times at this hotel and I have enjoyed every second of it. First of all, this is not a hotel – this is a very pleasant way of experience Hawaii in a way you will never come close to if staying at one of the other hotels on Waikiki. The staff is very relaxed and helpful, they are basically more like friends. The location is absolutely perfect if you want to explore Waikiki (300 m to the beach) and the surroundings. Just about everything is within walking distance (or a short cab ride). The standard of the rooms are ok and you will find all the necessary things you need for a pleasant stay.

This hotel may not be for everyone, but it was perfect for me. It is not posh but it is warm and genuine and reminiscent of what I think Waikiki was 20-30 years ago before all the development. There is no breakfast or restaurant, there is a small pool, but what there is, however, is charm and a sense of belonging. There are people I met there that have been coming for over 35 years. There was a neighborhood man at the reception desk who had stopped by to chat with fresh cheese bread he had just made, and he offered me, a complete stranger, a piece of it. The room had a kitchen with microwave, sink, stove and refrigerator and the Food Pantry supermarket is just down Kuhio street about 3-4 blocks so you can save some money and cook in your room. The place is well-worn but clean and a block from Waikiki beach and the buses on Kuhio Street. If you are travelers on a budget, look no further for an affordable roof over your head in a central location. Mahalo to Royal Grove.

This is a hotel with alot of heart, lost in time....The location is ideal (2 blocks from the beach and close to all amenities). I stayed 2 months and felt very safe and secure here. The Monday jams were awesome! The pot luck holiday meals were ex! Previous guests have left air mattresses, floaties, swim goggles, wake boards, etc. and they are all available to borrow. The rooms facing the pool are less noisy than the ones facing the front of the building as the early morning traffic can be noisy. It is reasonably priced and you won't be spending much time in your hotel room as you will be out experiencing Waikiki Beach and it is Paradise!!!!!

We'll be back! It's quite dated, yes, but very well located with clean, spacious, well equipped rooms and friendly and obliging staff. There is great eating on the same block, buses to everywhere 100m away and its 200m to the beach. We loved Royal Grove.

The hotel is a bright pink building and kinda sticks out like a sore thumb amongst the Hilton, Monarch and the other 5 star properties (what does this tell you – hell yeah, prime location!). Hop, skip & jump and you are at the beach. Centrally located and close to all the shops, farmers market, restaurants etc. The hotel is also right next door to the bus stop, you have a car rental agency right in front of the hotel, and a lane away from the pickup point for all day tour buses. What more could you ask for?? The room itself was quite comfy with all the amenities you need for your stay. The property could do with some refurbishing but yet manages to retain that quaint charm. We were glad we stayed at the Royal Grove as it met our needs. As for the staff – true Aloha spirit!

Every time we go to Waikiki we stay at this little hotel and we've never had a problem. When we go to places like this where a beach is available and so many activities, we prefer a cheaper place to stay cause the main reason is to have a bed to sleep, other than that we are never in the hotel. The staff were awesome while we were there and always helpful giving us information when needed. Housekeeping was very helpful and trusting as well. I really liked the Monday evenings here because there was music and hula dancing in the main area which was very enjoyable. The pool was always clean and the tables and chair area was always clean. We'll be staying here again in the future

We have returned recently from our 8th time staying at the Royal Grove, and made sure we booked for next year. As we arrived at the hotel, the greeting we received was more like visiting family - both from the staff on shift, and the other guests that are there the same time every year and have become friends - than going to a hotel. It was another great 2 weeks - the Monday night music session, the Friday night pot-luck, the afternoon around the pool listening to those folks from Australia practicing the Ukulele - you can't beat the price, the friendliness or the closeness to everything. Thank you Mr. Fong and staff.

The Royal Grove has definitely seen better days. You certainly cannot beat it for the location and cost. If you are planning on staying in your room much, this would not be the place to stay. But for a two-minute walk to Waikiki, this place cannot be beaten. Be sure to enjoy the ukulele night. Mr. Fong, the owner, and local musicians sing and dance in the hotel lobby one evening a week, and it's a genuine delight to be there with them. I am not one for all the glitz that often is part of Hawaiian shows. I like this real Hawaiian experience with locals. Get some shave ice at the Coconut Cafe just two doors away from the hotel--best in Waikiki.

We have just returned from our first trip to Hawaii. We had 3 nights at the Royal Grove prior to a 7 day cruise around the islands plus 1 night on return from the cruise. After reading all the reviews I was more than happy to book a room here and was not disappointed. Yes, it's old, and some of the furnishings are dated, but for the price and location it can't be beaten. The rooms (we had 2 different rooms, one before cruise and 1 after) were clean and surprisingly spacious, the beds were comfortable. We didn't need the kitchen facilities, but the kitchen appeared well equipped with the basics. We had air conditioning which the staff turned on during the day but we turned it off once the sun had moved and didn't use it, we left the balcony door open at night (not a fan of air con if it can be avoided) and had very little noise. We used the supplied beach mats and towels for a swim at the beach, and I was able to take a book from the library for my flight home. The staff were very helpful and friendly, offering to ring and confirm pickup times and help with The Bus timetables. I would certainly stay again, excellent value for money.

We initially booked a room without airconditioning for 55 a night. We thought, if you can sleep without an aircon, it should probably be doable. Don't do it!! The first room we entered, looked very shabby and had sliding windows (the ones that cut fingers when they fall) and two pretty huge plastic fans. We had 5 nights ahead of us with 90F at daytime and 75 plus at night, we quickly decided that we 'needed' aircon as a standard! So back to the desk and we got another one, without having to switch later that week. Kudos!That room was still being cleaned, it was the first and last time that week. The other days, they just changed the towels and did the beds. No more vacuuming after that moment. The room itself is nice, not shabby if you don't touch the furniture, as it is close to falling apart! It feels like walking into the seventies and not knowing better, one could think the room has not been touched ever since! The aircon works continously, so no switching on and off during the night and it keeps the room cold enough all the time. Then again, there are no windows you can open in the room, just the balcony door. The wifi is only available for free in the lobby, maybe the owner likes to see his guests every now and then, but in our room, next to the elevator, we just didn't have a signal. The tv was small by the way and shampoo only comes once a week. So buy it yourself!There are pans and glasses in the cabinets and there is a large fridge and microwave. Next door you have a great Korean place and a Denny's (with golden sign, other than red) for a fair price and the shopping centres are around the corner. Markets are there too, very cosy!Parking can be done two blocks away in a hotel, for 15 dollars per night. Don't gamble on street parking, there is hardly any and everything is one way traffic, killing!With the beach at the end of the street and surfboards to take in the lobby, what is the reason to really complain? You're in Waikiki for less than 100 dollars a night!! Just look through the old stuff, take this advice and save an awful lot. It can send one of the two to another Island for free and do a volcano tour. That's how much it is!!!

This is one of the best hotels we have stayed in for value for money, pool, quiet, friendly, great price, shopping and eating just around the corner, Waikiki beach 200 metres away, and buses pass near by to any where , overall we give this hotel a 9 points for all things.,Alf Meads, Auckland New Zealand, stayed 13th September for 5 nights.

If you are on a budget, but still want to stay in the heart of Waikiki, this hotel is your pick. My wife and I spent a week on Oahu, mostly travelling around or lying on the beach. We spent little time in our hotel room, but it was perfectly fine. The staff was helpful (they suggested a nearby cheap parking garage, they provided us with beach towels etc), and the room was clean. The building itself is pretty old and rundown, but it is tidy and everything worked just fine. Close to the beach and restaurants. Many people in the hotel were returning guests, most of them seniors, and they were really nice people to talk to.I want to emphasize again: this is not a fancy hotel. If you want all glamour of a Hyatt, go to a Hyatt. But if you just need a clean and decent room, this is a real bargain.

The price is fantastic and the location handy to all sorts of places.Not the Royal Hawaiian but still a little gem! We were really only staying for a couple of nights, breaking up our trip to Australia, trying to mitigate jet lag.Our studio room overlooking the pool was cool, clean and comfortable with a balcony...but yes, old. Being able to prepare some meals is a bonus.WiFi reception happens in the lobby or by parts of the pool closest to the lobby.Due to an ongoing travel problem we had to stay in Hawaii an extra couple of nights (I know, a real hardship! Not!)I was apprehensive about being able to book as I had witnessed several people walking in off the street looking for a place to stay, only to be told they were fully booked.When I explained my problem, I was told not to worry they could accommodate us.We moved to a room overlooking the street. Not quite as nice as the previous room but due to being over the lobby were able to pick up WiFi in our room. There were fireworks on the beach at the end of the street one night, an added bonus, as we might have missed them if we'd still been poolside.For what we wanted, the Royal Grove was great! Certainly the prices mean a longer stay is a possibility in the future.

We stayed at Royal Grove 4 nights while vacationing on Oahu.We decided to stay there after reading reviews on tripadvisor and Fodors. Some reviews were mixed so we we not sure what to expect. On the Oahu TA forum, several people strongly suggested finding another place to stay and said it was a dump. We were SO glad we did not listen to their advise.We got a nice room on 5th floor for $70 a night 2 blocks from Waikiki beach. Yes, the hotel is older(1960s style), but our room was spacious, AC cold, clean and the location could not have been better.We only stayed in the room to sleep at night and get a quick shower before going out to dinner after a busy day. We know several people who have been to Waikiki area and spent over $300 a night. We rather spent the $200 a night we saved on something more enjoyable.If you want a reasonable place to stay with friendly staff, we recommend giving it a try. Yes, it is not the newest or the prettiest, but it has location-location that can't be beat.If you are one of those people who expect a 4/5 star hotel you will be disappointed and I suggest you stay elsewhere. It is a 3 star hotel at best.

This place is such a good deal (and not listed on the major booking websites) that I almost don't want to tell anyone else about it, lest the prices increase. The location is perfect- a couple blocks from the beach and easy walk to pretty much anything in Waikiki. We stayed in the back building. We had a huge room/studio with nice shoji screens separating the bedroom area. A big closet and even a kitchen! No, the décor is not the newest, but it's clean and comfy. The pool area is lovely and relaxing. The front desk staff is great. Don't hesitate to book here.

We were looking for an affordable place for our family of 4 where we could potentially cook dinners and have breakfast in the room and not spend a huge bundle. A guidebook (I think Fodor's) mentioned that they were a wonderful gem 2 blocks from the beach in the heart of Waikiki Beach. We totally agree - total gem! Our room (which was actually two rooms, one with a double bed and single bed, and one with a single bed and the kitchenette connected to each other) was not overly large, but it was completely doable and the price was good. The downstairs staff was very personable and always were able to answer our questions. The maid service was wonderful. If you are into luxury or brand new everything in a room, if you need wifi in your room and aren't satisfied with using wifi just in the lobby, if you don't mind spending more money, then this place isn't for you. But if you're looking to stretch your dollars and still be in the heart of Waikiki, have comfortable accomodations, and maybe cook some of your own meals, then you may want to call this hotel. I tried booking online, but it indicated they were full. There was a caveat that you should call if it says there are no rooms availables. When I called, the man said, he absolutely had a room that would fit our family.

Stay here if you want a budget hotel in an awesome location 2 blocks to the beach. Had a a/c room over looking pool. It was quiet, clean and safe. Has a small pool which i didn't use but, looks nice enough. With hotels so pricey on the beach, i was very happy to be so close to everything at a good rate here. Will return. This is not for you if you like full service hotels and all the "bells and whistles"

This charming family owned hotel is right smack in the centre of everything. Yes it is old & there is no dining room nor breakfast served, but they do provide cooking facilities in the rooms, & right outside is a heap of fast food restaurants. My son left a good wrist watch in the room when we left & contacted the hotel when we returned to Australia. Nothing had been handed in but the receptionist (I've forgotten her name - but she is a blonde haired mature lady) said she would ask the maid to have a thorough search of our room & ring back. To our pleasant surprise the watch had been found & she said she would post it back to us in Australia. What amazing service! Book well in advance as this hotel fills up fast.

You can't go wrong with this place. Sure, it is old. But everything works and it is just 2 min to the beach! Great food is all over the place here, ME bbq is the best! It is in the same building. ABC stores just over the street. Internet works as long as you are close to the lobby. Get a ground floor place and it works free in the room. Pool is clean. Lots of stuff to take to the beach for free like chairs etc. We had a pool room and it had ac, kitchen, tv, toaster, micro, fridge, backyard, and table off the front door to the pool area. The hotel had its own laundry we could use for cheap and they sold soap for it. Noise was never a problem. We were out and about most of the time but when we needed to sleep it was just fine. Great place to stay if you don't need high price stuff. I just loved thinking of all the money we did not spend sleeping! It made for better shopping.

We first stayed at the Royal Grove some 10 years ago, so decided to chose it once more, having first read the updated reviews and been suitably impressed.We were not wrong.First the staff: Absolutely amazing and couldn't bee more helpful if they tried.Second: Value for money - unbeatable.Third: Location - very handy to Waikiki Beach, transport, restaurants, shops etc.Bonus: A small swimming pool.Okay, so the hotel and the rooms are a bit dated, but all the important equipment works.Would we stay there again? Absolutely!

This was the second time we have stayed at the "Little Pink Palace" and we would nerver consider staying anywhere else in Waikiki. Perfect location and great price!! We travel from NZ so spend a fair but on airfares and when you spend your days at the beach, or for a change of scenery at the pool, you don't want to be spending heaps on a room. We stayed in the old wing and our room was great - clean and enough room to get organised for our days out and about and a small balcony to sit at night for a game of cards and a quick drink before wandering out for something to eat. Sure it was noisy but we knew it was going to be so bought some earplugs.Ruffage round the corner great for a sandwich and smoothie. PF Changs great for happy hour food. We stayed for 14 nights and we will be ack and book the same room. If you want a relaxing beach holiday and want to stay in a clean, tidy and friendly 'no frills' place that is great value then this is the place.

My 4th. trip to Honolulu and first at royal Grove. I told myself this was my last trip, but after my stay, I can hardly wait to go back to this charming hotel. Wow what a great little place. Grocery store near by. Everything you could need. Love it.

For the price this truly can't be beat. 5 stars for value, 3 stars for accommodation itself. In a great location a few blocks from the beach. Had a air con room which was very spacy and clean. Sure, the room looked a little old and worn, but it was still very pleasant. Eat at the Japanese place across the street. Would definitely stay here again.

This is my 2nd visit and I was very keen to get in again. There's a full small kitchen w' a huge frig, toaster and microwave. Not to repeat all the other good reviews, but I will say that it is reassuringly comfortable. It did remind me of my nanna's place when I saw a little piece of hand darning on the bed spread and on the edge of a sheet, I felt quite at home. It was all very clean and a little retro. I took quite a few basic supplies as my suitcase was almost empty as I planned to do shopping there. I took a little bit of washing up liquid and a dish sponge; some breakfast cereal (which I declared and was allowed to keep); some peanut butter and quite a few other bits of basic foods. Plus, a skirt hanger for when I washed out my shorts at night, all my own toiletries etc. Only basic soap provided.The aircon was terrific and covered up all outside noise. I booked a room over looking the pool, not the road. And, they very kindly allowed me to check in very early.The TV is old and the programs hopeless, although the drug adverts are intriguing (we don't allow those in Aus). The warnings on the negative side effects sometimes take up 80% of the advertising time and certainly warned me off taking them unless I was about to die. Oh and talking about dying, the hotel is completely non smoking.If you can't afford the 5 starts on the beach, I wouldn't stay anywhere else.

I come here every year and I love it! It's like " old Hawaii" used to be. So friendly and welcoming. Great staff and the owner, Mr Fong, is such a great guy. Ukuleles and hula in the lobby Mon. Nights! Yes, it's old, but clean and well kept and conveniently located...close to the beach, close to "TheBus" , and lots of live music venues nearby.

We were here for two nights and were very pleased with our stay. Loved the atmosphere and vibe.The building is old and not much has been done to update the facilities but everything worked, the room was clean (not spotless but acceptable) and the location can't be beat for the price.Since we were here for such a short time we didn't even get a chance to stick our toes in the pool but other people looked to be enjoying it. Hopefully next time we will stay longer.

This place is great if you want to save money and have a kitchenette. You can do shopping down Kuhio at the Food Pantry (the only large grocery store around the area), and cook your own food in the kitchen. The people working there are nice and helpful. They have bus schedules behind the desk. They have local music on Monday evenings, which is better than a touristy luau in my opinion. The air conditioning works very well, things are clean in general but a little worn in. That's okay since you're getting a great deal for being a hop, skip, and a jump from the most famous beach in the world.

Aloha All this so called hotel is very dirty and old. The place has bed bugs. That's why it's so cheap. You can find a better place. They only cater to people from Canda and Japan. They also don't like local people but they try and act like they have Aloha!!!They also talk to much about people they know nothing about. The staff like to tell storys about people. So be careful what you say or do there......,...

What can I say about this hotel. Not the newest, cheap as chips but so welcoming. We stayed here in 2006 and wouldn't think of staying anywhere else. Its not pretentious by any means. The staff treat you like family and I hope it never changes.We had an early arrival 7am and rolled into reception around 8am not expecting our room to be available until 2ish. Wrong wrong wrong, they put us straight into our room!It's a family run hotel and nothing is too much to ask. What we found there last time is that he people who stay the are real and easy going just like us. Rooms are older but clean as. We stayed ground floor poolside. Make sure you are there at least 1 Wednesday night for Hawaiian night. So good!Forget the star ratings they mean nothing. Read he reviews cos that's the real story for this gem in paradise. A big thank you to the Fong family for never having sold out to the majors. It's the only choice when staying in Honolulu.

This hotel is a great deal, the staff is very friendly and accommodating. It is clean and basic and just what we needed for a couple of nights on a trip to Hawaii. Spending so much time outside in Honolulu, all you need a hotel room for is sleep and shower, anyhow!

Its my second time at the Royal Grove (previous stay in may 2012) and I would go back there in a second!!The lobby is filled with caracter and history, old pics and surf boards plus a nice music show every week by the owner and friends. Doors in lobby locks at midnight, security feature appreciated when you are a female solo traveller. There are beach towels and some chairs you can borrow, plus laundry machines if you need. Rooms are simple but clean. They are a little dated but at that price I'm not looking at the decor. The cleaning equipment in the kitchennette could be more complete: you need to buy everything from soap to scrubbing sponges to do dishes. Location is amazing, minutes from the beach. Bus stop on the corner will take you anywhere on the island. There is also a grocery store walking distance. Overall its a great place to stay if you are on a budget and don't mind simple ameneties.

This hotel is an excellent value -- it is literally a five minute walk to the beach! The rooms are cute and very functional. There is a kitchenette with dining supplies and a fridge, which is perfect for storing leftovers and fruit. The lobby staff were very helpful, and the pool was clean and refreshing. There were also many things you could borrow, like beach supplies and board games. We will definitely stay here again when we return to Waikiki.

This is an older budget property in an excellent location. We stayed on the fifth floor in a reasonably decent room with a view to the beach. The AC was weak, but functional. The decor was dated and worn. But for this price - it was worth it! The staff is friendly and helpful. The atmosphere is more "old Hawaiian." The beach, shops, and restaurants are in easy walking distance. The kitchenette saved us money on eating expenses.

I was in Hawaii in Sept., I always stay at the SHERATON PRINCESS KAIULANI HOTEL WHEN I AM IN WAIKIKI THEY WHERE BOOK, UNLESS I WANTED TO PAY $300.00 a night for my self. I book another hotel, I was NOT happy with it, there was a convention in town, not many hotels. I when by the Grove twice, I finally got a room there for 2 weeks and loved it. It is a charming hotel with a lovely staff. The hotel is old but CLEAN AND CHARMING. LOOKING FORWARD TO MY STAY AGAIN NEXT YR.I booked a month for next year in SEPT. looking forward to seeing new friends I made while I was there.. I CALL THIS PLACE MY PINK PALACE, LOVE IT...

Have stayed here a couple of times and enjoy it each time! A nice short walk to the beach. Free wi-fi in the lobby, and friendly people who work there. We were here when the tsunami alert was on in October and felt very secure knowing we were in good hands. Monday night lobby jam is a wonderful way to spend an evening.Please feel free to browse the videos. Posts with aloha welcome on that page.https://www.facebook.com/yahoo#!/royalgrovehotelwaikiki

we stayed here for 4 nights in totoal. we didnt have a booking but they had places available. its in the heart of wakiki, very close to the beach and to the bus stops. we had a room which has your own bathroom and kitchen. downstairs is free wifi and a pool. if there is 2ppl its works out to be the same price as 2 beds in a dorm room, $65 incl tax. some rooms you can hear the loud traffic of the main street, but get yourself some earplugs and sleeping pills from the chemist and you'll be fine. or if your a heavy sleeper, it won't worry you. if you book in advance try to get a room which is away from the main street. i had a great time staying here. you can catch a cab to the airport for $35 or get a shuttle for $11pp. great staff, clean rooms, what more do u need?

We stayed at he Royal Grove Hotel in Waikiki in late October 2012. Our decision was based on the many glowing reviews on TripAdvisor & elsewhere, and we were not disappointed.From our first contact by email, the staff were very friendly & welcoming, and they remained so throughout our stay. I made a mistake in my booking (had the dates wrong, having forgotten about the International Date Line), but they were able to give us a room for the first night, and then moved us to another one the next day.The accommodation as stated in other reviews was a bit "retro", but comfortable & well-equipped for a self-catering room. The pool was a nice treat, and the wifi access in the lobby & breezeway was very handy. The location was only a short walk to the beach & all the popular Waikiki spots.From the moment we checked in, we could tell that many "regulars" stayed there & had been doing so for some time. That's always a sign of a good place.What impressed us ore than anything was the care and common sense displayed by the staff during the tsunami scare that occurred during our stay. They were quick to relocate all the guests to the 4th & 5th floors during the warning period, and kept everyone well informed of the situation at all times. Throughout this, they remained calm & kept the rest of us from worrying too much. Thankfully the tsunami was a non-event, but the staff were very organised & reassuring throughout.We would happily stay here again!

The street noise was horrible, really loud, night and day. There was no way to stop the sound of buses, trucks, cars, sirens. I couldn't understand why the street noise from Uluniu Ave and Kuhio Street were bouncing through the room on both sides.  The room itself was tiny but clean and ok for the price. It had no lanai or air conditioning, so a fan would be welcome. A square table for two would fit into the room much better and an inexpensive lamp would be nice.Thanksgiving Pot luck dinner was enjoyable, the band was great and the dancing lovely - Mahalo.I would stay here again but never in the old section, it's too damn noisy.

It is an older building, but what do you expect in Hawaii without paying ridiculous resort $$$. 2 double bed (which we pushed together), kitchenette, bathroom, with microwave, but no ac (which we didn't mind because its was October so it wasn't hot at all). The staff was very friendly, we had little interaction as we knew where we needed to go. The pool is nice if you don't want to walk the block to Waikiki Beach ( such a plus ). The hotel was close to a lot of things. There is a convinient store (ABC Store), a couple of tiny restaurants within the same block and some fancy restaurants within walking distance. Lots of stores to go to, there They also saved us $$ by pointing to a low cost parking garage about 2 blocks from the hotel. Now its clear why they have so much returning business.It was a little noisy, but we didn't mind as the ended we were so tired to notice.If you plan to spend a lot of time NOT in your hotel room. This is the place for you.

I stayed here for nine nights in september. Booked my room online, needed to make a change this was easy to do by phone with no hassel.I arrived around 8pm and the hotel. First Impression old but safe and clean.Room was really big for the price I paid 64.29 usd a night for a dubble bed, even had an extra bed also. 501 located on the 5th floor. It was hot in the room and AC was working but made a heck of a noise. Well tierd after 14 hour flight from YYZ i fell asleep. Next morning I woke up and had a nice swim. During this time I put on the AC at max. speed. Well when I got back to my room 1h later i noticed carpet was wet. The AC had broken down. Well No worries, went to speak with the nice lady In desk.
