She offerd me another room, wich I kindly declined cus I really liked room othervise. So Instead they gave ma a rough 50usd discount for the incident and a big fan wich more then enough keep room cold during next night. Day after the came and Installed a New AC that worked without problems druing the rest of my stay.So why would I give this Hotel a 4 star rating all this said:Well: The location is exellent. 200m or about 1 block from downtown Waikiki.From my room I could even see the ocean. Nice to sit out on the Balcony and eat some fresh fruits from the farmers market closeby watching the sun rise over Waikiki.The staff at the hotel is just so lovley. The made me feel like this was my second home.Always ready and eager to help make plans for every day. Nice to have a chat late at night.The cosy lobby is a great place to meet fellow travelers from all over the world. I even met some pep from Norway. (I live in Norway at the moment).The Value for money is unbeatable. Most hotels in same area will set you back much much more.In Total I paid 647usd incl tax. for my nine nights (after the discount and some other smaller changes).This hotel is a great place to stay for anybody who really dont think they can afford an holliday In Hawaii. Well you are wrong. With some planning you can. Lots of good flighdeals from Mainland USA and Canada. BA also has a direct line from LHR with fuel stop in LAX. The price I found cheapest on this was just around 800 usd returnfare.It's a bit rundown but the value is still so good that I would use this hotel again and would not hesitate to bring my family over also!

We enjoyed our stay at the Royal Grove so much we booked it again upon checking out. The hotel is in a very convenient location just 2 blocks from the beach. If that's too far for you, there's also a small pool. There are convenience stores located right next to the hotel and just across the street. The rooms are clean, though the furniture isn't very modern, but that's what makes to hotel so nice. It's not up to date, but has a lot of flair you don't find too often any more. The staff is very friendly, a broken fridge in our room was replaced the same day. We'll stay there again, if we come back to Waikiki!

If you are looking for a resort, this is not it. But if you are looking for a comfortable place that is close to the beach because you just want to go surfing and listen to music then this is a great. It is like old Hawaii. I almost don't want it to become too popular because then it might change. I really enjoyed my time here. If you stay, try not to get a room facing the street.

We just got back from another stay at the Royal Grove..Stayed in room #421 and it was huge. It's like a apartment-1 twin,1 double in a room and a king in another room, full kitchen,big bathroom and a living room and a dining area. Will always ask for that room when we return. No AC but pleanty of fans and windows-we really weren't in the room that long so it was all good. What can I say-Monday night they had live music down by the pool with guests setting in-2 hula dancers, it was better than going to a luau -they really make you feel like Ohana. They people that work there are friendly and very helpful.You are close to the bus,stores for snacks,and best of all about 2 blocks from the Duke statue..The price is very good so if your going there make sure you stay here,you won't be disappointed! Mahalo Royal Grove for a wonderful stay........The Reid Family

This was our second stay (the first one was 5 years ago). The hotel looks more or less same. It is a walking distance to the famous beach. The rooms are spacious with mini kitchenette and a fridge. We stayed from Sept 20 to 27th. The staff are friendly. There is a wifi on the main floor.We were allowed a late check-out at no charge as our room was booked to be rented that day. it was helpful as our flight was around 11pm.New air conditioners would help.

We love this place! The staff and all the occupants make us feel the "aloha" of Hawaii. The clean rooms have anything you need for a comfortable stay. Fully equipped kitchenettes- (Hit the grocery store first so you can just enjoy the ambience to wander all over Waikiki.) Usually 2 beds- 1 a full size the other a twin. Rooms have balconies- some overlook the pool and are quieter- the others look down Ulunio St and to the water, and all the activity near the Duke's statue. It fits like a comfortable shoe- a bit worn and scuffed, but ends up being your favorite! If you demand High class- go elsewhere. If you'd rather make friends and join in on a Hawaiian jam session and hula with the locals, then this is the place :)

We just returned from 2.5 weeks at this charming hotel. Room 604 had a balcony and every morning we had cofee out there and looked down the street to Waikiki beach and all the folks walking down the road with the surfboards on their heads.This room had a kitchenette,which allowed us to make our own breakfasts each morning,a big saving. We chose to eat lunch and supper out,but you could save even more if you ate in.The pool and lobby are warm and inviting,with many interesting guests to meet.People congregated here,for the internet access. Monday nights are the social nights with a group playing music and learning to dance and hula-what a blast!The laundromat on site was a huge bonus,as it was so convenient!The front desk staff are always friendly and accomodating,always ready to answer our questions and give us directions.The safety deposit boxes(for free) are a super deal!This place is so incerdibly reasonable,amazing since you are a 2 minute walk to the hub of Waikiki beach-LOVE IT! It is clean,safe and an incredible deal! Highly recommend it!!!!!

I stayed at the Royal Grove the first two weeks of September and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. It's definitely has a feel from the "70's but that a good thing. Reminds me of the times when I first started going to Waikiki It made me a little nostalgic and makes you wish for times of the past when Hawaii wasn't such a mordern destination and Waikiki wasn't just another big cityThe hotel is clean and comfortable, located so closed to the beach at a great price. I can't express enough how clean it is although quite old.If you're looking for clean comfortable place to stay and not expecting luxury this is the place.I have stayed at many hotels in Waikiki since 1978 and in my opinion this one is the best forcomfort, convenience and oh so reasonable rates

This hotel is perfectly located close to beach and shops. The rooms were clean and comfortable it is an older property but for the price and location we think it is the place to stay if you are on a budget.

Our family of 4 stayed in one of the 1 bedroom suites directly above the front lobby, and from our balcony, you could see the beach and all of interesting people from all over the world walking by. We tend to only stay in Waikiki for the night life and sleeping, so this Hotel was perfectly located. The room was comfortable with working Air Conditioning, and comfy beds. Reading some of the reviews before actually staying here could be quite misleading and unfair. The place is what it is as far as decor goes, but this "Mom and Pop" outfit oozes with warmth and friendliness. We were visiting from Canada, and are quite used to travelling around both Canada and the US staying in Hotels and Motels which would be comparable to this place. The only difference is that you are in the Tropics, and therefore you need to consider the amenities from that perspective. Whatever you decide to do, please don't underestimate this place, you could be missing a treat. Spend the money you save seeing the Island and on the entertainment that is readily available. The locals will thank you for helping their economy rather than supporting those already rich Hotel owners who may not even be on the Island. Thanks Royal Grove (Mom and Pop) ....for your hospitality, and treating us like one of your family.

Some people might say the Royal Grove has seen better days, but for me it conjures up the charm of the Tiki era – Hawaii’s heyday, when people were into Polynesian decadence, tropical cocktails and bright colours. Its location is perfect right in the middle of Waikiki, with the beach just two blocks away (a 5-min. walk) and the bus stops for the rest of Oaho just round the corner on Kuhio Street. The building itself in glorious pastel pink seems to be a remnant from another time, trapped among the towering skyscrapers of Waikiki. It has a definite sanctuary feel to it. OK, some parts could do with another coat of paint and some of the fixtures may actually be from the 1940s or 1950s, but it is very clean and extremely well kept. The staff are friendly and very knowledgeable about the island. There is also a supermarket and a “hole-in-the wall” Korean restaurant in the building – ideal for self-catering and take-aways. Considering what people normally pay for accommodation in Waikiki The Royal Grove is excellent value for money.

This older property is very affordable and is about a 60 second walk to Kuhio Beach in Waikiki, HI. Everything at the hotel was adequate and the rate was approx. $67/night during my September stay. Again excellent location and the place to stay if you want to save money and not splurge on a more expensive hotel. Daily maid service, small pool, laundry room, friendly staff.

Very pleased with this find. It's not a palace but it's not priced like one-I actually think you get more than you pay for. Excellent location, self catering (although when I reported to reception that our microwave not working, was told I was welcome to use the one in the lobby/common area. We were on the 6th floor-not practical). However we did have a stove and oven as well. Also air con not particularly effective, except when I laid on the floor one night, directly under. Thankfully end of summer, so not insufferable. A couple of staff were incredibly helpful and friendly. No name badges so I can't give names.

I stayed 6 nights from August 14 to 20. I had room 422....twin room with overseized furniture, small kitchen and ensuite bathroom. Price: $55+tax. / night = $376 total! Ok, the room was "ok"....old, tired, "smelly" and not very clean BUT only 2 minutes walk to Kuhio beach: I went there beacause I was on a budget. I was on a 3 weeks vacation ( cairns+sydney+LA+Honolulu) so I had to be careful with hotels....However, the place is alright for people that don't spend their time in their rooms. If you want a better room they have a highy category with AC and "lanai". If I ever return to the lodge, I will certainly choose one those "premium rooms" but again, if you have to fork out 100 dollars, the other hotels offer sometimes bargains that make the Royal Grove" look expensive. The place itself is a little old but you feel safe....Well, you know, for 55 bucks... what do you expect? FYI: the computer is $1 /10 minutes and it's very, very slow.....

We picked the Royal Grove because you can stay here for a week for the cost of 2 nights at the Hyatt just down the block. However, do NOT stay here if you travel to "be in the hotel." It's just not that kind of place. The room, as the hotel, is utilitarian but not beautiful in the "Architectural Digest" sense. The Royal Grove provides perfect accommodation for those who are not there to be in the room but want a clean, safe, room for sleep and clean up. The kitchenette was very handy--included a toaster, microwave, and coffee maker. The lanai was a pleasant addition to a spacious room. The pool was a nice plus and was in shade for part of the day--no sunburn--and often I was the only person in the pool. The Hawaiian music in the lobby on Monday night was an unexpected bonus. The staff are friendly and helpful. Arriving just after noon on a trans-Pacific flight from Asia we didn't expect our room to be ready until official check-in time but we were able to go directly to our room and crash.Next time we hope to have a room on the pool courtyard. Our room faced the street which was noisy enough to prevent deep sleep. Running the a/c unit provided enough white noise to mask most of it.Also, since carry-on is the only way we travel, we were able to get to the hotel in just an hour from the airport for $2.50 each. Numerous bus lines from the bus stop half a block away provide transportation to just about anywhere you'd want to go for the same price.For those who need it, there is vegan restaurant in the building on the ground floor on the Kuhio Ave. side of the hotel.

We stayed for 2 weeks and enjoyed it immensely. The staff are Very nice, friendly, and easy to get along with, and very helpful and knowledgable. The room rate was excellent! As we were so close to the beach, strip, shops and restaurants. Everything was close! We plan on returning for sure!!

We read about the Royal Grove Hotel on Trip Advisor. It is an older hotel but very clean and friendly. It lived up to the great reviews on Trip Advisor. The room had a stove/oven, full-sized refrigerator, sink, microwave, coffee maker, and toaster as well as dishes and some pots and pans. We had a comfortable standard size bed and single bed. When we got up we made coffee and sat on the lanai overlooking the pool, enjoying the morning. When we arrived, we were going to give them a credit card but we were told to wait until we checked out. How many hotels trust their guests these days?! The staff were very friendly and willingly answered questions and gave us suggestions. We often laughed and joked with each other. We felt we were with "family." There is a smaller, very clean pool that where we were able to swim a few laps. Waikaiki Beah is only two blocks away. The hotel has beach toys, mats, goggles, etc. for guests to use with no charge. Bus transportation is just across the street. There are a wide variety of stores nearby. If you want a "basic" hotel with friendly staff, this is the hotel for you. If (when?) we go back to Honolulu, we definitely would stay at the "pink hotel." We showed our room to my niece (a Honolulu resident), whose parents plan to visit later this summer. She/we is/are recommending it to them.

I keep coming back to the Royal Grove! I mean I'll admit when I first walked into the place I thought "oh, boy! What did I get myself into?" However, it's cozy, clean, close to the beach, and I keep coming back. The hotel is super cheap, the little pool is clean, and last time we were there I got invited to a wedding in the hotel lobby! Free cake? Yes, please! They also allow you to use snorkel gear, surf boards, and boogie boards for free! Just bring it back! Wow! It really is like staying at grandma's. The staff is super sweet but not in a superficial way. Infact, I love the staff, because they are down to earth, reasonable people. The place is quiet too.What you should know: This isn't a luxury hotel. They don't have the latest gadgets, decor, and there isn't room service (best little Korean Restaurant next door though!). This is an absolutely no frills kind of place! So if you're high maintanence, luxury minded gal or guy who tends to nitpick and demand the best of everything then this place isn't for you.If you like to save, be close to the beach, mingle with other travelers, and feel at home then stay here. This hotel makes Hawaii affordable. Place is great to stay if you especially like to make your own meals. Rooms with kitchens have all the necessary utensils and cooking gear. Pantry Market is around the corner, and can save you a ton. Also, the bus stop is right across the street to take you to many attractions.
Clean ,friendly , close to the beach in Waikiki , Oahu

We stayed there 3 nights during our last trip, and it was great!!! I must admit, when you enter the lobby, it really feels old, and wierd, having a reception like the old times.But that feeling quickly went away!The staff is really nice and helpful. We got there at 10.00 am, and they let us have our room as it was available, I work in a hotel, and I know that sometimes, staff can be mean, and don't let you in, even if your room is already free and clean.We were on the 6th floor, and room was great, brand new! huge fridge, which did not smell bad like other review says!Room was twice big as the one in the Ohanas hotel.Bathroom was a bit old and small, but who sleeps in it anyway!No problem with missing stuff when we came back from shopping. Good price, good location, good room and excellent staff. The only thing is that the parking is located 2 blocks away, at the Waikiki Banyan, it's 10$ per day, but it's really safe, security really checks people entering and exiting.I wish they could have a parking close by, but for sure, it's better to pay 10$ than 20$ at the Pacific Monarch. I read that some of you say you had to pay for internet, but I got it free in the lobby last time, and there was none in room??!!!If I may suggest something to the owner of the Royal Grove Hotel, change the elevator! lol , we were late for getting to the airport, and that was the time, the elevator decided not to work anymore, so from the 6th floor to the lobby, that was a long way for my hubby to carry our 6 suitcases.Lucky for us, there was the other elevator located on the 5th floor, on the other side of the building, so that helped my husband . But otherwise, that was not a big deal, as it was at the end of our stay.I really recommend that hotel to anyone, who doesn't want to pay high prices, for a room they will not be staying in all day long.Thank you again Royal Grove for the wonderful time we had with you.

We loved this hotel and would recommended it to the traveller who likes a great deal and a unique homey experience. A big step up from the HI Hostel a block away (we'd stayed there last time) for just a few bucks more per couple. Lots of quirky personality.Excellent location close to everything. Super friendly owners / staff and customers who come back year after year. Small rooms with old furniture and basic kitchenette. Small TV, AC worked fine. Small lanai overlooked the pool with small table and chairs. Clean and no bugs. Lobby decor straight out of Grandma's house, circa 1972. Lotsa books and magazines. Fridge to stash your beer when you are sitting around the pool area. Pool is very small but clean with tables around the deck. Computer / Internet available for reasonable charge.

We had a wonderful experience at Royal Grove! Although it's a hotel without amenities, it makes up for it in location and price. We would not hesitate to stay here again.I will say, there are two reasons I gave the hotel 4 'circles' instead of 5. For one, the maid was very insistent about cleaning our room (we don't like to have our room cleaned while staying at a hotel). We had only been there 3 days and she said that we have to take off our do not disturb sign because she must clean our room. This bothered me so I called the front desk and they informed me that our room does not have to be cleaned. I don't know why the maid was so persistent on this but she did not bother us again after front desk spoke with her. Maybe they are paid per room?Second, the mattress was hard as a rock. We slept, but we woke up aching each morning.Aside from those complaints, we enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay again!

You arrive in Waikiki, you go for that basic lodging, you intend to carry your surf board to the beach and back, barefoot ... you care for the pulse of beach life, at any time during the day and at night, you wish to shop nearby ... then the Royal Grove is the place for you. The staff is friendly. There is a nice little swimming pool, where you can find some calm. Free WiFi available in the reception area only, but this is OK.If, despite all your activities your sleep is light, bring a pair of ear plugs.

I stayed at this hotel for the second time and, if I come back to Honolulu it´s there I will stay again.It´s not a fancy, big, modern hotel but It´s cozy , friendly and many of its guests have been going there for decades !It doesn´t belong to those giant famous chains. It´s run by a Chinese family and the owner gives a party to its hosts every Monday evening. A group of 5 musicians and singers (including the owner) performs songs in Hawaiian and English, then there is always someone dancing hula and teaching hula for the guests ! What other hotels do that ?They have everything you need to take to the beach: towels, beach chairs, beach mats, kid´s toys, etc.The people at the front desk are helpful and nice. It´s 2 small blocks to Waikiki beach. You can also walk to stores, shoppings, restaurants, supermarket. Bus stop to downtown, Pear Harbour, Ala Moana mall or Hanauma Bay is steps away.The fact that the rooms have kitchen with all you need to prepare your breakfast or meals, is a plus. And there is a small swimming pool to cool off.

Where else in Honolulu can you stay for $67/night plus tax?? It was very clean, the kitchen well-equipped, comfortable, and the staff very nice and very accomodating. Parking nearby(the hotel staff will tell you where) is available for $10/day. Be sure to tell the garage attendant that you intend to return for another day BEFORE your current day expires. If you simply stay in the garage beyond your first day's expiration time, it will cost you extra. The hotel is less than 2 blocks from Waikiki Beach.

I stayed at the Royal Grove Hotel near Waikik Beach, It is a piece of the 1040's, and most of the Guest have been going there since then! It is family orientated, and "Old, but nice"....The owners have almost everything "extra" you might need, or had forgotten to pack, They let me use a wheelchair for over a week for free, alos available for use were surf board, snorkeling gear, beach mats, "Bogie" boards, and I think if I asked, they had it behind the desk!Great place for a family vacation in Waikiki. Which is definitly NOT for families! Very, Very, Expensive Place to vacation !!! But the Royal Grove Hotel is that jewel in the gravel... I would definitly recommmend it to anyone the "Just Has To Stay" in Waikiki Beach ........

I have stayed at the Royal Grove many times, and will be going back real soon. What can I say, Well for the price and being a few blocks from the beach you can't go wrong. Yes it is older,but when I am in Hawaii I do not stay in the room much-I'm outside enjoying the sun! But in the room you have a clean but older room with a kitchenette,dishes to use,pool, if you have forgotten your sand chair,toys or snorkel stuff they always have plenty to use for free.They are very nice and Have that ALOHA SPIRIT that many of the fancy hotels have lost.It is close to little markets,places to eat and the bus line so you can go anywhere needed.Remember,it is like stepping back into the past when you stay there..I love it.

I stayed by myself and while the value and location was good, I was a tad disappointed with the room and service.I tend to be a more "positive" reviewer... The establishment, room and facilities are very basic. From the entry to the hallway then finally into the room, was sadly a bit of a let-down. And I'm not pleased to say the staff were not welcoming... several staff in several days. I returned back to Waikiki after travelling around the islands and chose to stay at another property similar priced and much better service and room.Being in the tourism industry for many years and a budget traveller, I at the very least expect good service. Sadly, I never got it.

This is a great little place. Honolulu is not cheap, and this hotel gives value for money, as long as you're not looking for something flash. Our room was $80, for a studio with queen bed overlooking the pool, with small kitchenette. It's sort of old motel style, but was clean, functional, and comfortable. It's an easy walk to the beach, and close to all the shops.

The wife and I have Stayed at the Royal Grove many times and have found the hotel and staffvery good.The hotel is very close to all you would want to do as far as shopping and short walk to beaches.The bus stop is just up on the corner to travel all over the island.The rooms at the Grove are very clean and all you would need for a very good vacation.Why would you not look at the Royal Grove Hotel.

My college age daughter and stayed at the Royal Grove in January for five nights.After the initial shock at how dated the place was we settled in for a great stay.The one bedroom with kitchen was so handy.It was easy to stock up at the Pantry on Kuhio,so breakfast,lunch,dinner and snacks were easy.The other guests consisted of older long term returning guests and value seekers like us,always well behaved.The pool area is an oasis of quiet where people sun bath,read or play cards in the shade.The maids tend the rooms daly (they do not do dishes)with towels,bed making and bathroom cleaning.If you are OK with "old but good"this is a fun place with great value and convenience.

The hotel was clean, comfortable, spacious for the location and amazing affordable. We stayed in a two-room suite with a full-size bed and two twin beds. Exactly what we needed. We intend to stay at the Royal Grove for any future visits to Honolulu.

I've been staying here on & off every year for the last 40 years & have watched the hotel become a home & guests become family over time. You get what you pay for & the RGH is central to Waikiki entertainment. A block or so to the beach & surfing, snorkelling & markets. It's not for everyone but then neither is Hawaii so stay home & be miserable. Mahalo!

Great location, clean room at a reasonable price, and helpful staff that see more than dollar signs when talking with. Many of the people we met at the hotel, have been returning year after year, for many years.

Once again, I cannot say enough good things about my positive experiences at this hotel. I just returned after visiting from Novemeber 16th to December 1st. The lovely Thanksgiving potluck dinner, hosted by the Fong family, was a great opportunity to reconnect with other repeat visitors, along with meeting visitors new to the "Grove experience". I have always found the staff to be friendly, respectful and helpful . . .I visit here twice a year, for two and three weeks at a time. I am so looking forward to returning in April 2012.Mele Kalikimaka (Merry Christmas) to the Ohana (family) at the Royal Grove.

I went with no expectations but was totally shocked by how little we had to spend to be half-a-block from the beach in clean comfortable surroundings. I especially liked the well-stocked library and inadvertently left a library book from the Vancouver Island library there, which I hopefully will pick up and return for my $8 when we return in January.I enjoyed the pool and being handicapped, I especially enjoyed our suite on the ground floor. We do not live in the lap of luxury so everything was fine.Our highlight of our two week stay, including a week long cruise to four Hawaiian Islands, was the jam-fest at the Royal Grove on Monday nights. We were serenaded for a good two hours, with mostly Hawaiian music. It was marvelous!We are returning again in January.

Avoid this place at any cost. Not worth the cheap price. I booked a room months in advance which was for a queen bed and a/c. When I checked in, I was told my reservation was for two single beds and not a queen, but they would upgrade me to a room with a double-bed and balcony for no extra cost. I wasn't expecting the Ritz, but I at least expected the room to be clean and not run down. The balcony was covered in pigeon poop and the "a/c" was nothing more than a sad looking box fan in the corner of the room. The main lighting was a single, bare florescent light bulb in the middle of the ceiling. The hotel website also boasted a parking lot nearby. The parking lot was 4 blocks away at the Waikiki Banyan. That's not nearby. Despite all these displeasing things, I decided to stay since I didn't want to spend my precious vacation time booking a room at a different hotel last minute and paying an arm and a leg for last minute bookings. I figured that I would only be sleeping and showering at the hotel and not spending a lot of time there. Big mistake. My 4th night there, I come back to the hotel around the usual time of after midnight to find the doors locked to the lobby and the lights off. I didn't have this issue the 3 previous nights, so it took me by surprise. The night auditor came to the door and was instantly confrontational. I asked why the door was locked and he said those were the rules. I informed him that they weren't locked for the last 3 nights and he started yelling that if I didn't like it, I should have gone to the Hyatt. He continued yelling at us all the way to the elevator and when I mentioned that he was being cocky for no reason, he started yelling that if I wanted good customer service, I should have gone to the Hyatt and that I can just get out and go somewhere else. Mind you, this was around 1am. His behavior was threatening and unprofessional. I took his remarks to mean that I didn't deserve good customer service because I didn't pay more for a hotel room and he kick me out in the middle of the night if I didn't like it.As soon as I got to my room, I spent two hours searching for a hotel that could accommodate me with a room on the fly. The next morning I went to the desk to check out from this dump. The clerk said that the night auditor accused me of swearing at him for the doors being locked. As I tried to explain to her what really happened, she picked up the phone and pretended to make a call. During her fake call, she printed up the check out bill and ran my card. I commented that I shouldn't have to pay for the day of check out since it was the night auditor's behavior that made me check out early. She just gave me a blank look and an insincere half-baked apology for what had happened.When I got back home, I filed a complaint with the BBB. That was a waste of time. The hotel manager's response was drivel. He even proved himself a liar by stating that it was a matter of fact that the parking lot was 2 blocks away. Any paper map or even Google Maps will show that the Waikiki Banyan is 4 blocks away. You go a 1/2 block NE on Uluniu Ave to Kuhio Ave, then 3 1/2 blocks E to the Waikiki Banyan. He claimed that the doors are locked for security measure. Bull! The night auditor didn't even check if we were actual guests of the hotel before letting us in. And how is turning off the lights part of security measures? Plus, if you're going to lock the doors, someone should have mentioned that at check in or at least post a note on the door. I've stayed at a lot of hotels in Waikiki over the years and NONE of them lock their lobby doors. I was under the belief that I was staying in a hotel, not a dorm!I was born and raised in Honolulu and the Royal Grove is shameful. No aloha whatsoever. This experience definitely marred my vacation.

I have stayed here during many trips to Honolulu at least 6 times. I try to go twice a year. Very few local places left, especially close to the beach. Don't give me a 4-5 star hotel when I'm there. I want the true feel, smell and experience of the Island. I've gone alone and occasionally brought my spouse. Very safe, clean, friendly, with full kitchens, bus stop across the street, shopping...anything you could want. I stay at least 2 weeks each time and love every second. The staff is absolutely the best!!!

This was our second stay at the Royal Grove, first time was only 3 or 4 days, this time 8 days, next time much longer. It is so close to everywhere. Our uncle used to stay here every year since l960's so we reckoned if he liked it it was Ok for us and it is the best - suits our needs, we had the same room at front as last time (bit noisy when refuse wagon comes round early) but one cant have everything tho this hotel does have beach stuff if you need it. We had a view of the beach thru the palmtree, a very comfortable bed, A/C, full size fridge/freezer, full size cooker and microwave, food store and restaurants on ground floor in building, plus lots a short walk away, Food Pantry good place to stock up at. Ask reception if you need a safety deposit box. 2 minutes walk to beach, International Market a couple blocks away, bus stops round the corner, Royal Grove Reception staff are a mine of information and very knowlegable about which bus to take wherever you want to go and its the best way to get round the Island (be sure to visit the Iolani Palace). Try to be there on Monday nights for local music it is first class and great atmosphere. Pool is good to cool off in and catch up on tan, quiet in mornings. Altho it is a budget class hotel it ticks all the right boxes for us and we highly recommend it for travellers of all ages. We will definitely be returning to this Hotel in the future.

It's an older hotel, but for the money it's a frugal traveler's best choice at Wakiki. Our corner room had a wrap-around balcony, kitchenette, two beds and lots of room. The staff was friendly and helpful. There are three restaurants and one conveneinece store in the building. And best of all, the beach and the nightlife were a tiny walk from the hotel.

I was a guest for 17 days at the Royal Grove. I was very impressed by the size of the room and its amenities. I had a full four burner stove and full size fridege in my room which allowed me to save even more of my budget by not having to ear out every day. The bed was very comfortable. The staff were very friendly, (always remembering my name what room I occupied). What I enjoyed the most was the Monday evening musical event. held at the hotel. Both staff and guests made me feel that I was in my second home. The only concern I had was, that in my opinion, the dusting and vacuuming could have been done a little more thoroughly, but certainly nothing that would prevent me from gladly staying there again.

I had the pleasure to stay at the Royal Grove Hotel from December 19-26, 2010. Donna and the rest of the staff were so helpful - offering advice and tips that turned out to be great! The hotel has guests who come and stay every year, and even those guests were helpful! I loved having access to laundry facilities. Since I was there during Christmas, I got to go to their annual Christmas party. It made me feel like I hadn't completely missed out on my Christmas at home! The Sunset Jammer band played and sang carols - some even played barefooted - I loved it! It isn't a new, upscale, fancy place...just make yourself at home...and isn't that better anyway?!

We stayed for 14 nights sept/Oct 2010Its a really old hotel,very old furniture,old carpet etc but we liked it.We dont care to have modern furniture we just like cleanFor $60 a night its a bargainIts like staying in a granny flat.We had full size kitchen,micro/full size fridgeSo if you are use to staying budget no frills you will find it okIf your a person who would freak at the sight of one hair in the bath dont stay here either LOLOur room overlooked the road,,so it was noisy and trucks did wake you up early in the morning,,but you get that everywhere.Location is fantastic,5 mins to the sand,bus stop are just a few minutes.We could get the FREE internet in our room which was fantasticPool is tiny but clean and just enough to cool off.We felt very comfortable here and felt right at home after a few days.They have heaps of beach chairs you can use.The same people see to come here year after yearAnd yes i have also rebooked again for next year..If your not fussy and want more dollars to shop with stay here

This is my third stay at the Royal Grove , and will not be my last . For the price you cant get any better in Waikiki. Located 1 1/2 small blocks from the ocean ,minuits from restaurants and shopping and night life. You dont need a car , unless your touring the island. The hotel is a bit on the older side , but if your like me and dont expect to stay all day and night at your hotel , instead checking out the suroundings , this place is for you . I dont want too many people to know about this place , cuz then when I book , it will be sold out , but , well , thats the way it goes. In the winter months it is booked up solid , so might need to book in advance , summer seems to have more vacancies. Dont expect any frills here , this is a basic place , but does have a nice small swimming pool , but who needs that when the ocean is a 5 min. walk away. Diamond Head maybe an hours walk or so, if your into a bit of excersise ,Grocery/liquor store downstairs , food all around , free coffee in the lobby , a computer to print off boarding passes , or check your email ,down to earth friendly staff in a family run hotel . Home away from home.

Was on Holidays in Honolulu for 10 days alone,though i could of easily gotten a better place to stay i was Happy with my choice.Took a cab from the Airport,arrived shortly before midnight cab fare was $20,checked in had made reservations in advance.Was offered a room on the 4th floor with a Kitchen which i jumped at.Dropped my Gear off in the room and went out to grab a bite to eat,ended up at a Jack in the Box order to go,return to my room chowed down went to bed.Next morning i went for a walk about to see what was in the area??,found a supermarket and bought myself a package of Balogna,loaf of bread,some softdrinks to sedate any hungar in the middle of the night,hit up the Fast food outlets for condiments seeing i was going to be there for 10 Days.All in all my stay was a happy one at the Royal Grove bed was comfortable building was quiet and was able to have a Escort come by for some company.Upon leaving during my 10 days i found out the local transit went right to the Airport so when it was time to checkout i took transit to the Airport fare was .85 cents compare to a $20.00 Taxi.There is NO Room Service at The Royal Grove plenty of places to eat,dine at.Maid Service Yes.

Once again, I cannot say enough about how completely satisfied I am staying at the Royal Grove. This year, I brought two "newbies" with me, my youngest sister and a good friend, along with another friend who has been to Waikiki once before (but stayed at a different property on her first trip). We had two rooms between the four of us and it was just right. Everyone agreed that the friendliness of the staff and the homey ambience of the hotel itself was a big part of the enjoyment of the trip. Coming back to the hotel after a day of touring or shopping (or in many cases, both) was indeed like coming home.It was also wonderful to meet up with the many return visitors from past visits, and to enjoy the music provided by the Sunset Jammers every Monday evening. I am really looking forward to returning in November for a short trip and again next April for a longer visit.  Mahalo to all of the staff at the Royal Grove for continuing to being there and being just who you are.

I love the Royal Grove Hotel, I've been staying here since 1999.this hotel is close to the action, without being "in the International Market place."The staff are awesome, and the proximity to everything just makes my stay simple & Easy.I've stayed here, even the years, we've had conferences at other Major hotels, I just head across the road and get the bus down to the other hotel. The money I save staying here, means I can shop my little heart out!Being from Australia, EVERYTHING, is sooo much cheaper, so I come ready to shop.This hotel, is not modern, it does not have photos, in the latest Vogue, home mags, but it is Home, when we are in Hawaii. it is clean, tidy, and fresh, with a warm family atmosphere.... I've bought many friends here over the years, and they've all loved it.We are not looking for a big fancy hotel, we're looking for a small in expensive hotel, that we can cook a meal in when we don't want to go out, it is perfect.We always land early from Australia, never have a drama checking in early, and the girls at front desk, always more than accommodating.The pool is enough to cool off in, and hang around, but waikiki beach, is just a 2min walk awaythere are ABC (corner stores) across the road, the 24hr Food Pantry just down the road, you have a computer with internet access for a small fee, in reception, and there's free wifi in reception/by the pool.Fast food is close, it's clean and friendly and seriously, who wants to spend millions on a hotel room you're never in?? once a week, they have a guest get together, and sing along, which again, just makes it all the more homely, family friendly... Love this place, it's my Favourite!

I stay at the Royal Grove every time I come to Honolulu. I make several short visits each year. I always get the warmest of welcomes and I am always happy with the room. As others have said, the furniture is a bit worn, the hallways are clean but faded (although they do have security cameras, as an earlier reviewer had requested), and the paint on the lanai could use some touch-up. But the whole place has a homey, comfortable feeling, which is the reason that I keep returning. There definitely is a time warp feeling when you enter - many of the guests are folks who have been staying here for years - sometimes renting rooms for months at a time. Next to the lobby is a larger room with a piano, computer for internet access, and a large table. The table is often used for card games in the evenings. The place can be described as "cluttered" but spending a few moments to look over a lot of the souvenirs and collected memorabilia can be entertaining.As an earlier reviewer said, this place attracts "regular folks" and I agree that this is not everyone's preference (especially someone coming to Waikiki especially for the upscale experience or for a special occasion). For me, I enjoy taking the Roberts bus from the airport ($15 round trip per person) and not dealing with a car - most of Waikiki is within easy walking distance, and there are bus stops a few steps away that will take you to more distant destinations.I am sure that Honolulu used to have plenty of places like this - and many were torn down to make room for the high-rises. I recommend doing yourself a favor and checking out the Royal Grove as an example of how Waikiki used to be.

You will be surrounded by big, beautiful hotels on Waikiki...and you will be paying much less--and getting the basics: a room with a bed, mini fridge/sink, small bathroom and a little pool. Overall, it was a good experience for our short stay, but I think there are few people that would enjoy both 1. What the Waikiki area is like, and has to offer (like high-end shopping) and 2. also enjoy this kind of no-frills hotel.You can walk to the beach, Diamond Head or downtown Honolulu (or use the bus if you aren't interested in walking a few miles) from this little place. Great location.

Royal Grove was a perfect hotel for a family holiday stay. We had a one bedroom suite on the 6th floor, and x-mas rates were $90 a night, a block from the beach - a price non-existent in Waikiki. There was a full kitchen with 4 burner electric stove, oven, sink, dishes, utensils, coffee maker, toaster, microwave, a full size refrigerator. In the first room there was also a dining table with chairs and two single beds with night stands. The bedroom had full size bed, a TV, dresser, a night stand, a full bathroom with tub, and a closet inside the bathroom. The lanai (balcony) overlooking Uluniu Street, was the length of both rooms, with two doors, you could comfortable seat a dozen people on it. Lanai had a table and three chairs. Looking towards the beach, you could see the ocean. Each room had a separate air conditioner, brand new and working perfectly and silently, with remotes. The carpet in both rooms was is good shape, the paint was in good shape as well. Furniture was older, but matched fine. Bathroom was clean, except the air vent.Beds had soft clean mattress pads, and clean sheets. The towels ranged from very new to very old, the oldest being offered at the pool. If you would like good service (we did), leave a few bucks on the pillows and in the bathroom and get good towels and fresh sheets every day (we did LOL).I chopped, fried, and baked in the kitchen, it was great. Gave some business to the store in the building. The big grocery store is down the street, and on that first jet-leg early morning, get an empty carry-on and load a gallon of milk, a pineapple, other provisions, some shucked oysters and wine (I did:) Thursdays 4-8 pm farmers come to the Waikiki market place, and it is easy to load with freshest produce and flowers for a week (we did).If you have kids, get a $25 annual family pass to the zoo ( a ten minute walk).Royal grove saves the beach paraphernalia left behind by the previous guests, and we had daily choices of straw mats, floaties (mats, donuts, boogie boards) that are stored by the pool. My daughter used the pool and enjoyed it.When we arrived on Dec.23, there was a concert in the small lobby, and as we have walked in, the band greeted us and sang us a Hawaiian song. I was assigned a long narrow lock box (like the ones at the bank) in the lobby, and stored valuables there when at the beach. The lobby staff was friendly and patient, they also were on the lookout for safety, trying to remember their guests.Overall, if you are OK with the retro furniture, there is not much else to gripe about. I should also mention better quality Duke posters decorating our room walls - nice touch of Hawaiiana.

The "Little Pink Hotel" in Waikiki will forever be our "place to stay" on Oahu. We booked 5 months early, & had a nice 5th floor room facing Uluniu Ave. Perfect for what we wanted - a great location with a good view from the nice lanai (literally 3 minute walk to the beach). The cost was very low compared to all other decent lodging in Waikiki, & the owners & staff treated us (and every guest) like cousins from the Mainland! Of course, this pint-sized gem is not for everybody. Those that require grand entrances, breathtaking architecture, and gleaming marble columns should ante up the $200-500 per night for those places. If all you need is a place to sleep in clean beds, have a well-equipped kitchenette (with plates & dinnerware!), shower with great water pressure (and hot water!), feel welcomed every time you cross the warmly decorated lobby, and enjoy the company of like-minded regular folks - this is the best bet on Oahu. For perfect convenience, there's a nice corner sundry & liquor store actually in the building on Uluniu, along with Me's Korean BBQ (great food) and the Coconut Cafe for fruit smoothies & much other good stuff. Music night was Monday Dec 14, and it was almost 2 hours of fun, listening & singing along with the cadre of wonderfully talented "Kamaaina" musicians that volunteer their talent every week. This night the musician lineup included a guest from Japan playing her ukulele and the hotel's long-time owner, Mr. Fong and his lovely wife. I'm telling you - that kind of simple (no cost) fun & shared experience isn't likely to happen to a tourist anywhere else in Waikiki! Queen Lililuokalani's famous "Aloha O' E" song that ended the show was heartfelt, and much appreciated by all guests - some Europeans, some from Japan, Australia, New Zealand and of course - the Mainland. Get the picture? A real international group of people - all with a common link. The Spirit of Aloha is alive and well at The Royal Grove!

So I read all the reviews about the Royal Grove and knew what to expect and my attitude was we're just gonna sleep in the room the vacation is in Hawaii not the Royal Grove .Only problem with my philosophy was you have to sleep there now maybe it was our room but the double bed was at least 20 years old and man it was uncomfortable thank goodness only there for 3 days .My only recomendation for the royal grove is please invest in some half decent beds.Other than that I'll only repeat what other reviewers have said friendly staff who will lend you beach mats ,short walk to the beach,major bus stops ,and the International Marketplace.

I stayed here about 7 years ago, in Aug. of '02, I believe. It was a good value for the price and location. I think I found it from Lonely Planet. It is within 1 block or so from the beach, and the zoo. It's typical Hawaiian, laid back style. I remember it being clean, a little worn, but that didn't bother me. It was nice to have a frig., coffee pot, and the like. It had a TV with all the channels. Hurricane Katrina hit New Orleans, so whenever that unfortunate tragedy happend, was the time I was there. There was a good Hawaiian plate take-out restaurant about one door over. And, a tourist/convenience store about 2 doors over which was nice to buy iced coffee and the such and put it in the frig. I didn't try the pool. I did feel a little uncomfortable with the security, or lack thereof. I don't remember A/C. It seemed the windows cranked open. I think there was an outside walkway to the rooms, but I may be wrong. A nice hotel would have security cameras in the hallways, and that would have made me feel better. However, when I was in Honolulu there was something in the paper about female tourists, I believe, Japanese girls, who were robbed in their hotel rooms. The one girl opened the hotel door thinking it was her friend, and got tied up. I remember it being in a nice hotel. Unnerving for anyone. After reading that, I obviously had different thoughts about Honolulu, that verged on being a little paranoid, watching my back, and keeping my wits about me at all times, especially since I was traveling alone. Please don't get so intoxicated with the beauty of the island that you're not aware of the potential for crime. When I took my rental car back, the agency said someone got into my car. I couldn't believe it! Whenever I went to the beach, I parked where I had full view of the car at all times. I figured someone got into it in the parking garage that I used near this hotel. Just like the hotel, they had no cameras in the garage. The rental car company said the door lock was messed up, and when they showed me, it was an obvious attempt at someone who tried to get in it. Nothing was missing, because I didn't keep anything in the car. It might be a good idea to not keep bags or anything in your rental car which might tempt thieves wondering what's in it. It was so long ago that I stayed at this hotel, that it might have become really shabby. However, I remember being happy with it, as it was cheap and in a good location. If you're just looking for an inexpensive place to lay your head, then this could be a good bet. However, if you want something nice, and the real Hawaiian experience, I would look elsewhere.

I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone. Our room was infested with cockroaches and dirty. Was not worth the cheap rates and will never stay here again. You get what you pay for and this is especially true of the Royal Grove Hotel.

you know your in hawaii but where did you leave the tardis? awesome place staff were freindly and made you feel at home , it is very dated ... but thats what is sooo coool about the place , in the evening the family gather around the pool and play their ukeleles and have a sing along , maybe not everybodies cup of tea , but its different and thats what we loved.

I had the most wonderful time in royal grove, i went there last august and it had been amazing from service people to the people that stayed there.. 10 points.. i would reccomend it to my grandma if i have to..

We went for our 25th wedding anniversary. Our first trip to Hawaii. Stayed 10 days. Loved, loved Hawaii. Yes this hotel is dated - the furniture is like the hand-me-downs we had when we first got married - but the fridge was new and worked, the mattress was firm and comfy, the sheets, towels and bathroom were clean, as was the room as a whole. Definitely needed the air conditioner. Two short blocks to the Duke Kahanamoku statue on the beach. We had a car for half our stay (so we got to see most of the island) and parked for $10/day in a roomy parking garage about two blocks away (recommended by hotel staff). The staff were friendly, laid back and helpful with ideas about where to eat, etc. Loved the hula and live music on Monday night, and even got to have birthday cake and ice cream with everyone after the jam session - Leonard's (?) birthday as well as a couple of other guests. And you can't beat the price!!!!! If we ever get back to Hawaii would definitely stay here again.

this is a small authentic run down hotel.I am being honest in saying it is rather shabby and perhaps the lure of the skyscraper with a view that has come to define Waikiki seems to be a place many would prefer... but... this is a friendly relic of the past. A feeling of being at your Aunties or Grandmas place, with many optional spaces. A large comfortable sitting area in the lobby, another large room beside the lobby with a table area with lots of chairs and a comfortable seating area around a pool. You are paying a very reasonable amount of money to stay here, and with the air conditioning on, which we needed in our room, we slept well. With a fridge you can hop on a bus to Chinatown and buy lots of lovely fruits, and make tea and toast in the morning. We would come back again. The other thing that put us off Waikiki was the agressive people trying to get us to take a tour, the blantent commercialism, and such high end shops... and so many people and noise everywhere. But this is what a world class beach town has become, a far cry from the simpler days. We were in Waikiki twenty years ago, and noticed how many homeless vagrants seemed to be sleeping in the parks... so sad....We didn't rent a car as we didn't want to add to the pollution, and found that this town that could be bike friendly (so flat) didn't really accomodate renting bikes for a reasonable price or have bike lanes etc...Thank you to the Royal Grove for the lovely music provided Monday night by a group of very talented Hawaiin musicians, and the staff for their kindness.

The staff were so wonderful and helpful. They answered any question we had to the best of the ability.The rooms were average. The hotel is dated, and there are a lot of seniors who lived there permanetly, but the location cannot be beat! It literally takes 1 minute to walk to beach! We had no incidences involving ;raoches in our room, so that was a plus!The only thing that we found troublesome was that we had to put our valueables inthe safe box at the front desk everytime we left the hotel to explore.

Stayed here for 4 nights in May 2009. For the price we paid it was an excellent investment. Room: small, dated, looked old and worn but was always cleaned (daily), Bathroom was extremely small (tiny...) but fine for us. We made use of the small kitchenette. Location - Excellent, Excellent..... 3 minute walk to beach and main tourist area. If this is your 1st visit to Hawaii or you want to save money on hotel's and speand it on tours, food etc... this is the place to stay.

Say what you will about the Royal Grove. We have been staying there every year for 33 years and have a reservation for next year. It's not the Hilton! It's better. The staff know you by name, they will do anything to make your stay as comfortable as possible, and the other guests, like us, stay extended periods of time because it's what we can AFFORD ! So, it's a little dated with the furnishings.....ok, it's very dated, but the bed is comfortable, the refrigerator works, the sheets and towels are clean, the coffee pot and microwave do just what they are designed to do, the room is large, and the shower is hot. Did I leave anything out? Stop complaining and just enjoy the bargain of a lifetime! Go to the beach and get some sun, or whatever it was you went to Hawaii to do. The owners and staff at the Royal Grove are super nice folks and if they grunt at you, grunt back! (And yes, that is the coldest pool in Waikiki!!!)

Whenever we had a question we could always ask at the front desk and the answer came to us like the Great Zultana at the carnival...always what we needed and accurate. Christy was exceptionally helpful and friendly. The room was just as described. It fit our needs perfectly. The quaint and kitsche atmosphere made for an enjoyable stay. The poolside is breezy and comfortable. You could always make a new friend in the lounge room. Excellent review! Loved playing the piano. Highly recommended.

We stayed just one night as a stopver on our way to Vancouver and thought this hotel was the best value so far in our three visits to Waikiki. However, as per othere reviews, this place is not for those loooking for 5-star appointments and modern decor. We shared a double room with our adult son who had a single bed and it worked just fine. Beds were comfortable and very little noise to interrupt our sleep and my wife is a pretty light sleeper. Staff were quite friendly and helpful - no trouble hanging on to my power adaptor for pick up on our return journey. Almost had to insist that they accept a tip!We love Hawaii and are planning our next trip later in 2010 and if we can't get any resort accommodation through our timeshare membership, I'll be quite happy to book a week at this hotel. The cost is low, the ambience is cosy/friendly and the location is fantastic.

Planning this dream vacation for me and my wife, I read alot of reviews. With some trepidation I decided on the Royal Grove. We were not disappointed. The hotel is run down by today's standards. The desk people don't care to impress you, and they really are not overly friendly. They gave the impression that we were staying at a very reasonable hotel 1 block from Waikiki Beach, so they are not going out of their way. Which was fine, because we don't go on vacations to stay in hotels- except to sleep. The rooms and the bed were fine, and the noise was not too bad. I had to laugh, because the reviews were right on. The pool was freezing even for Oahu, and we did feel the front desk person would grunt at us. The pool could have ice in it, and the desk person could grunt all he wanted. I felt safe and I was in Waikiki baby. I'll go back and stay in the same hotel.

Stayed here from May 18th til June 3rd and had a great time.Paid $64.00 a night and have no complaints at all. The staff Donna, Debbie, and Steve were the best. It was like I knew Them a long time. Some reviews say it is noisy, well everywhere in Waikiki has exactly the same noise. I've stayed all over in various hotels and You can't get away from it. It is called a City. Garbage Trucks early in the morning is probably the biggest complaint. All You do is get up. It is like an alarm clock. At the Grove They have about 12 surf boards, boogie boards, snorkel gear, and beach toys for the kids for no charge. Also a computer They charge $01.00 for ten minutes. The RG may be a little dated and the carpet might need replacing but big deal, for $64.00 a night and a great location You can't beat it. I'am sure The Hyatt down the street a couple hundred feet is$200.00 and up a night. If I come back to Waikiki again I would not hesitate or even think of going anywhere else. Thank You Tony R. Roseville Ca.

Had to write after seeing that last negative review. I have never stayed in a hotel in Hawaii where I have gotten better service and value than this hotel. I can afford to stay elsewhere, but I see no reason to throw money away when this cute, vintage hotel is available a block from the beach with kitchens and a pool.We were there for the last Aloha Pro Bowl (say it isn't so!) and we saved moeny and had a way fabulous time.Yes it's dated and could use some updating. And yet, I think that would ruin my good time. The people were lovely and I enjoyed being able to cook my own breakfast in my jammies before I met the world.Close to everything, quiet and has a laundry room! Yes!Go for it and get the week rate if you can.

We have stayed a few times at the Royal Grove. We won't be back. The staff and cleanliness have deteriorated (and to be honest we only felt it was ok to return because of the cheap price- but with package deals, you really can do better...honestly).Our feet were black from the carepet. Staff grunt when you say good morning. Pool- freezing (never heated up!). How about putting in a solar heater guys!!? Did not see the elderly owners this time. Their son in charge ignored most guests and only spoke to a few (hey your'e only paying $65 per night right, that's the new attitude there). We won't be back!On the positive side, the "club" across the street is gone and a restaurant is there- safer feeling. Food staff at Bubbles Eaterie in the building are great. Best salad for blocks. Winning attitude towards customers at Bubbles!!!

This is a great budget hotel if you are looking for no-frills accommodation. It is a little bit like stepping back in time, but thats not necessarily a bad thing amongst the bustle of Waikiki. Great positioning just off the main strip. I stayed in this hotel at the beginning and end of my trip - both rooms I stayed in had road noise but nothing that wasn't blocked out by ear plugs!! Friendly and helpful reception staff and clean rooms.

We took a leap of faith and depended solely upon the majority of reviews for this hotel and got more value than we expected. We only spent three nights here, and it was very much worth the cost (about $75/night, taxes included) for the location alone. The rooms were relatively clean, at least where it mattered, but don't expect to be able to eat off the floor. The decor... well, it's "vintage". It feels like a visit to grandma's house. The service... excellent...friendly. What I didn't expect was to meet so many travelers whom have stayed here many times before, perhaps even a little sad that their "best kept secret" was not so kept anymore. We had room 407 which had a great little kitchenette, a queen and a single bed, and a balcony facing the adorable little pool. It was relatively quiet, but if your a sensitive sleeper you may want to opt for a lower inside room as they will likely block out the sound better. If you need to access the internet, it's cheap.... $1 for 20 minute blocks. And you can even buy a small bottle of dish soap for $1 as well. Clearly these items are to add value and service and aren't money makers.You can walk anywhere from this hotel.... it's not much more than an average city block from Waikiki Beach, and turn in any direction and there is a restaurant or ABC Store. Parking was convenient, right across the street, and $12 bucks a day which might seem expensive until you look around the area. They advised me of a $10 rate, two blocks away, but the extra $2 was worth the convenience. And the parking is in-out parking so come and go as you please. The staff at the hotel were just as you would want.... friendly, courteous, helpful.... but also humorous! Clearly they established relationships with repeat visitors. They are on a first name basis with many guests.If you want a place for as inexpensive as it gets, without compromising your enjoyment, you won't find better value and locaton then the Royal Grove Hotel.Don't have the expectations of the 5 Star hotels across the street that cost $300+ per night, and you won't be disappointed.Visit them online at www.RoyalGroveHotel.com

I found the Royal Grove through reviews on trip advisor and was not disappointed. You simply can't beat the price. We booked our room nearly a year in advance which may have contributed to having a great room. 5th floor, corner with an ocean view. We enjoyed the balcony and the table and chairs that was on it. We ran the air conditioner the first night but were too cold and were comfortable with the window open after that. We only stayed a couple of days because we set off on a cruise around the islands. We all wished we could have stayed longer at the Royal Grove. It's not fancy but it's homey and comfortable and the folks hanging out in the lobby were friendly and made us feel welcome. I asked about a Royal Grove t-shirt that I saw someone else wearing. The t-shirts are as good a deal as the hotel. $5. but you have to ask them to pull them out of the closet! Kids were happy that they could tap into free wireless internet from another hotel. Could see if you didn't get an inside or upper level floor room where it might be noisy but we didn't have any trouble at all. Found the beds comfortable and slept well.  The Blazing Steaks place down the street at $6 a person for 8 oz. steak, rice and salad is too good to pass up (ignore the stark decor. or get it to go) Upstairs mexican restaurant (from Blazing Steaks) is good but much more expensive. I hope to return to the Royal Grove someday for a much longer stay.

I was happy with the location and the price was extremely reasonable. In retrospect, I should have paid a bit more per night to get a room with a/c. My room was very stuffy and smelled a bit musty. I didn't mind using the fans (they helped drown out the street noise) but I wish the windows had been easier to open to get some air circulation. Some of the room's furniture was also in bad shape - a lampshade with a burn hole, for example.I found the desk staff friendly but unprepared for my questions about Waikiki, the bus, restaurants, etc. I had guidebooks but would have appreciated a live person familiar with tourism in the area to chat with.

My wife and I stayed here 3 nights, as we wanted to have a cheap hotel room and splurge on the vast food and shopping in Waikiki. We loved it, the AC worked almost too well, we hardly heard anything with an interior room. The kitchenette made our left overs lunch the next day. Try finding a microwave and a fridge at your 5 star hotel. The Royal Grove is our #1 choice when visiting Waikiki from Kauai. One down side is no on-site parking. The parking lot is 2.5 blocks away and is only $10 come and go as you please. Minor set back but well worth the exercise. Plus for the missus, I would fetch the auto and return to pick her up valet style. Love the hotel and the friendly staff.Pro: lockable safe deposit box.

stayed at the royal grove for a week and was very happy with the service...they were a very helpful and friendly hotel. The location is perfect..just yards away from the Duke's statue and Waikiki beach. The rooms were fairly basic and needed redecorating but for the price what can you expect !! Recommended as a cheap option for Waikiki which can be expensive. Money saved on the hotel enabled us to do other amazing things in Hawaii.

This hotel is all everyone else says: kitchy, quirky, beachfront, cheap, and old. It is also the noisiest place on earth, and I've lived in New York my entire life. The windows are glass slats from sometime in the 1970's and as such, they never completely close. I was advised by a fellow trip advisor to stay on an upper floor to get away from street noise. We stayed in the old wing on the top floor in a gigantic suite (that hasn't seen an update since 1971) with a shower made for those 4'9" and smaller. We did not have a single complaint, as our Waikiki beachfront palace cost only $71 a night and was, indeed, comical. That is until we tried to get some shut-eye. I cannot express in words the noise level from the street below. It was amplified, I'm not sure why, and we heard every horn, every bus hydraulic, every drunk idiot on the street, and everything inbetween. I imagine sleeping at a 42nd street bus stop on a Friday night might be a close runner up.By all means, stay here if you plan on enjoying downtown Honolulu for its nightlife and are on a limited budget but please for goodness sake, put down several maitais with your dinner and drink heavily before bed if you plan on even an hour of restful sleep. Seriously, if I ever visit Honolulu again and find myself unfortunate enough to have to sleep at the Royal Grove, I would pack some serious earplugs.

Hawaii is somewhere where I have always dreamed about going to but was usually out of my price range. Thanks to the Royal Grove I was able to enjoy a 10 night stay from the UK. Please read the reviews carefully, this place may appeal to many and at the same time not. The best thing about the accomodation is the location. Waikiki beach is a mere 2 mins stroll away, those who complain about the hotel need to spend a a wad more and head to the Hyatt Regency nearby. The rooms are worn but fine and there is paid for internet in reception as well as items you can use to borrow for a day at the beach (deck chairs and cool boxes etc) tell me another hotel that does that? There is also a self service laundry that uses quarters.I ate at the Korean takeaway (about $8 a meal) frequently as their plate lunch meals were divine. I didn't cook much as the number of restaurants around Waikiki was plentiful and cheap. As a single female tourist I never once felt intimidated in the evenings, in fact you felt safe as there were so many other holiday makers around.Get yourself a bus pass form the ABC stores and start exploring , the nearest bus stop is located about 30 metres behind the hotel. You'll never get lost, just look out for the Hyatt and the Pink Lady will not be far behind. I also travelled around the islands using a travel agency located next to the hotel, all the tours were on time and were of a good quality.If you are staying long term of wish to cook real meals which I did on the odd occasion, you will not find many supermarkets - head to the Ala Moana Centre for that!I wont go into the negatives of the hotel as I feel that it would be really unfair to, the positives far outweigh it. I will be surprised if the Royal Grove will still offer such value in future, snap it up while you can!!

Royal Grove is a great individual hotel. Plenty of personality and never dull. The staff are friendly as are the guests, some of whom stay for months. The location is good, a block from the beach and right in Waikiki. The rooms have kitchens and a balcony. Remember though that the hotel is not fancy and is quite old. I loved it because I felt really comfortable and not in a typical hotel 'factory'. My duaghter and wife thought it was just so so.

This place is a dump. Don't go cheap and stay here. It will ruin your vacation!First off, the room reminded me of college. Ugly brick walls, worn furniture, and an overall dirty feeling. The fridge was missing a handle, the sheets were absolutely horrible, and the shower was disgusting. We are cheap people, but this was a bad experience all around. For most of our trip, we heard this never ending beeping all night long. Come to find out that it was an alarm for the pool. It wasn't getting enough chlorine or something. The receptionist commented how management never does anything to fix up the place and that the beeping would continue for a while.This has been one of the only places where my wife has not felt safe and/or clean. We had to go to walmart to pick up some sheets and other items because the place was just gross.I read nearly every review on tripadvisor and thought that those people that were complaining about the service or condition of the rooms were used to nice places. I was wrong, this hotel really needs to be updated bigtime.Bottom line, don't ruin your vacation and go cheap here. Spend the extra few bucks and go somewhere decent.

this was our second time at the royal grove and we we're just as pleased this time with our stay.we stayed for 8 nights in a cat 1 room on the 6th floor poolside.the room was clean tthe bed was comfortable and the pillows are great which is a big thing for me.we like staying here and will definitely stay here next time we visit oahu.it is in the perfect location for the price we paid 575.00 with taxes for 8 nights.we we're there for 2 tuesday nights so got to enjoy 2 music nights at the royal grove.we got to hear the wongs and their friends play wonderful hawaiian music and see some lovely hula performed.we can't wait for our next visit.

My lady and i stayed here for 2 glorious weeks...It was an excellent experience and the hotelstaff were extremely helpful, gave us directionsand lots of information that we needed such asbus routes and activities in Waikiki...One of the great things also is the location...Close to everything a person could want...I know i was in paradise with my angel andstaying at the Royal Grove made it that muchbetter...mahalo to all the staff, especially Kristy!!!ALOHA!!!

I stayed there(by myself) Sept 27-Sept 30. My room faced the street the building is located at. Sure I heard noises part of the night but who doesnt when they stay somewhere. Heck, I'm a Motel 6 kin-of-guy and this was quiet to me. I stayed in Rm 404 which was airconditioned and I had a king size bed. Yes there was lint stuff in the wall vent, however, it is not used since you use the a/c in the wall anyway, so big deal. I recommend you have the a/c going full blast all day while you are out and the room will be comfortable by the time you get back in.The room was very clean and there was maid service everyday. I chose the Cat#1 room for $67. Look, all I need is a/c, a tv, clean bed and room and shower and I'm happy. I got up and left the room about 9am and didnt come back until after 4 or 5pm, then only for a short while, to relax and then go out and eat and then less than 5min. walk to the beach to watch the sun go down among hundreds of others.I utilzied the fridge by buying some local fruit at the fruit stands on the other side of the island and brought my own coffee with me. So all that was part of my breakfast in the morning.There is a small Korean take-out restaurant down stairs located on the corner in the same building. They serve breakfast; Portugese sausage or spam, two eggs and an ice cream scoop of rice plus toast for $4. Cant beat it. I saw long lines in Dennys for breakfast who wanted to spend more money and didnt trust the food quality from the small local eateries. Dont know why.If you have a car, you can park about two blocks away for $10 for 24hrs. at the Waikiki Banyan. The hotel has a loading zone which you can unload luggage and stuff and bring it up to your room then you can park the car or just take off.I wanted to use the computer when i woke up early but I was told you can used it from 830am until???. Dont know why 830am is the magical time.I've been to Oahu many times on vacation and with the military and for me, I'm not fancy, this will be the place I will stay from now on. For those who want the $55 room, they they get what they pay for; no a/c and street level noise. Heck just pay $12 more and get the a/c and up a couple stories and youre away from most of the noise.I will stay here again.

We stayed at The Royal Grove for 7 nights in July 2008.We thought this was a pretty good place to stay, especially if you are on a budget. The location was excellent - less than a minute walk to the beach, so it was easy to go for a swim without needing to take anything with you to the beach.The room was not amazingly clean - the bed and bedding was clean as well as the bathroom and kitchenette, but the curtains and carpets could do with a bit of attention! There was no air conditionining in our room, instead a ceiling fan and a bedside fan. We needed to have these on all night which was a little noisy and combined with the street noise, it meant I needed to buy some ear plugs!There was no internet connection provided in the room, instead a computer available for use in the lobby.Overall, I thought this was an okay place to stay at a very cheap price for Waikiki! I'm not sure that I would stay there again, and would only really recommend it to someone on a budget who doesn't really plan to spend much time in their hotel anyway!

Lets just say this.You can stay next door at the Hyatt for one night, room only.You can stay one night at the Royal Grove, be just as close to the beach, have a nice breafast out, take a surfing lesson, have a nice lunch, go on an afternoon tour, have a nice dinner or dinner cruise, watch the sunset, all for less than the room only at the Hyatt. And have money left over!!!!Plus have a nice hotel staff and feel like you are staying with family or friends.

Review of my month long stay (August to Sept 08).For the first two nights, I stayed in a One Bedroom Suite:This room faced the main road and experienced the afternoon sun. However, running the AC and keeping the curtains closed kept the room comfortable and had the added advantage of 'drowning out' the sound of civilization outside. (You are in Waikiki afterall). Bed was comfy and EVERYTHING in the room worked & was clean. Probably would have prefered the TV in the 'living area' rather than the bedroom, but I'm not in Waikiki to watch television.Spent the rest of the four weeks in 309 - a corner room with wrap around lanai (Balcony). This room actually seemed to be bigger that the one bedroom suite, but that is because the suites have two rooms. No major issues were experienced with this room and although I did not cook during my stay (hey, I'm on vacation after all!!) there was everything one would need right there - all you need to do is provide the food.. I also had two fully working refrigerators, and I made the most of the coffee percolator, even though there was also a drip filter coffee maker, complete with filter papers.Look, this place is not a dump. It's honest and great value. The staff greet you by first name from day one. The pool and surrounding area is nice and clean, plus you get all the added extras. Books to read, magazines and free newspapers daily, free coffee in the foyer and much more stuff you can borrow. Hell they even made dumbells available to me, so I could exercise in my room.  As for people complaining about fluff on exhaust fans - have you checked the one in YOUR bathroom at home lately? And sand on the Lanai? - hows about rinsing your feet at the beach before tramping back to the hotel? Found a DEAD bug in the bathroom? flush it down the toilet or toss it in the trash. (Bugs probably go to the Hilton as well you know....) These are petty complaints and a call to the front desk will have your "issue" sorted quickly.You know, there are Hyatt people and there are happy people. I like to think of myself as part of the latter group, (and I bet the front desk gang are part of it too). Big special Mahalo to Donna, for making me feel like part of a family. Thanks also to the Fongs for the great entertainment and a great place to call home, when I'm in Waikiki.Couple of points for those of you wanting to book:1/ Call the hotel directly for confirmation as email replies can be a bit slow.2/ Want a quiet room? - ask for poolside off the ground floor.3/ Pay the few extra bucks for an AC room if you're gonna have issues with warmth or noise etc.4/ Make use of the hotels facilities - borrow the body boards, fins, snorkels, towels, airbeds etc. (You won't find this offered in other hotels)5/ Finally, if you're demanding or pretentious - do us all a favor and book at the Halekulani instead.Mahalo.

Let's just say that if you have no problem with the budget, you probably shouldn't stay at the Royal Grove. However if you are the kind of traveler who doesn't spend that much time in the room and prefers to spend money on tours, this is the perfect hotel for you.
