The truth about this hotel is like what everone says, it is old, everything looks like it's from the 60s or the 70s, but it is clean, staffs are extremely helpful and friendly, the kitchen is fully equipped, the hotel is like 30 seconds away from the beach and 20 seconds away from the bus stop... what more can you ask for with their price. I would definetly go back again.

Some comments on here do make me laugh! We stayed at the Royal Grove from Aug 29th until Sept 3rd 2008, in room 609 and had a view of waikiki beach! (Apparently room 609 is the favourite room - I assume for the view)Ok guys lets put this into perspective, you pay 55 dollars a night, for a hotel literally 2 mins from the beach in Waikiki and you moan about it?! If you want the Hilton, which clearly you do by your comments, then go pay 5 times as much per night, and no doubt some of you will moan about that.Yes the hotel is old, very old, and the furniture, decor is perhaps 1970's, but one thing every hotel needs to be is CLEAN, and I was absolutely impressed with the cleanliness of my room. Yes there are silly signs everywhere which did make me smile, but as long as somewhere is clean, then I'm a happy man! I would have no issue in staying here again, but I do appreciate that if i wanted a trendy hotel with posh fittings, i'd be prepared to pay alot more in price!!!!All of the staff were really really helpful, and really friendly, which made it a perfect stay in honolulu

I stayed at the Royal Grove with my partner and 10month old son for 3 nights and we really enjoyed our stay there. The photographs on the website clearly matched the room we stayed in. I was particuarly impressed with how clean the room was as well as the bathroom. We had AC and there was no problem at all.The reason I say that "it is what it is" is because you are paying on average $55 per night! You can't beat the location and the service we received could not be faulted. My younger sister stayed there last night and is returning again in a few weeks. She is staying there with her best friend and they absolutely loved it!! It's very retro, kind of reminds me of old school family holidays...Put simply I loved it and I would recommend it to anyone.

We reserved three nights at the Royal Grove with an expectation of an older hotel with a great price and location and that was exactly what we found. This location for the price cannot be beat. We checked in to find a large and spotless room with a double and twin bed. The only thing that was not spotless was the air conditioning vent in the bathroom. I had read about this before reserving and even seen a picture that someone posted and really fail to understand why they don't just vacuum it! That was the only thing tho... The one complaint we had about our room is that is was somewhat warm in the afternoons. Our room was on the street on the southwest side with a wall of glass and with the sun shining (even with curtains closed) the window A/C unit just couldn't keep up. I would definitely stay here again tho and save that part of the budget for dining out and acitivities (and ask for room overlooking pool).

This wasn't the worst place I have ever been and it definitely has a lot going for it. My husband and two kids (16 and 9) stayed here for 10 nights. My husband was disappointed, however and thought we should have stayed somewhere nicer. It was a bit embarassing to tell people where we were staying but I spoke to another couple who were paying twice as much and their hotel was just as dated/shabby so the price is certainly right. We paid under $800 plus $120 for parking for 10 days. Really cannot beat that. Parking is not convenient but everything else is. There is a market downstairs and a good restaurant. Shave ice on the corner and across the street is another market which is open earlier than the other. My kids enjoyed the convenience of borrowing flippers, toys, beach mats, snorkles, (near the front door) boogie boards (behind the pool) etc and we walked to the beach nearly every day and had a shave ice every evening. They have surf boards to loan as well. There is a coin operated laundrymat open until 11pm in the hotel and in the laundry room there are coolers and lawn chairs you can borrow. We took a cooler to the North shore and had a nice picnic. They will also give you towels to use at the beach. They have hairdryers and irons to loan out. Laundry soap is 50 cents and dish soap is a dollar at the front desk (cheaper than in the market). Front desk staff are indeed helpful and polite. You can pack pretty light. Everything you need is right in that building. The closet is fairly large with lots of hangers. There were 13 drawers in our room (double with two single beds) so storage was no problem. For some reason our room had a multitude of mirrors which I thought was funny. Mirrors above each bed, back of bathroom door and in bathroom. Guess they saved on art work?The dominos pizza man comes around every evening around 6pm with small pepperoni pizzas for six bucks and he will bring you something else if you ask. One evening our kids swam at the hotel pool and ate pizza while we did laundry and checked our email. The bathroom was not up to my standards of cleanliness and I am not a picky person. I didn't like the mold around the bath tub fixtures and the dirty air intake. The maids were supposed to come in twice a week but as one of the previous reviews said it was hit and miss as far as cleanliness went. They never did sweep the lanai floor so we had sand everywhere. My pillow had a foul odor so I got a new one. Bed was ok to sleep in. We had to keep the a/c on all the time and turn on the fan or the room got too warm. Be careful, even local phone calls are 50 cents apiece from the room.The neighborhood has a fare share of vocal mentally ill people hanging around but there were always lots of other people there, even at night, so we never felt threatened. I wouldn't let my kids go out by themselves though. All in all this is a good place for a budget vacation and I might stay here again if I have the kids along. They liked the hotel and appreciated the beach toys.

I'm not here to question the criteria or discretion of my fellow travelers. I'm just flabbergasted to compare their findings of this hotel with ours. We arrived on Aug 7th for a weeks stay. I expected the location to be super and the exterior of this facility to be dated, but I was truly shocked by the interior conditions. We had a kitchen with twin beds and an adjoining bedroom with a double. Upon entering, we were struck by the obvious deterioration of the furnishings as well as the distinct filth. The kitchen table had a layer of dirt, the AC filter was clogged with grime, and every air duct had a greasy film fluttering in the breeze. The beds were barely OK to sit on, but we couldn't fathom crawling between the sheets. We quickly realized this was not for us; first impressions were going to be lasting impressions. We secured other accommodations and explained to the clerk that we were not able to stay. She was very understanding of our situation and there was a satisfactory conclusion, We vacated with no charge, and I assume someone was willing to take our place. To each their own, but we never unpacked!

my review is for the "old" rooms @ $ 55 p.n. aka old wing room as mentioned in lonely planet.the royal grove is located a 2 min. walk to waikiki beach and 1 min. from kuhio ave. (where most of the buses stop)we stayed 2 times at royal grove. the first time the room had twin beds and was very dirty,hot and smelly.the bathroom was disgusting and absolutely NOT clean (dust and the hairs from previous guests were everywhere!! even the floor was dirty. we also had a dead cockroach behind the toilet) the maids didn´t CLEAN the room not even close, they only made the bed, but only if you don´t leave any private things on the bed.i really wonder why the hotel has such good reviews- but i also don´t know the rooms w a/c. (in the new wing)forget sleeping, it was VERY loud because of the restaurant and traffic noise. the only positive to mention is, that the people at the front desk were always friendly and helpful.NEVER AGAIN!!!

My 18 year old daughters and I stayed here for a total of six nights, and it was the best value accomodation we stayed in during our three weeks in Hawaii. Given the price we weren't expecting the Outrigger or the Halekulani (though some of those who left negative reviews seem to have been) but we were very pleased with what we had. Quirky is probably the best word to describe the Royal Grove, and it certainly had a unique charm. One of my daughters described it as like a youth hostel with private rooms, and that was meant in a good way. It was odd walking throuhg the back of the restaurant next door to get to the stairs, but if that sort of thing offends you, take the elevator!We split our first 5-night stay over two rooms because of a mix-up in the booking that was about 75% our fault, but which the hotel sorted pretty quickly, and had a different room on our one-night return visit, so had a chance to see more rooms than most guests. (If you're in the main block, ask for a corner room - much bigger lanai.)All three rooms were pretty shabby and would benefit from redecoration, but I'd rather have shabby and cheap and save the money for eating out. As well as a microwave and full oven there were, somewhat bizarrely, two fridges. We were able not just to make our own breakfasts but to cook full meals a couple of nights, which also helps keep costs down. The pool was smallish but big enough to swim in, with plenty of tables and chairs around it. Internet in the lobby was good value at ten minutes for a buck, and you can print as well. As well as beach towels there are beach mats and other useful things you can borrow.Because we're cheap we walked two blocks to the parking lot that charged $10 per 24 hours, but if that's too far to walk you can park across the road for $12 a day.If you want spotless and newly painted rooms, go somewhere else and spend a lot more, but if you want basic but perfectly acceptable accommodation for a ridiculously cheap price given the location you will struggle to find anywhere as good value as the Royal grove.

What a wonderful week we had in this little pink hotel ! The staff was polite and helpfull, the room was clean and the price was more than decent.The hotel is located near the beach, at exactly 2min walking distance. Many many stores and services nearby, everything is accessible and easy to find.The only thing you need to know is that there is some city noises all night long around the hotel (buses, trucks, people). So bring earplugs.It is not luxurious but you got all you need at a great price.

Of the five places we stayed as we travelled around Hawaii, this was the best deal: a kitchenette and private bathroom in our own room for just $55 per night for the room with two single beds. It's also a minute's walk away from the beach, shops and restaurants. We'd definitely stay here again.

We stayed in room 507 from July 2-9, 2008. The room was fine, although I would suggest that the drapes be drycleaned; they were somewhat dirty/stained.Everything else was reasonably clean.The staff was always friendly and helpful, They were always willing to answer any questions we had.The location is terrific. On;y 2 blocks away from the beach. Public transit and restaurants were also close by.We felt safe the entire time. This is an extremely good value for the area. We will return someday.

My husband and I, along with his parents, stayed at the Royal Grove May 15-17, 2008 prior to a NCL Pride of America cruise. We had one of the Cat. 2 room for $90 per night. It was one that had a bedroom with a queen bed and a separate room with two twins and a kitchenette. Check in was fairly easy. The place is very old and really needs a major refurb. I was aware of the bare bones accommodations ahead of time, but was expecting something cleaner and better than what we experienced based on past reviews. I'm usually not this hard on a property in my reviews, but this place does not deserve its high Trip Advisor rating. I would guess it's because of the price and location. It cannot be for the accommodations. First of all, the pool was being fixed and they were using a jackhammer and some kind of saw late into the night and early in the day. We could hear it in our room very clearly, so that was very annoying. The carpet is in dire need of being replaced (both in the hallways and rooms). When we arrived in the room, the two twins had no pillows on them. We found a couple in the room, but we needed a couple more, as well as some additional towels. I called the front desk to have some delivered and was told to come down and get a key to another room so I could take them out of that room. I was told earlier the hotel was sold out so I guess someone didn't have any pillows or towels that night. The room I went to was even more depressing than our room.We had only one working air conditioner, which was in the bedroom. It was so hot in both rooms upon arrival that it was almost unbearable. It pretty much stayed that way the entire time we were there. We had to leave the door open between the rooms at night and put the fan in the doorway, but that didn't help much. We all felt very dirty the whole time we were staying there. We needed ice and I was told it was in the back, so we walked past the pool area down a old, damp, dirty hall. We opened a refrigerator since we thought that was the ice maker. It had spoiled food and it was disgusting. The adjacent restaurant used it. It was so filthy and smelled horrible. We quickly closed the door. I would not eat anything from that restaurant. We finally found the ice machine a bit further down almost in the restaurant, so we felt funny taking it. What an experience.I called ahead of time to ask if the beds had been replaced recently. I was told they had, but that had to have been untrue. The sheets, blankets and pillows are in dire need of replacement. If you stay here, make sure you bring your own soap, shampoo, etc. since they only provide one small bar of soap. The towels and wash cloths also need to be replaced. The ceiling in the shower had reddish looking matter splattered on it that looked as if someone had died in that room. It really made me ill. I tried to not look up when I showered. The vent in the bathroom had so much mold and dirt clogging it, it was disgusting (see photo). The window air conditioner was also moldy and clogged. There was a refrigerator and a stove, with a few dishes/glasses in the cabinet. You need to purchase dish soap to wash dishes. There was also a ice tray in the freezer, but we didn't use it. The coffee pot was disgusting, so we just didn't use it. There was only one t.v. in the bedroom. The main room with the two twins did not have one, so my father-in-law was not very happy. They didn't sleep well because the room was just too hot. The only bathroom is in the bedroom so they had to move the fan out of the doorway at night and then come into our room. Parking is another issue. You must park several blocks away and it's $10 per day. This was very inconvenient, especially if you have a disability. Finding a place to park while we were dropping bags off and picking them up was a challenge as well. We didn't feel very safe there either. What really bothered me was that both of the doors to the hallway were propped all of the way open all night long just inviting people to come in. There are a lot of homeless people in Honolulu. The doors to the rooms have vents in them (see photos) and you can hear everything on the streets and in the halls. Someone had kicked in the lobby door overnight and broke the glass out. There was a very heated argument between two strangers on the street in front of the hotel as we were standing there waiting for my husband to pick us up. One guy said to us "what the [--] are you looking at?" We were just very uncomfortable there. Our stay at the Royal Grove really made a difference in the enjoyment of our trip, or lack thereof. This place is just depressing. They need to spend some money painting and cleaning up this property, or just demolish it. Bottom line, if you are on a very, very tight budget, stay here. Otherwise, spend some extra money and stay elsewhere. We could not wait to check out and get to our cruise ship. The only thing this place really has going for it is the location since it's only a couple of blocks from the beach. If you are a young, single person in town to party, surf or whatever, this place is probably for you. You really do get what you pay for.

We stayed here for 3 nights recently while on vacation, based largely on the glowing reviews on Tripadvisor. Certainly, the Royal Grove is well situated, inexpensive and quite clean. Staff were friendly and helpful. The downstairs sitting area is welcoming and the other guests were pleasant - we encountered mostly younger couples and young families. However, the two rooms I saw could really use some maintenance. In my room, the top of one of the chairs was detached, one of the lampshades was heavily stained, window screens were clogged with dust and the walls were quite scuffed. It seemed like some fairly minor upgrades to this particular room would have made a big difference. It's possible that some of the other rooms are in better shape - I only saw two. Street noise (early morning garbage trucks, etc.) can also be issue, depending on where your room is located. Overall, I am not sure if I'd stay at this particular property again.

We had a great stay at the Royal Grove. Yes, it's worn and dated, but it is also CLEAN, inexpensive, centrally located and friendly. We stayed for 4 days at the beginning of our trip and liked it so much that we came back for 2 more at the end! Our room was everything we could have wanted - it had a nice stocked kitchenette with a refrigerator which we used to cook breakfasts (saving us lots of money). Its location (less than a minute walk to the center of Waikiki beach) allowed us to go surfing every day, walk to shopping and restaurants, or hop The Bus to anywhere. The health food store downstairs (Ruffage) makes killer whole grain turkey sandwiches (for packing on a hike up Diamond Head), and the smoothies shop made us so many yummy taro bobas that we lost count. The room was cleaned daily, we had fresh towels constantly, and the staff was very friendly - holding our bags while we picked up the rental car, lending us beach towels, snorkles, umbrellas etc. The next time we go back, we're going to just stay for a week...

I visited the Royal Grove on 05/20-05/23; aside from the weather, which was generally overcast with some light drizzle, I had a great time during my stay in no small part due to the Royal Grove. I arrived at the hotel and checked-in at around 3pm; my cousin, with whom I was sharing the room, arrived at around midnight (after his flight was delayed) and had no problems checking into the room after I informed Christy that he'd be arriving later.The really cool part about the stay (aside from the great price and the proximity to the beach) is the jam session that took place on Tuesday night. The owners (the Fongs) invited some of their friends over to jam to some Hawaiian tunes on some ukuleles, an acoustic guitar, an electric guitar, an electric bass guitar, and a set of drums. The music was pretty sweet as was the impromptu hula session given by the (daughter-in-law?). After the jam session, I had the chance to meet the Fongs, who as it turns out, have owned the Royal Grove for about 40 years now. Although they still own the hotel, the Fongs leave the day-to-day management up to one of their sons, Tim, whom I also had the chance to meet. I'm not sure how Tim does it, but the staff he works with was generally really friendly and helpful. Speaking of which, Christy, one of the ladies behind the counter was a total rockstar of friendliness and helpfulness. She wasn't alone in this; I was able to get directions to a good (and inexpensive) salon for a haircut, directions to a place for good eats nearby, etc. throughout my stay.All in all, I had a blast during my stay at the Royal Grove and look forward to another stay there.

The location cannot be faulted and the price does not reflect the little gem that it is.The decor is dated, the hotel needs an overhaul but that is also part of its charm. Even the parrot in the reception is a little bonus. Do not expect in room service or concierge (although they will do all they can for you) but do expect a decent sized room that has a fridge and a hotplate. I didnt have much problem with noise but then again we used to hotel for sleeping in after a full day.Being central you have all the shops you need in the area including small restaurants and takeaways.Definately recommended.

This hotel is really in a very good location, very convenient to everywhere. But the room along the street side is very noisy...So if possible avoid stay there. There's a Korean small restaurant next to the hotel, their food are great, very good value and very tasty,

After reading about the Royal Grove on TripAdvisor we thought we would give it a try and it did not disappoint. This hotel is probably one of the few left in Honolulu with genuine character. OK, so it is a bit worn around the edges but the hospitality shown by the staff, the proximity to the beach and most importantly the price more than compensate. We loved it!

Royal Grove was as advertized in other reviews. Great location, couple of blocks from the beach at the main attractions/shopping end of Waikiki. Our room with kitchenette was fairly spacious, very clean, no bugs, even had a partial view of the ocean, also quiet. The hotel is a superb deal at a price of about $70 night. The furnishings are dated and the room could use a modernization, but at the price and location it cannot be beat.

I had stayed at the Moana surfrider in high school as a kid. While in college, my wife traveled in Europe through Hostels an I did the same in Austrailia. We've seen pricey and we've seen budget. At the Royal Grove, we saw character! We absolutely loved the Royal Grove. We had a kitchen sink, cookware, stove, fridge, and were a 2 minute walk from the beach. Why pay $200 a night when you could stay here. Our ONLY complaint is that the hot water could have been hotter. My Favorite thing was the $1 bottles of dish soap that could be purchased in the lobby and all the free stuff you could borrow such as beach mats.

This is our second visit to the hotel. $55 - $60 per day. Remember the price and keep everything in perspective.Age/Condition of The Hotel: We were told that a man sitting across from us (in a motorized chair has been coming there since 1968, so the hotel is quite old). It has aged gracefully because of the care it gets from the staff (and the long-term residents who often come from Canada and often stay for 5 months).The hotel is rated as a 1 star budget hotel, but has so much care and Aloha that it really is 5 stars.Some of the bathroom paint (in the closet) was peeling, some of the baseboards are disjoining from the walls, the hall did need a good shampoo and vacuum. But- we thought there was new carpet in our room (a 1 room air conditioned room, with complete small full-service kitchen).Tv channels are not something to spend time in the room for. But, I would not want the hotel to spend any extra money on TV- in fact, save the $ each month that they spend now and take the TV out. Entertainment (Free):Every second night, there was music coming from the lobby. Music from friends of the owners (the Fong family) who care enough to continue to drop by to entertain the guests (for the last couple of decades from what we heard). There was classical piano music coming from the lobby, from an elderly gentleman guest, who wished to share his wonderful talents. New Years Eve- there was music, pot luck food, and lots of Aloha. We really did not participate, but sat on the veranda and listened to the lovely music and fun. I think some of the guests/residents make it a point to come on special occasions. One gentleman told us that he comes yearly, and has several children, nieces, nephews, and grandchildren,.... and he IS AT the Royal Grove. This place has special meaning for people.The staff have been there a long time, and this says a lot about the comfort they feel there. Guests/residents have been coming a long time, and that says a lot about how they feel about the place. We will go back again.Yes, as a reviewer said, bring your own shampoo. The hotel DOES give several bars (small) of soap, kleenex replenished regularly and toilet paper replenished regularly.For a place that supposedly gives cleaning 2ce / week for guests staying 1 week, the maids were really around 4 or 5 times out of our first week, and the same for the second week. ...They start working at 7 AM ! Put the "do not disturb" sign on if you want to sleep in.Not one bug! And I hate bugs!!! They regimentally spray monthly!! Cement building (not wood).Nelson, the maintenance man always has a smile on his face, and is always there, every day. Holidays included. He must feel like he is at home there:)Thanks to Steve (night staff), Donna, Debbie, Christie, another lady (sorry my brain is fuzzy), Nelson, Jimmy, and the elder owners Mr. and Mrs. Fong- and everyone there I can't remember the name of. Free coffee and paper in the AM is nice.Pool is cold- your shoulders are warm in the sun, though.Free items in the lobby to borrow (just ask the staff) to meet ALL your beach needs.** 30 seconds to walk to the beach. And we do not walk fast!Security- good because they lock the lobby at 12 midnight, and the hotel is in its own courtyard- very good design.**To book- look at their website and see what room you want first. The hotel staff are busy and don't have time to describe the rooms. Call for info. about availability, once you familiarize yourself with the hotel offerings. We heard staff refer people to their website. Non air conditioned rooms in the older wing are often sold out because of the low-cost... but if you can afford the air-conditioned room (our room had 1 double bed and 1 single bed) it is great because you don't have to have the window open. THE NOISE IN WAIKIKI IS TERRIBLE. A homeless man yelled every 2 AM. Garbage trucks backing up with beeps starting at 4 AM. Loud music from car radios all night. TRY TO GET A "POOL SIDE" ROOM. Very much quieter.Long-time returning guests are remembered and appreciated by the staff and management. All are treated with respect.We will go back again. Tip regarding travelling- if you can live without a car rental- do so. The cost is high, the parking is very very limited and adds to the cost of your trip. The Bus is $2 and they give you a transfer (one transfer offered 2 hours another offered 4 1/2 hours) so we got off, did something, and then got back on again. The most we spent in 1 day was $8 for 2 of us. We used The Bus every 2 or 3 days. Save your money. We went around the island on The Bus- even past Hanama Bay (great value for money !!). Waikiki has many well positioned bus lines. They knew what they were doing when they designed Waikiki and its bus system!! If you have a Medicaid card, you only pay $1. We are not American, so I'm not sure what you have to do to get this, but if you have this card, it cuts your bus costs down even further.All the best, happy travels, you will love Oahu- we do.

Clean, spacious, comfortable beds, full little kitchen, extra pillows and blankets, new rugs in our room. Small but clean bathrooms--bring your own shampoo. We were able to borrow an iron and full size ironing board. They also had beach mats, boogie boards, snorkels, etc. to use. Free newspaper everyday. The management had a very friendly family feeling.The decor is dated but our eyes were mostly closed when we were in the room so it wasn't a problem! There was A/C but we didn't need it.

We only stayed for 1 night, as I really needed somewhere with internet access.The room was a good size, but very outdated and in need of a facelift. The location was brilliant - a short walk to all the shops and minutes from Waikiki beach.Having the kitchen would be a huge help for those on a budget.If you want somewhere affordable and clean, this isnt a bad place to stay. But we ended up getting a great last minute deal and moving to a nice refurbed 3 star with a view just around the corner for $90+tax.

Just found this lovely hotel trough tripadvisor,and stayed there for 4 nights. The rate of 75$ for a standard room is by far the best deal you will get in Honolulu.The rooms are spacious and have also a fully furbished kitchen.So you can heat up your own food and pizza,which will save you also a lot of bucks.The location is perfect,just a 2 minute walk,and you are right in the center at Waikiki Beach.The owners are very friendly and help you wherever they can.Just dont expect a new hotel,it has already a couple of years,but in mu opinion,the by far best deal in Honolulu.Enjoy it....Jurgen

just returned from the Royal grove, stayed five nights. had a one bedroom room with a double bed in the bedroom and two twin beds in the living/kitchen area. It is a old hotel, but very clean. Our room overlooked the road, that was "ok' because the doves came to visit pretty much every time we went on the lanai, the road noise was kind of loud in the early morning (garbage truck and car alarms) but the air conditioner and fan really helped keep the noise down to a bearable level. The other guests were considerate with the noise level also. The room was way worth the $80.00 we paid considering how expensive it is in Waikiki. Would definately return. Again, clean, NO BUGS of any kind, quiet for the most part, close to the beach and shopping and food, what more could you ask for!

I was more than happy with my stay at the Royal Grove Hotel! I was told 609 was the most popular room, only forging out 60 dollars a night for a 2 bed room with a kitchenette, airconditionining, and a partial ocean view! Its 2 blocks from Waikiki beach which I could see out my balcony, and across the street from a little mexican restraunte, a surf rental shop, and your choice of 3 or 4 ABC stores in a 2 block radius, Most importantly, the room was CLEAN and free of bugs! The shower had good water pressure, which always is a plus in my books. I have nothing negative to say about this place! The front desk was GREAT, very friendly, and the housekeeping staff was always smiling and saying hello as you pass through the halls. I enjoyed my stay, and I encourage anyone who is looking for a cheap stay to book at the little pink Grove! Enjoy!

Hats off to the staff at the Royal Grove Hotel. If you are expecting the Ritz then you can go to one of the OUTRAGEOULY EXPENSIVE high riseHotels anywhere in sight. The rooms are dated of course, but clean andvery adequate. After all you are in Hawaii to see Hawaii not four walls of a hotel. Our trip turned out to be less than a vacation as my mother traveling with me became quite ill and had to have emergency surgery right afterarriving in Honolulu. The staff was absolutely great. Because of the uncertainty of our departure because of the hospitalization I needed to stay an additional week at the hotel. Because of the "season" beginning the hotel was completely booked up but the staff was able to find additional room nights for me for an additional 7 days. Try and find that at one of the other upscale hotels, I dare you. All of the guests at the hotel were very friendly and a very "community-type" atmosphere. MANY of the guests were regular returningguests from previous stays at the hotel. This says a lot to me. Evenings you could find a few of the local and family members of the hotel owners in the lobby playing traditional Hawaiian music for the guests. This place really makes you feel like you are visiting with relatives on the island and a party of the family.Had it not been for the friendliness of the staff and their going OUT OF THEIR WAY to make sure all of our needs were met, Im sure this tripwould have been a TOTAL disaster. Everyone always asked how my Mom wasdoing and when she returned from hospital, there were big smiles on everyone's faces to see that she was doing well.ONCE AGAIN, I cant say enough good things about this hotel. I travel quite a bit and can tell you, there wont be another experience like it anywhere. One hint though. Try to get a room on the pool side of the hotel as the traffic noise on the street side can be a bit distracting early inthe morning as is with most every other hotel in the Waikiki area due to deliveries etc. KUDOS to the ROYAL GROVE HOTEL.Rick ApfelbeckNov 9, 2007

Upon arrival, I was told we were "upgraded" to one of the two units they own in Pacific Monarch across the street. Shortly after we laid down to sleep, my baby started to cry. I looked and noticed some bugs moving around his face in the dark. Lots of blood came out as I crushed the bugs. I turned on the light. It was a horrible scene. There were bugs crawling on the bed and more coming out of the pillows. I called the hotel and were moved to the other unit they own in the building. We didn't find any bugs on the bed. But every morning I still woke up with bed bug bites. The carpet was filthy. One unit had a microwave the other didn't. The A/C in the living room can't keep the room cool.

Pleasantly surprised with the hotel. Very clean and roomy. Our room overlooked the pool. Our price was $66 with air, Kitchen, and 2 beds. Very good price we thought compared to other hotels. Very easy walk to the beach even for this old lady. Nice cheap place next door to get breakfast. They do not do maid service every day but if you need it just hang the sign and they will be happy to. The only down side that I can think of is parking. It is cheap only $8 every 24 hours but it is at the Kuhio Prince Hotel which is about 2 blocks away. Not that far but when you have been out all day and tired it is a bit of a walk. Overall I would recommend it and stay there again.

Me and my girlfriend stayed here in june 2007 for 3 weeks, as we were traveling we were on a tight budget and we came across the royal grove hotel online and decided to book one of the budget rooms for $50per night. This hotel is clean well run and great value for money seeing as it is just a short walk to waikiki beach. I would definately recommend this hotel if you are on a budget and want to visit oahu!!! i would recommend staying here rather than a hostel for travelers as it works out about the sames as staying at one of the hostels in oahu and is much nicer!!

We spent a wonderful week at the Royal Grove. It's not some fancy resort, but it offer CLEAN rooms, good beds and a good shower. Those were the important things! The location is grest, two blocks from the beach, close to many restuarants, grocery store, and shuttles. Paid parking ($12 a day) at the hotel across the street. The kitchenette has full-size refrigerator, microwave, coffee pot, and four burner stove, plus all the dishes, pans and silverware. We stayed in room 208 overlooking the pool. Free use of beach mats, snorkel gear and beach toys was a plus. It was nice to get the free paper from the lobby and have my morning coffee while reading it on the lanai. I felt like this hotel conveyed more of the real Hawaiian spirit than the big resort hotels. As long as you aren't expecting a big resort with lots of activities, you won't be disappointed when choosing the Royal Grove! At $400 a week, it costs less than you could pay per nite at some of the other hotels in Waikiki. We're already planning our return!

My husband and I stayed at the Royal Grove at the end of August 2007 for a week.The location is soooo handy to beaches, bus-stops,shopping etc.We found our room to be spotlessly clean, the desk service was very helpful and friendly, and the whole atmosphere of the place was casual and relaxed.We chose a room with kitchen facilities, as we were on a budget, and didn't want to have to eat out all the time. The kitchen facilities were nothing great, but perfectly adequate for what we needed, especially the large fridge/freezer.The decor is dated, but everything worked properly and nothing was falling to pieces. And if the decor of the room is of major importance to you, then you should pay ten times the price and go to one of the big shot hotels.Our room was overlooking the pool area,which was as I had requested, because we were concerned about road noise, as we come from a very quiet area.The only noise we heard was a rubbish truck empying a skip somewhere in the block each morning, but that is a job that has to be done, and it gave us a chance to fall back to sleep, and feel like we had had a sleep-in.We were particularly happy to have a room facing Easterly. We had lovely morning sun on our balcony for the first few hours each day, and then in the late afternoon when one was hot and tired from the days activities, it was nice and cool and shady. And if we felt like watching the sunset, then Waikiki Beach was only a 3 minute walk away.We have no regrets at all about choosing the Royal Grove for our stay, I cannot imagine better value for money, and am grateful to others who had posted comments on trip advisor which gave me the confidence to book into a low star rated property. So if like us, cleanliness, friendliness, helpfulness and economy are the important factors, you cannot go wrong here.

My husband and I spent our 2 week honeymoon at this hotel. not the most romantic setting for a honeymoon but we were in HAWAII so we didn't care.At first sight it may just be an old hotel but it truley is a gem. Our room was clean and had everyone you needed for a very enjoyable stay.Our a/c worked but for some reason didn't really keep our room all that cold, but we didn't mind that much...Some hotel staff are friendlier than others, but overall very helpful.I was worried about staying here because of how cheap and old it was, but after i read the reviews we decided to give it a go.It is right in the middle of everything and easily walking distance to most things.We hired a car a couple of days and had to park elsewhere and walk a bit, but that is ok. If you were hiring a car for your whole stay it may get a bit annoying.

i just arrived home from staying in this place for 2 weeks....it doesnt look much from the outside but let me tell u i will be rebooking again...perfect location about 1 minute from the beach and walking distance to everything, we walked to the zoo etc. the homely relaxed nature of this place is amazing. i cant believe this place is so cheap. i thought it was too good to be true. i loved this place and cant not reccomend it highly enough!

It doesn't look like much from the outside and the inside may be a bit dated, but the stay was nothing short of fabulous. Location was perfect, a 2-minute walk to Waikiki Beach. Hospitality was second to none and the owners even staged a Wednesday night kitchen party for free by the pool, with a lot of people dancing. Great prices, quiet hotel, small but decent pool. Doubt if you'll find better value for the dollar.

I am not a fussy person when it comes to hotels. I do, though, expect a clean room, towels, and friendly staff. I got all of these when I entered the Royal Grove Hotel. The room was more than I had expected. I was told the bed was a queen, it seemed much bigger than that! There was a full sized refrig, sink, stove with oven, towels for the kitchen, microwave, coffee maker, all the plates, cups, utensils, pots, and they even had safety deposit boxes!The staff was very friendly and was helping any time we needed them. We checked in late in the day and we didn't fly out until 9 pm, so the staff held our luggage for us. We asked for morning wake up calls, no problem there either.Yes, the rooms are dated, but you know what? My entire stay was under $350 for 6 days and 5 nights. My whole stay was less expensive than some people would pay per night!We had a great Korean restaurant right under us, loved it! More places directly down the street, we were about 2 blocks off Waikiki Beach. The morning traffic was a bit loud, but not enough to bother my husband or I. There are grocery stores close by for breakfast food, which was wonderful. I have zero complaints about the stay. The only way it would have been any better is if there had been juice and bagels for breakfast, but that was not even necessary, it would have just been an added bonus. Like I said, I don't ask for much. We bought it all at the local store.I realized during the stay that many guests are return customers. They knew the names of the staff and they staff knew them. We were asked how we found the best deal in Waikiki by some of those return guests. I told them, "By luck!"I would never consider staying at any other hotel in Waikiki. I am so convinced you will love staying here! You get real keys, the place is decorated by the owners, with their own items, things they have made and all in all is a very homely place. They even have Emilio the bird at the front door.

We stayed at the Royal Grove Hotel for 3 nights in August. It is a nice place to stay,and it is absoulutely priced right. It is the probably the best in Waikiki for the price you pay. The only drawback was having to park our car elswhere, but I"m sure this is not the only motel that does this. The staff was very nice, and very helpful to us. We did not receive our luggage the 1st day that we were there. So we informed the staff our luggage would arrive sometime the next day, and they assured us they would take care of it, and they did.

We stayed at the Royal Grove hotel for 12 consecutive nights and had the most wonderful time. Our room was spotless, the beds comfortable, the staff very helpful. The hotel was very quiet and we never had any noise problems (except for the garbage truck doing its rounds outside our window at 5 in the morning a couple of times!) Granted, the Royal Grove is not a fancy place. But having our own kitchen in the room and being located 20 seconds away from the best part of Waikiki beach for $60 a night was fantastic! I highly recommend the Royal Grove if you plan on staying in Waikiki.

We stayed in this hotel for two weeks and I was sceptical prior to going. This place is not for those wanting luxury but for those who would rather have a very clean room (they even wash the bed spreads here and there are no mouldy smells and no bugs) with cooking facilities, air conditioning, a relaxed and down to earth Hawaiian experience and exceptional value for money. You can't ask for a better location as this hotel is just a few minutes walk to Waikiki beach and the Grove would have to be the cheapest place around. You could pay double for something and not get a room to this standard. We requested a room to be located on the upper levels facing the pool because I read in other reviews that it can get noisy if you are facing the street. We found it very quiet at night in our Category 1 room on the fifth floor which could sleep three people. There are also larger rooms for families or groups travelling together so the saving is even better. If you stay for a week the maid service is twice a week but we only needed to clean the room once a week (that's how relaxed we felt there). We loved the free entertainment every Wednesday night with "hoolah time"!!!This was our second trip to Hawaii and on our third trip we will be going back to The Grove. The money we saved on the hotel and with cooking our own breakfast we happily spent at Ala Moana and Waikelie Premium Outlets...our suitcases were so full!!!! If you are travelling from Australia you are allowed 2 suitcases each and 32 kilos maximum each so pack light because the money you save here you will be investing in your wardrobes!! Local shopping is magnificent!!!! For great local food, The Cheesecake Factory in Waikiki is very popular but has long queues to get in...we also found The Californian Pizza Kitchen across the road was equally as good with no waiting to be seated so try that place also.Hope this helps! :)

Our studio was spotless; altho old with funky furniture but everything worked. The A.C. kept the studio cool and drowned out any noise, the desk/lobby area was entertaining and comfy. We felt safe and from within 30 seconds of leaving our room we were standing in front of Dukes' stature on Waikiki Beach.This hotel is for surfers and guests who do not plan to hang around an exotic pool and spend lots of $ on wall papered, fancy rooms. We were gone everyday doing fun stuff.The pool was fine for cooling off, and the beds were very comfortable. ( there were 2 beds)Parking, if you have a car, is a challenge. We could have, and should have, bought the $50.00 pass at the Waikiki banyan, 2 blocks down the street, for seven days. Well worth it. Almost all hotels in Waikiki charge for parking.The korean cafe next door was good for a quick stop and the area cafes were close and pretty reasonable.Perfect location, nice folks and a feel-good atmosphere...and reasonable. Aloha!

I just finished reading some of the recent reviews on the Grove and have to say it was nice to see one from our OZ friends and finding we are pretty similiar in our needs. This was our third stay at the Royal Grove and the second for my brother and his wife. We maybe a little superstitious about somethings like " if it ain't broke don't fix it " in that the times we have stayed at the Grove we had a very relaxed and enjoyable visit. I think it is one of a few that what you see online is what you get when you arrive. For less than $70 you get a fridge, 4 burner stove with oven a m/w, and toaster pots and pans plus a coffeemaker but with Me's cafe just around the corner with breakfast and coffee for $4 who cooks.I didn't mention the lanai on which we had a small oceanview but it seems some are willing to pay much more for about what we had. Also the staff and many of the guests we felt were a big help in making it another great stay .

I will state right now that vacations for my family are about experience,people, and relaxation not about posh surroundings.Yes, the Hyatt has a beautiful pool which overlooks the beach...there are 100 more elegant choices in Waikiki than the Royal Grove...but for stories, for heart, for old school Hawaii, there is no better place, and will never be a better place. The Royal Grove doesn't work to be anything. The Royal Grove simply exists. It is the place you hate to leave, filled with character and characters. The staff is friendly,not overly so. The rooms are clean.(We had the coolest room, on the corner, with a wrap around lanai, and an ocean view...). Men play music in the sitting room on Wednesday nights...sort of hawaii unplugged.It is not a fancy place....it is purely a place I fancy. My home when I visit paradise.

We read so many nice things about the Royal Grove and everything was true. I laughed passing the Hyatt knowing people paid one day what we paid for a week ! Hey - you sleep at the hotel - get out to the beach & Waikiki ! We had a great time and the front desk was always a big help. The room was cleaner and nicer than ours at home! 2 short blocks from the beach - you can't beat it. Want to go back asap!

i stayed here for a week in june. i had heard that it's a noisy hotel so i asked for a room on the sixth floor overlooking the pool/inner courtyard rather than a room facing street traffic. my room was quiet, especially with the a/c running. i never heard anyone in the next door rooms- the walls seem to be well-insulated. the a/c barely kept the room cool but it was very humid in honolulu so i'm glad i reserved an air conditioned room. front desk employees were nice and helpful. free daily newspapers were nice to have. the prices are good, especially considering how expensive other waikiki hotels were. the hotel is just 2 blocks from the beach. many stores in the area and the busline to go downtown or to pearl harbor or the airport was across the street. parking was $50 a week at the marriot 3 blocks away. it was also nice to have a kitchenette and cable tv.

What more can you want - clean & functional (but old fashioned & fairly basic) rooms, friendly and helpful staff, excellent location 2 minutes walk from the beach, great korean takeaway & cafe below. I didn't have or need aircon but you might. I was in HL for a conference. Others stayed at the Marriot. I 'Groved' - and glad i did. Back for another conference in January & will stay again.

The Royal Grove has many great qualities: The friendly and attentive staff, overall cleanliness and great atmosphere. For all those reasons it hurts to have to mention that this hotel is past its prime. However, from what I've heard at seen from other Waikiki hotels, this one was still a steal. My family was able to get what was by far the best rate in all of Waikiki. Along with the positive reviews, this place was an easy decision. We stayed in a one bedroom that was clean and comfortable. One very big issue was the absence of air conditioning in the front room/kitchen area. It was hot. Every night, we had to drag a mattress from the front room to the air conditioned bedroom so our daughter could sleep in comfort. I was told by the front desk that all the one bedroom units were the same. They supplied two fans but they did very little. I would consider staying there again if A/C was supplied throughout. Overall a good deal. If you're looking for a bargain, this one is worth it.

We love this place,this was our third visit and we felt like we were visiting friends,same hotel staff as before and they are all wonderful (Christie can crack you up)we like it because it is homey and cheap,has every thing we need and if it doesn't they will find it for you.True Hawaiian style and so close to everything we want.Not only is it cheap but the rooms are very good sized.Sure the furniture is old and the place is a little run down but who cares,unpack,throw your stuff around grab a towel,enjoy the beach,eat out or in then maybe if you are lucky the guys will be playing music down stairs in the evening and spend a couple of weeks cause its affordable.Make your self at home,they want you to.We were there for Halloween and there was a potluck in the lobby,everyone concocted something or bought something and it was all soooo good.We got to meet alot of people who visit time and time again,after dinner we walked down to the beach and watched people parade around in wonderful and hillarious costumes,wonderful memorys and we can afford to do it every year thanks to The Royal Grove.

Coming from Maui...I don't want to spend a bunch of cash on somewhere to sleep. This place is golden. I'm not sitting in the lobby looking at it's opulence and beauty and ordering drinks from a well groomed bartender.....it's not here. I'm getting excellent directions from people whose first language is English. I'm getting a rate that is phenomenal for this location. I'm getting $8 daily parking 2 blocks away....a steal in Waikiki. I'm getting a staff that won't hand you anything until they clean it first. I'm getting a deal. Especially on the weekend of Pearl Harbor Day, U2 and Honolulu Marathon. Expect a bed and a bathroom and you won't be disappointed....if you want more...there are plenty of rooms in Waikiki, just make sure you don't go broke. Great breakfast 20 feet out the door and a store and a mini-mart around the corner. Waikiki beach is 2 blocks away....3 minutes walk. Some might call it a "dump", I call it a "deal". Next time I fly over....I'm here!!

We have been going to the Royal Grove since 1992 and it seems to be getting better. Don't expect the Hilton or Hyatt, it is strictly an old family run hotel with lots of ambiance. The friendliness of the staff, particularly Donna at reception, Nelson the all-around helper, Mr. Fong the owner, Amy our super housekeeper, it feels like home away from home. The loclation could not be better, literally steps from Kuhio beach (which is the best and least crowded beach in Waikiki). Mr. Fong put on a wonderful Thanksgiving dinner with about 80 guests in attendance, turkey with all the trimmings. Guestscontributed to the food and afterwards there was singing around the pool.The Royal Grove is not for everybody but we will be back. It's strictly a happy place to be.

If you are after a true Hawaiian experience then you cant beat the Royal Grove! It's not one of those mass produced hotels where nothing changes no mater what country you are in. It offers an unforgettable experience that leaves you depressed when you get home. From guitars and Hula dancing to long board riding and social evenings with other guests, it will leave a lasting impression. Thats probably why my grandad has been there 26 yrs in a row! The staff have all been there for years and know the place inside out. Christy would be the most helpful hotel person I have met. She not only has great advice but knows how to have fun outside the place. The manager Tim is the man! He is very friendly and still rides his 10ft board like he is a teenager Flag those expensive hotels where the cost one night = 1 week at the Grove. Dont expect room service but do expect at GREAT TIME!!!RG's Kiwi friend

My new wife and I stayed at this hotel in September. We booked it primarily for the price and the location. We knew going in that it wouldnt be the greatest thing in the world...and we were right. Having said that however, we didnt spend all that much time in the room anyways. There is just too much to see and do on the island to spend your time at the hotel. The location was awesome. Less than a 5 minute walk to the beach and ABC stores. Love the ABC stores!!! Our room was a good size. It had a queen, but it felt more like a full, and a twin bed in it. I will say this though, the bed [--]. It was hard and didnt have hardly any cushion. It felt like it was probably from the 60's. The room had a fridge, microwave and kitchen utensils, which was nice cause we made our own lunches and saved cash this way too. We also had a nice big lanai and would eat breakfast out there everyday. Our biggest problem with the hotel was the AC. The first day we got there it was on but it was cranking out absolutely no cold air. We told the front desk staff and they got us a portable AC unit that was on the floor. This cooled off the room for the most part but it was a real pain in the rear. WE had to empty out the water behind the unit when it got too full and even this wasnt enough because we were gone so much. It always overflowed and our carpet was soaked. That made walking on the floor not so pleasant. There was no parking on site and we had to walk 4 blocks to the Waikiki Banyan where it was 40 bucks for a week to park. It wasnt bad considering we were in paradise but after a while it gets to be a long walk. Other than the AC issue and the bed being too hard it was an alright place to stay. We knew going in that it was nothing spectacular and that is OK. I got a kick out of people who thought this place was supposed to be a 5 star place. However, I do think that the given all of the reviews on this place that it is a bit over rated. If you are looking for a very cheap place to stay (we paid 500 bucks for 8 days) than this is the place for you. Would I stay here again? I would really, really have to think about it. I would if I was going there on a very small budget again but I think we could probably spend even a few hundred more dollars and stay at a better place. I hope this helps all of my fellow Hawaii travelers.

We stayed at this hotel in late August. The hotel is a great value but is old with the pool only open limited hours (i.e. 9am-8pm). If you are like me and want to swim early or late you can't because they are stict about this. Also, they had a pot luck supper while we were there but the hotel mananger told us the wrong night so we missed it! This was one of the reasons we wanted to stay there so I was very disapointed about that!Kristy, the lady at the front desk, was great. She has a great sense of humor and always went the extra mile for us. Emilio, the bird in the fount lobby, would chirp and sing to everyone but if you catch him in the right mood he will sing the theme song to the Andy Griffith Show. That was a highlight! Overall an OK stay. The room was always clean and the towels always fresh. I just wish they would extend their pool hours.

I have to say that for the money, you cannot go wrong with the Royal Grove Hotel. I had heard about the hotel from some friends who stay there all the time. My first reaction to the cost of the rooms was "HUH?" It is as you see it on the website. There are no fancy frills here. Simple honest to goodness family style hotel. The Fong family has done a fantastic job and there are so many of their memories throughout. Surf boards, a quilt done by Mrs. Fong. If you can get a room pool side, it is much quieter. But our AC became the hum we needed to drown out the rest of the noise. Kitchen was fully stocked with cookware and essentials and after a trip to the supermarket, we were all set to go. It was so wonderful to be able to step out on our balcony in the morning with a cup of coffe and sit and watch the sun rise as the tropical tradewinds blew across you. When traffic was quiet, you could hear the rolling surf from up the street. It is literally right up the street to the beach. There is also a wonderful landmark which is the Duke Kahanamoku statue on the beach of Waikiki. You are within walking distance to so many great things from the hotel. The International Market Place, Kapiolani Park, just to name a few. The only downside is there is no parking. SO...if you are renting a car, you will need to do like we did. We parked at the Waikiki Banyan which is about 2 blocks away, and paid the weekly rate to park our car. There are locations closer, but they have a high daily rate to park in their garage. That was a minor inconvienence for the money we saved with our room. They have beach chairs and mats you can use to go to the beach. There is music on Wednesday evenings as the Fong 'Ohana would come and play music with their friends. There was music and dancing, food and laughter had by all. It was great getting to meet some of the other guests that were staying there. I ran in to sooo many who have been to the Royal Grove 4+ times. We'll be joining the return to Royal Grove club. It is simple and basic and a treasure right in the heart of Waikiki. Debbie and Steve were great behind the Front Desk. They were always cheerful and helpful and then there is Emilio. He sits on his perch at the door to the hotel and greets everyone with his chirps and whistles.I am recommending this hotel to all I know and we will definitely be staying there again! Mahalo to the Fong 'Ohana. May you all be there for a VERY long time!

We stayed here as a family of 4 for 3 nights. It was in a fantastic location. We could walk to Waikiki, as it was 1.5 blocks away. Therefore we got to experience the nightlife of Honolulu. It was also a fantastic price, considering what other hotels in the area charge.That said, it had some downsides. The woman at the desk was incredibly unhelpful. She spent most of her time on the phone to her friends, and when I disturbed her (by asking a quick question) she made it clear I was a pain. I was not impressed by her level of customer service. The guy on the desk is much more helpful, but unfortunately the woman seems to be on it far more. When I told her that our AC was not working, and neither were the powerpoints on the right hand side of the wall in our room she said "I'm not surprised, everything in this place is falling apart". Our AC got fixed but we had to live without the powerpoints. The night without the AC was terrible. I could not sleep with the humidity. This was not helped by the noise. Forget NYC being the city that never sleeps, Honolulu is. The walls do not block out sound, and people seemed to love making noise in the hallway (usually between 1am-4am), which is not the hotels fault but it certainly is frustrating. All up, considering the price I got what I paid for. If I ever returned to Hawaii I would probably find another hotel slightly better. As a tourist I would have loved desk staff who answered my questions readily.

We stayed at the Royal Grove Hotel from 6/13/06 thrugh 6/18/06 and loved it. This hotel is the best deal in Oahu. Your two short blocks to the beach and right in the middle of waikiki. The hotel is a bit dated but clean and very quaint. The pool is small but clean. The rooms were big with a kitchenette. If you care about all the small amenities that the big hotels give you with a bigger price, this place is not for you. If your like me and are looking for a clean place with great location and great price, this place is absolutely perfect.

My boyfriend and I recently vacationed in Oahu. We stayed for a week at the Royal Grove hotel and loved it. The hotel is quite cute - vintage Hawaiian. They are in the perfect location - VERY close to Waikiki beach (less then a 5 minute walk), and all the shopping and resturants. The hotel staff was a joy - very friendly and extremely helpful, We stayed on the 5th floor. We had a cute lanai and there was even a fridge out there to store drinks and food so we did not have to go back in the room to get stuff from the kitchen. The place was super clean and well kept. There is a pool on site and internet access. There is also the most yummy Korean BBQ place right next door. One of the best deals for good food in Oahu. I highly recommend it. My boyfriend and I would definately stay at the Royal Grove again.

My son and I stayed at the Royal Grove in 2005, we already have our reservations for our next trip in 2007!The Grove is very dated, but we found it to be clean and the staff to be extremely helpful and respectful. We always had plenty of hot water with good pressure (which I hear can be a problem with budget hotels sometimes). The use of a safety deposit box is free.You can park across the street for a nominal fee.Maid service is not everyday...if you have weekly reservations, it is 2x week. But with just a little picking up after yourself...NO PROBLEM!The kitchenette is the best! You can purchase some supplies and have a few meals in your room...saving some more $$$.I have recommended the Grove several times.
There is nothing wrong with this hotel. Save big bucks right next to the beach.

My husband and I stayed at the Royal Grove for 3 weeks while we looked for an apartment in Honolulu. The rates couldn't be beat, and the staff is very friendly. The laundry room wasn't overpriced, and they offer free beach mats and toys. With the beach 2 blocks away I never went in the pool. The vegetarian restaurant downstairs is highly recommended. We had an older room without air conditioning, and it was always comfortable. I felt safe in the hotel. With the weekly rate the room is cleaned twice a week, and we never saw any bugs or cockroaches. There is no parking, but they directed us to a garage about a block away that wasn't too unreasonable, for Waikiki.While it was small, it served its purpose for us, and is in a great location--even close to the grocery in Waikiki. Its also on the main bus lines (a montly pass is only $40). If you're used to budget accomodations, this place is a real find, if a bit worn around the edges.

A warming to anyone looking for a non smoking room - I was given a room without a lanai (even though I'd booked a category 1 room with a balcony) because I asked for a non smoking room.I booked a room with A/C and lanai, but was given a room on the ground floor w/out a lanai. When I queried this, I was told that I had asked for a non-smoking room, and the only non-smoking rooms were on the ground floor with no lanai. When I asked to move to a room with lanai I was told I'd need to wait until the following morning as the night reception staff member couldn't change my room.The up side to this room was that it was right next to the pool, facing inside rather than out on to the road, so while there was some noise from the pool during the day it was quiet at night. As a result I decided not to go to the hassle of changing rooms, and so had peaceful nights - but I did miss having a lanai!

I stayed at this hotel for 2 weeks last year, having chosen it on the basis of the reviews I saw on Trip Advisor and I must say I was very disappointed. We were given a very noisy second floor room facing the street and I found it hard to sleep as a result. The room was very large, but rather shabby and dated. The worst part was the parking situation really as it was hit and miss every day as to whether there would be space in the lot across the street. When there wasn't we had to go to another lot about a 10 minute walk away (through an area which becomes pretty seedy late at night). All in all I'd pay a bit more next time for something a little bit more convenient and sophisticated. Unless you're looking for a basic post-beach crash-pad I would avoid.

Date(s) of stay: Nov 2005Hotel location: 2 blocks from Waikiki Beach, 1 block behind Hyatt Regency. Roberts Hawaii airport shuttle service drops off & picks up at front door. Pedestrian-friendly neighborhood: yesAccess to public transportation: yes – ½ block away.Room location(s): on 3rd floor. Internal units.Room rate(s): $270 for a whole WEEK!!!Overall appearance: our room faces the apt complex next door. Late evening and early morning traffic noise but not too bad with the fan on.Other guests: budget travelers, seniors, families, students.Quality of room(s): tiny studio efficiency with 2 twin beds, but it's clean and comfortable. Full cable service. Kitchenette stocked with cooking utensils but no cleaning supplies (we brought our own detergent towelettes). A service elevator 20' away, but guests used it, too. Our room was in the old annex: no lanai or air conditioning – we weren't in the room long enough need either. For those who can afford to splurge an extra $18/night or who plan to stay for more than a couple of weeks, I'd recommend the Category 1 room – the front desk staff let me take a peek at a vacant room the morning that I checked out – that room was about the size of a regular hotel room that has a kitchenette as an extra.Quality of bathroom: tiny but serves its purposes. Other amenities: Outdoor pool in courtyard. We didn't use it, but guests did.InterNet access: I don't recall whether the telephone has a modem data port. Lots of InterNet cafes within walking distance (one is the Korean café adjacent to the hotel and provides wireless service; another in the hotel next door – 8 a.m. – midnight – enabled me to do an online check-in early in the morning for a midnight flight; ).Quality of service: If you want to experience true aloha, this place is it!!!!Meals: lots of affordable, mom-&-pop restaurants as well as posh restaurants within walking distance. A supermarket about 5 blocks away. With the money we saved on our accommodations and eating in the first few nights, we were able to splurge on afternoon tea at the Moana Surfrider the day before our departure. We arrived several hours too late for the Monday cook-out and left several hours before the following Monday's cookout. Security: We experienced no problems, though in the wee hours of the first morning a domestic disturbance at the apt complex next door woke me up and kept me up for almost an hrRecommendation: a resounding yes!

During the first week of March three of us spent 3 nights at the Royal Grove hotel. We stayed in a one bedroom suite. The room was clean, but showed signs of age. Only the bedroom had air conditioning which was a bit of a problem but the other room had a big fan. We stayed on the second floor facing the street, I recommend you ask for a room higher because of the noise from cars and people. The Room was cleaned everyday, and fresh towels was provided. The room has a refrigerator and a small kitchen, however we didn't get to use it. The hotel provides a safety deposit box for valuables for free which is good. The hotel is situated at a very great location, a short 3 minute walk and your at the beach. Basically every thing is reachable by foot within Waikiki. The hotel doesn't have its own parking space, but its easy to find parking at nearby streets if your patient, or there's a parking lot 5 block north for $7 a day.Now, you might wonder why this hotel gets such a high score. Well the hotel is suited for the budget traveller that doesn't really care about major hotel amenities. If you are a stickler with regards to amenities such as a hair blower, large bathroom, modern looking facility etc., then this hotel is not for you. However, if budget is your concern this is the place for you. Even if you can afford any place, this is still a great place to stay if you don't like hanging around the hotel any way. Why spend so much money on an expensive hotel when your going to explore everything outside anyway.Overall I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

If you are lucky enough to have found out about Royal Grove, and are considering staying here, congratulations for doing your homework on finding the best bargain in Hawaii! We recently stayed several nights in Honolulu, on Waikiki Beach, and were utterly charmed by this old style, old Hawaii hotel. Our rate was $62 for an airconditioned room on the second floor overlooking the pool -- just a 4 minute walk to the beach. Amazing, for this location -- when most places are in the $300 and up (way up) per night range!! Thanks Fong family, for offering up such a treasure as your hotel. We sincerely hope this place stays in your family for generations to follow. The room offered a full bed, plus a small twin, a full kitchen and fridge, appointed with everything you'd need to cook a meal, bake a cake, or microwave a quick snack. Cute little balcony, great shower with excellent pressure, and very acceptable, comfortable beds. This place is set up for long term stays as well, with on-site coin laundry, very reasonable internet access and rates- 1 accessible computer in a small room off the lobby ($1 for 10 minutes, you keep track on your own and pay at the desk when finished), a small shelf of books to borrow, and more. In the same building -- right next door was an inexpensive little Asian restaurant that did noodles and such at night, and best of all a great breakfast of eggs, etc, for around $3.50. There's a small grocery right next store, and another across the street -- very convenient. There is a small pool, and the location can NOT be beat. You are within walking distance of so many great spots in Waikiki. You can have drinks like we did at the Sheraton Moana SurfRider, under the famous banyan tree, or watch the sunset at the House Without a Key -- and then leisurely stroll back to your own room knowing you've saved hundreds upon hundreds of dollars by not actually staying at those places. It felt great, we were patting ourselves on the back, I have to say -- thanks all you tripadvisor reviewers who shared your knowledge of this hotel. Our room was very sparsely decorated, with old style 60's/70's decor & furnishings giving it a kitschy feel. Everything was very clean, so though it was older style, it did not feel "old". Some of the vintage Pyrex in the cupboards, or the lighting fixtures for example, would bring a mint on eBay! The lobby is a treasure trove of kitschy old Hawaiian items, from surfboards to tourist knick-knacks, to old botanical prints, and an old stereo my husband just loved, plus old bamboo style furniture -- even the requisite mascot bird, cared for by an older woman who said she awoke every morning like clockwork to feed and clean the birdcage. Loved it. For sure, this is not luxury -- it's more "kitschy motel room". The room is spare, and the street noise was pretty loud. No one will turn on the A/C prior to your arrival, and no turn down service. It's quite loud on the weekend, actually. (The airconditioner functioned for us as white noise to block out the street below). For this reason, I would not classify this as a 'romantic' place to stay, but, more of a fun step back in time. There is a real sense of community at this hotel, primarily because it is filled with active seniors who stay for long durations. For example, the small table in the lobby has a hand-lettered sign that reads "reserved" for 7 pm every night for the ladies poker games. I think being over 70 was a prerequisite for buying in to that game! In our 40's we were most definately the youngest guests at the time. Still, we loved it, and found it very welcoming. This is old style --- : No hairdryers in the rooms, but, we were able to get one at the front desk, use it, and return it. Coffee is available in the mornings in the lobby, with styrofoam cups, and a small sign asking that guests observe the 1 cup per guest rule. Making a long distance call requires the front desk to place it for you (you can call from the privacy of your room, but, you have to ask the front desk staff to place the call for you) It's that kind of place. We were lucky enough to be there for one of the famous pot luck dinners, on Chinese New Year! There was music by Mr Fong on Ukele and friends, two hula dancers, and more food (must have been 50 dishes to pass on that table!) than you can imagine. Hey -- those seniors know how to cook! The only other point I would make was that the long term guests do congregate around the pool to socialize at various points -- from mornings, to the early evening, and since the 1st floor rooms have tables and chairs right up around the pool, the pool area is not 'relaxing' -- as in you wouldn't plan to lay out reading a book by the pool... it's more of a spot to socialize. Still, having a pool on a hot day, when you just want a quick dip in some fresh water, was really great. And you can find a million (it seems) deserted beaches, or otherwise, to relax and read your book somewhere on Oahu. We would love to get a chance to go back to Waikiki, and would without question stay at the Royal Grove. We were charmed by it's style, it's family of owners, the price, the location, and the fun sense of community -- people were ALWAYS in the lobby it seemed, just chatting, talking about thier plans for the day, and socializing. This was just too much fun; we felt like we had stepped back in time for a short while!

We stayed at the Royal Grove in Oct 2004, during a budget vacation to Hawaii. The hotel and it's rooms are exactly what they look like on the website - very simple and a bit dated. If you are aware of this going in, you won't have any surprises. The location is amazing, though, and we hardly spent any time in the room. You can walk to the beach, shopping and restaurants. Spend a few extra bucks and get a room with AC - it helps drown out the outside noises. Buy some groceries and take advantage of the in-room fridge to help cut food costs. My only complaint is the doors in the room have large air vents, so you hear everything from the hallways and sometimes from other rooms. This can effect sleeping and romance.

This hotel was worth the money! All we did was sleep here. There is so much to do in oahu! This hotel was 2 blocks away from waikiki beach and 2 blocks from the international marketplace. It's definitely a budget hotel and you get what you paid for. The staff was very helpful and friendly. There are safe boxes behind the counter and that was where we kept our cash. They still use keys and not key cards! The only cons were (1) the queen bed we had was actually 2 twin beds pushed together and (2) there are metal slats in the bottom of the door which don't give you too much privacy. If you go to their website and see the panoramic view of the room you will see what i am talking about. If you can live with those things, like we did it's worth the stay. The room was clean, bug free and we got maid service 2X a week. We definitely had more money to spend on things that were more important like souveniers and our excursions. Enjoy your stay!

This place is located just a block and a half away from Waikiki beach and priced at an unbelievably low rate. The rooms were decent, but the people who worked there were awesome. They were so helpful and went out of their way when asked any questions. They made our stay there incredible and we will definitely be returning. This place is what Customer service is all about. You can't go wrong staying here!! AAAAA++++++

This hotel is about 2 minutes walking distance to the famous Waikiki Beach so we can go to the beach several times a day. It is also near the International Marketplace so we can go shopping anytime we have extra time. A lot of eating places, shopping and beach strolling so what more can you ask? The hotel has spacious rooms with kitchen though quite old. Good enough for a place to rest your tired body plus it's quite inexpensive. The staff is very helpful and friendly. Would definitely return here when we're in Honolulu.

I spent 6 days at the Royal Grove Hotel and I would recommend this place to anyone visiting. The hotel is 2-3 blocks from the beach, retail stores, and near every bus route. The staff was nice, except to people that gave them attitude. My room was clean, bug free, and everything worked. I had heard horror stories about roach motels in Honolulu and the Royal Grove is NOT one of them. Where else are you going to find a place with a balcony and kitchenette for 60 bucks a night. If you are the type of vacationer that just wants to relax in your room or the type that is barely in your room, you won't find a better deal. If you need a jacuzzi, spa, room service, and lots of bells and whistles, better try somewhere else. Hell this place still uses actual room keys and not access cards.

The Royal Grove Hotel lived up to its expectations. We arrived there August 2-6th and although the old fashioned atmosphere took my children aback at first, they soon grew to love it. We were two blocks from the Hyatt, a block from an ABC store and a block and a half from The Bus transportation. The people at the desk were very friendly and let us borrow beach mats and towels for our day trip at Hanauma Bay. The maids were great -- the room was always made up nicely and the towels were clean.Again, the location and the price makes the Royal Grove a super catch. We could easily walk to Waikiki Beach as well to the other hotels where we caught the Society of Seven and the Magic of Polynesia show. We could also walk to two supermarkets as well as the International Marketplace (hint- the best and cheapest place for souvenirs though is the Aloha Stadium flea market which is opened Wednesday and weekends. The prices were cheaper than all of Oahu and the other three major islands!).Anyway, you just have to stay at the Royal Grove. Aloha.

Okay, my husband and I and our two children did a survey after arriving home from our 9 day stay at the Royal Grove Hotel in Waikiki just this last week and we decided that if we were to go back tomorrow and had any pick of hotels to stay at, that we would undoubtedly go back to the Royal Grove....it was unanimous! We are an upper middle-class family and could easily afford a more upscale hotel but we truly liked the casual atmosphere there at the Royal Grove.....like "no worries" kind of atmosphere.
