You just stroll in and you can wear exactly what you feel like there (no need to dress up). The room was basic and you definitely have to overlook certain things because fancy it ain't.... :) but our room was fully equipped with everything we needed...we had a stove, full-sized fridge, kitchen sink and it was fully stocked with dish rack, silverware, fry-pan, bowls, mugs, glasses, spatula, and dishtowels, etc., etc. We had our own balcony and you could allmost throw a pebble up to the waterfront. The Hyatt is across the road and up about 50 yds or so and I can guarantee you that those people are paying a heck of alot more than we did and for what? Our room was very clean and the maids did a great job of cleaning up all the sand we dragged in everyday and everyone there just smiles at you and they are all just super friendly. They have lots of things for you to use, such as sand toys for the little ones, boogie boards, they did have a few snorkel equipment also and this is all on an "honor system". They have a dining table downstairs and a small pool to use, however I cannot imagine why you would come to Waikiki to use a pool for heaven's sake. Emelio, the cockateil is there in the reception area to great you, however he does go to bed quite early so you need to visit with him early in the day. The foyer area is filled with all kinds of traditional hawaiian memorabilia and surfboards on the walls and a couple around the lounge area...(would you see this at the Hyatt???? I think not!) That's what's so cook about this place.....it's uniqueness! You just feel relaxed the moment you walk in. You can do your wash there cheaper than any laundramat anywhere I've ever known. and they have a safe for you to keep any valuables in if you like. All in all, it was just the most relaxing place we've ever stayed in.......ever!So, like someone else said in a review I read before we booked the Royal Grove is that if you are looking for a place with all the "beeps and bells" and spa treatments and such....don't stay there but if you are looking for a place to really relax and get all the tension out of your system (which is what a vacation is all about anyway), then do yourself a favor and stay at the Royal Grove! We really want to thank EVERYONE there for making our stay the GREATEST!!!!!!

This was my 1st time in Oahu and the Royal Grove was a great deal. It wasn't the nicest place on the island, but for the price...it couldn't be beat. The staff was very nice, and were attentive to our needs, like directions or restaurants. We stayed in a suite w/ balcony and kitchenette. The bedroom had a double bed and the room the kitchenette was attached to had two twin beds. My boyfriend surfs and had plenty of room for the boards he brought on the balcony. The Duke statue is at the Waikiki beach 2 blocks away. We walked everywhere to eat and shop, and the bus line was around the corner. Try the Cheeseburger In Paradise or numerous sushi bars! Also walk to King's Village nostalgia shop to check out the Beatles cover band!

My 4 night stay was all work. So, up at 3am, and back by 6 or 7. So, I didn't go out much. Just to get a bite to eat. Well, my room was great for $62. Didn't see one bug. It was pretty clean. Air conditioner worked great. Great TV. Had a fridge, stove, and kitchen sink. Dishes. Okay, so it wasn't a 5 star, but it was great for the price. Didn't eat any Hawaiian food. So, I ate fast food for 4 days. Lots of fast food places around. Parking across the way is $12 a night and $7 at the Waikiki Banyan, about 3 blocks away. Corner stores all over. Pretty good prices. People who work at the hotel are very nice. It's quiet. It was worth the price. But if you are over 5'8, then stay somewhere else. `Cause this bed was very, very short. I'm 5'8, and I had to sleep in an angle to get in the bed. And it smelled a tiny bit funky. But I was too tired to really notice. If you are expecting a really nice room with a couch and nice furniture, well, this isn't the place. But for $62, it is worth it.murderbomb7@yahoo.com

We too had our doubts about such a low-cost hotel in the heart of Waikiki. But, the wonderful lobby, the quiet pool, and the warm welcome of the staff took us one step toward nirvana as soon as we arrived.This is a hotel like I would imagine in one of those old John Wayne WWII movies, where people just wander in, sit down and talk with each other, smoke a cigar, have a cold drink, and just relax. The lobby is a friendly, cool, welcoming place, where you can just sit and read a newspaper, visit with Emilio, the cockateel, or just dream about living in paradise. In addition to finding someone to talk to, you will find magazines, a computer (with reasonable use rates), newspapers, and a piano. You might just find someone to sing along with your playing.In addition, guests get the use of beach mats and children's beach toys that are kept neear the front door, the lobby. There are fresh towels near the pool, which can also be used there or can be checked out for use at the beach, so you don't use your room towels.The rooms are adequate and kept clean, even with only twice weekly maid service. While a little more attention could be given to cleaning under and behind the beds, even my "cleanaholic" wife was satisfied with how well they were maintained. If you just can't live without fresh towels and wash cloths, you can request them from a maid as she cleans another room, or get them in the lobby.Parking IS a little bit of a problem. Parking is at the Royal Monarch, across the street. Their parking garage was built for japanese cars - very tight. But, in a city where parking is at a premium, the $6/day was worth it.This AIN'T the Marriott, the Hyatt, or any of those other overpriced industrial monoliths, where everything is at your beck and call. If you want them, you have to pay their prices. This is just a very charming, very comfortable, family-owned hotel. If you use a vacation hotel for more than to shower, sleep, shave, and change, go to the Hyatt. If you go on vacation to see the sites, lay on the beach, hike Diamondhead, enjoy the nightlife, and do a little souvenier shopping and spend a grand total of 8-10 hours per day in the hotel, this is the place for you. If we return to Oahu, WE SHALL RETURN.

I read about this hotel through trip advisor and was VERY glad I stayed there. OH MY! What a great staff! I met others during our trip and nobody heard of the Royal Grove...which I think is great for those of us who do. Kinda like a secret resort for those in the know. Anyway, my son is planning to return to Waikiki and will definitely stay there. It is not a Hyatt but it is very cozy and homey. Our last night there they were celebrating the owner's grandson's graduation and had some of his friends there as well. We were all invited to the party. They provided the food and entertainment. My only advise is to book EARLY. They were booked solid when we arrived. I booked my room back in February.

My husband and I spent 6 nights at the Royal Grove and had not one complaint. Staff was great, our room was always cleaned well, and we even had an "ocean view" from our 3rd floor balcony! It is just steps from the beach, shopping, and the bus stop. Good restaurants very nearby. Parking was only $6.00 a night in the lot across the street. (A DEAL in the area!) Loved it. Would definitely stay again. It isn't the Ritz, but it has everything needed to have a comfortable stay.

Stayed here for a week at the beginning of May. Could not agree more with the previous reviewer in that it is a fantastic location for the price of the room. Do not expect luxury at this hotel, as the saying goes, you get what you pay for, but when you are here to see Waikiki and not your hotel room you can do far worse than the Royal Grove. After a week walking up and down Waikiki I think this is the perfect location. Only a 2 minute stroll away from the beach, and that is when the "Do not walk" signs are on just before the beach road:-) The hotel is old and the furnishings are not great but this is a happy hotel and the staff do almost anything to oblige. You get towels to take down to the beach, coffee in the morning if you cannot be bothered to use the coffee maker in your room and the owners pot luck dinners to look forward to if you are there at the right time. Safety deposit boxes at reception are free. Street noise can be a problem as the hotel is located near to a busy road. Give it a go and have some fun with the money you save.

We just completed a 9 night stay at the Royal Grove and, having read a number of reviews of the place on this site and others, felt the hotel met our expectations. The staff was particularly helpful and friendly. We always felt welcome, at home and all our requests were handled promptly and with courtesy. The location of this hotel could only be bettered by a beachfront property, and in this price range such a notion would be out of the question.The Royal Grove is a short block from the center of action on Waikiki. We were moments away from the free nightly entertainment at the beach (6:30PM), were able to conveniently and safely take our daily walk south and through the park and zoo area. It would be hard to find a hotel more conveniently located in the Waikiki area.The room was adequate for our needs and very clean. On the down side, the air conditioner could not cool both rooms, so we kept the door closed between the two. The street facing windows required that we keep our drapes closed at all times to avoid putting on a display for the neighbors across the street.All in all, this was a very good value. The key is to be realistic with your expectations. This is an older hotel in an older building with aging equipment and furnishings. The professional staff and location are big plusses.

We loved it. Staff was very helpful. Stayed 5 nights. Super location for beach, shopping... Our room and the lobby needed a good cleaning. We had mold in a/c but when asked, the ducts and a/c were cleaned right away. Use the city bus system, don't rent a car or use taxi. -----. We spent $1. each to tour island, go to Pearl Harbor, dinners, Diamond Head... We'd stay again. Don't spend $300+ a night when you can get a great room for $45-$60. Enjoy!

My daughter and I flew over from Kauai where we live and stayed at the Royal Grove Hotel in December of 2004. Living here in the islands costs enough as it is, so all I was looking for was a clean, cheap place to lay our heads. I spent a good three or more hours going over reviews before deciding to stay here, and I'm so glad I picked it. Not only is it really affordable at $60/night for the type of room we needed, but it was close to EVERYTHING! My family flew in from all over the U.S. because my cousin was playing a football game against U.H. and they all stayed at places like the Hyatt and privatly owned house rentals. For the amount of time we all actually spent in our rooms, we all agreed I made the wisest choice. The staff was great, the rooms were clean and included, fridge, stove, and microwave. They also had avaliable, boogie boards, surf board and other beach stuff, for free! Now I do have to say that if you are looking for luxury, spas, and pampering, this is NOT the place to stay. It is a older small family owned hotel. While I was there, I was waiting next in line to add on an extra night, and the couple who were foriegners, in front of me were complaining that there was a cockroach that someone had "planted" in thier room. Well all I have to say to that, is welcome to Hawaii. There are more cockroaches than people in Hawaii. You're lucky you only saw one! Anyway, I just wanted to share that this was one of my better choices in life! The Royal Grove was great, and anyone who says different should pay the extra money it costs to stay at the Marriott or Hyatt. You get what you pay for and I ended up getting a lot more than I expected. The next time my family and I go to Oahu, we will most definatly be staying at the Royal Grove and spending the extra money we saved on ourselves out and about while we are there. Aloha!

The good...A wonderful, accomodating staff and spacious rooms. Great rates, where else can you get a hotel room in Honolulu for $60 a night. Great location, just a block from the beach and shopping.The bad...Very run down hotel. Upon arriving at the hotel, my wife and I almost looked for another place to stay. A very small parking garage is available at the hotel across the street. The rooms desperately need to be remodeled.As you can see, I had various feelings about the hotel. Would I stay there again? Probably not, but if you have a small budget like we did, then by all means stay here. You won't get near this for the money anywhere else.

After landing in Hawaii about 7am I headed into Waikiki with no hotel plan. So after breakfast I went to every hotel I could find to ask about their rates; and more to the point...what the staff were like.And that's what did it. The Royal Grove staff are amazingly, super friendly and it made the whole stay relaxing and homely. Nothing was any trouble and I felt it was easy to ask for any advice, or just chat.For me, I don't really care how squeaky clean or what kind of facilities a hotel has if the atmosphere is sterile or in some places unsociable!That's why the Royal Grove won me over!I would say to folk who are after a fancy hotel that this is not the place, the room was fine but nothing to sing and dance about. The emphasis here is homely, like a friend's house and I'd prefer that anyday to a faceless large hotel.I talked to locals and other visitors about the Royal Grove and they said they know people who go there everytime simply for the family like atmosphere the hotel has.So if that's your priority, the Royal Grove is your second home!

My husband jokingly told me that if I wanted to holiday in Oahu near Waikiki Beach, I had to find a place for under $50.00 a night. I searched the Internet, read the reviews concerning The Royal Grove Hotel and felt quite comfortable in reserving for a two week stay, which averaged a daily rate of $37.50. Upon arrival I was sceptical of our room, which was in the older wing - clean, but provided neither balcony or air conditioning. While I was made aware of this while I was booking online and felt it unnecessary, I changed my mind when the 85 degrees of heat and 100 % humidity pressed against my body. My husband and I asked at the front desk if we could be upgraded and by the end of the day we were in a room three times the size of the space before. Mind you, the price changed to $59.00 (taxes included) but it was worth every U.S. penny. It had all the comforts of home including a mini bar, stove/oven, microwave, balcony and A/C. Kithchenware was provided but next time I would bring a few plastic beer glasses (for around the pool), a cork screw (one wasn't provided - unless you visit room 202. We forgot ours there!), and a small bottle of dish detergent. The bed was utterly soft and comfortable, and the water pressure in the shower was perfect and we never ran out of hot water. When we asked if it was possible to stay in our room for a few extra hours since our flight wasn't leaving until 6:00 - there wasn't even a moments hesitation. To sum up the hospitality of Mr. Wong and his management was the posting in the elevator a few days before our departure back to Canada. It was an open invitation to all guests to sign up for Thanksgiving supper on November 25th - hosted by the Wong family. Another note to mention is the Oahu Discovery Passport bus pass. It costs $20.00 for 4 consecutive days of unlimited travel. Available at any ABC store. It is recommended to also purchase a Map and Guide Book at the same time ($4.99). Well, worth the money.

I found the Royal Grove through Trip-Advisor and made reservations based on the reviews, and the price. We were going on a shoe-string budget and the Royal Grove is very inexpensive. Our room was $260 plus tax for 7 nights. You can easily spend that much a night in Waikiki! Our room had no a/c, but cooled down nicely after sunset with the fan on.They say with real estate, it's location, location, location. The Royal Grove certainly has that!! It's steps to the beach, bus and trolley stops, the statue of Duke and lots of shopping. It's older, but VERY well maintained. Everything was freshly painted. The staff truly cannot be beat!Many evenings, Mr. Fong and a friend played and sang Hawaian music just off the pool. It felt more like staying in someone's home than a hotel. We got to know some of the other guests while we were there so well that we gave them our unused groceries! Having the full kitchen allowed us to save a ton of money on meals.You probably wouldn't choose this place on looks, but you can't beat it for the ambience! I have NO complaints about the Royal Grove and would stay there again in a heart beat!!

We stayed at the Royal Grove from Oct. 30 to Nov. 5. The staff was so nice, really sweet and accomodating after a long flight out to the islands. The hotel had a nice potluck for Halloween, a local Hawaiian band played island music and a dancer performed hula dances. This was all for free! And again, the Fong family couldn't have been nicer. We were really impressed that they would do something like that and felt like part of the family. What was neat to find out was that other people felt like that too. So many couples we met at the potluck were regulars to the hotel that come visit year after year. The hotel is not a resort, so don't be expecting luxury accomodations. However, it was clean, and the location cannot be beat (1 block from Waikiki Beach)! The price is outstanding for the area. Even parking was cheap! Other 'luxury' hotels in that area cost a fortune for the room, and then for parking, so when put in that perspective, you are really getting a deal. We did so many activities on the island that we were hardly in our room except to sleep. So I am happy we saved the money and stayed at the Royal Grove, and brought home more souvenirs.

My friend (who is Hawaiian) and I stayed at the Royal from Oct 2 - 12, 2004 and had a blast. This hotel has an aura of old Hawaii and now I would not stay any where else. Most of the staff has been here from 10 to 30 years. We met many residents that have come for over 30 years and stay 4 to 6 months at a time. Our room did not have A/C but we had a fan and slept with wet t-shirts!The parking is cheap at $6/day and the hotel is 2 blocks inland from Duke's statue. There are several good places to eat under the hotel. My favorite is the Korean BBQ place where even the local police eat. There is also a smoothie and Health food store with sushi.The hotel provides beach towels, mats, boogie & surfboards, umbrellas and bikes. Free newspaper every day. The rooms have full kitchens.The staff of Chrissy, Debbie, Tim and Nelson are awesome and we miss them already. We will be coming back every October so watch out!

We stayed here from August 30 to September 6, and the Royal Grove added immensely to our GREAT vacation. As someone who lived on Oahu 30 years ago for almost 2 years, I knew the island fairly well, so in a way I was not a "typical tourist." The location of this hotel was great - close to most everything a tourist would be going to in Waikiki... and, it was 2 blocks away from a street that would take you to Highway H-1, where you can access the North Shore and the rest of Oahu easily and quickly. The room was comfy and clean - not extravagant - and large enough for 2 adults. As the price is much more reasonable than most (if not all) hotels in Waikiki, I suppose we were a bit skeptical in staying there, but now, we would not hesitate AT ALL to recommend this place to everyone. We plan on return trips to Oahu, and will not even consider staying anywhere else... unless we win a lottery, and want to friviously "throw money away." :-)))

I stayed at Royal Grove for one night during a layover on Oahu because of recommendations on Frommer's and this site and definitely did not have a great experience..First, the good:$6 parking is a great deal for Waikiki, the location is perfect a couple of blocks from the beach and the rooms are spacious and include a full kitchen with all the dishes,utensils etc. and the front desk was very helpful.The bad but tolerableParking is a block plus away from the hotel and is a 5-6 story parking garage with no stairs or elevators - a bit of a walk - and the spaces are really tiny - if you rent anything over a midsize, fitting in one is not a pleasant experience The room was not exactly clean.. a bit of a mildew smell, wet spots on the ceiling, dust. - definitely a few spots below an average motel 6 on mainland. The A/C filter was absolutely filthy and limiting its already pitiful efficiency (see below)The really ugly: Their website screwed up our reservation so they had no record of it when we came. They did have rooms available so we got one with no problem, however, all those rooms had A/C OFF!! (checking it at 5PM this means that the room was probably at 90+ when I got into it) and the piddly wall unit that it has did not succeed in getting it to any even remotely comfortable level until after midnight. I don't know if they would've turned it on earlier if they knew the room wsa going to be occupied... but as it is I could hardly imagine a worse hotel experience. Given that you can get a reputable highrise hotel in Waikiki for $10-25 more a night, I would never consider staying here again

Was there 9/17-9/18/04. I think everyone who loves this place has no qualms about staying in an old, decrepit, dated place. Yes, you can't beat the price for 2 blocks from Waikiki beach, and I wasn't picky either, but I have to give it the worst service because they essentially lied to me. Told me to upgrade to a room not facing the street for less noise when I reserved. When I got there, guess what...my room was on the street. When I complained they were unapologetic, and matter-of-factly told me someone else is staying longer than me, so I got bumped from my original room. No class. I got out of there immediately. Be warned. In comparison, in Maui, I stayed at the much more modern and friendly Sunseeker Resort for the same price -- made this place feel like a shelter. I mean the only thing separating the laundry room from people walking down the sidewalk is chicken wire. If that's your idea of great accommodations, be my guest!

I stayed at the Royal Grove in March of 2000, it was small and cosy. I liked it there, it was clean and air conditioned and so close to everything, and having the parking lot across the street was great because parking in the area is limited. I traveled to other islands and before I came back home stayed there again for two more nights. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and I have. I found it in the Frommers Budget Guide to Hawaii. I will go back again and bring more people with me.The price is definitely right and there was even a liquor store next door. Go and see for yourself, you can't go wrong with this place, definitely a good value on many levels.

I stayed at the Royal Grove from April 2 - 18, 2004 and will not stay anywhere else in Hawaii from now on. Aside from the great price, rooms, service, location, etc., the staff were the greatest. They knew my name and room number by the second day and were more than helpful and accommodating in every way. A great place to stay! I'm booking 3 weeks for next year and hope to continue to stay there each year.

This is a small, unimposing hotel with a truly remarkable ambience. I lived in Waikiki for a year, and I became familiar with many of its hotels. True, the big, expensive establishments are impressive, and if you can afford them, that's great. But if you're looking for a quiet, clean, friendly place to stay that will really make you feel as though you're on a tropical island, you can't beat the Royal Grove for quality and value. I've seen some of the other "economy" hotels in the area, and I feel sorry for the people who come to Honolulu with wonderful hopes but walk away disappointed or bitter after their experiences there. But if you're on a tight budget, and you have to keep your costs down, but you still want to enjoy yourself, the Royal Grove should be high on your list of places to stay. What I liked best about it was that I met Hawaiian residents from the other islands who were visiting Waikiki and chose this hotel for their base. I joked with their kids who splashed in the tiny swimming pool in the hotel's courtyard, and shared drinks with their parents. They told me stories of their own islands, and I listened with delight. They helped to make my stay there a memorable one. The Royal Grove rates five stars on my personal hotel ranking scale!

I found this hotel in Fodor's guide in 1993. I've been to Hawaii many times and have even lived there for a few months at a time. I knew this area well, but had never been inside the Royal Grove before. My family was very skeptical because we knew that it was an older hotel, possibly unwanted bugs, etc. Much to our surprise and happiness, it has the old feel of the islands, what I remember from when I was kid there. The staff is always great, Tim Fong the manager is very friendly. In 1999, my Mother, due to Parkinson's, required a handicapped room and needed a hospital bed. Though Tim said he'd never rented one before, he took care of the arrangements and I paid the modest rental. He also bought a raised toilet seat with handles. Mr. Fong went out of his way to make sure that my mother was happy. It was her last visit to Hawaii and I will be forever grateful to him for making it a comfortable and truly enjoyable one. We love to relax after a long day of beach time or walking around by reading books in the little paperback library in the breezeway or playing the old upright piano, feeling the tradewinds blow through. The real Aloha spirit. If you want an island unto yourself on a very exciting island like Oahu, this is the place to stay. I hope to go back next month.

I stayed at the Royal Grove on my honeymoon in May of '04. It was well worth the money. Our room had a full kitchen as well as a full size refrigerator on our private lanai. While the room was not the most modern, it was clean & the maids were always attentive asking us if we needed towels, sheets changed, etc. In addition, the front desk workers were always pleasant; they even let us stay in the room all day at no charge because our flight did not leave until 10:30 p.m. I highly recommend this hotel, you will get your money's worth and more.

With 1st time in Hawaii, I had no idea to stay with my kids. I reviewed and reviewed and at the last moment I called the Royal Grove. They made me feel safe and was so friendly and helpful. It was Great!!!! We had a long flight and was so worn out by the time we got to the hotel, they sent us to our room right away. We had a three bed with kitchen, balcony and air. The hotel is in the center of everything and all in walking distance. 2 blocks from the beach and bus stops was around the corner. Our taxi driver said home of the ABC stores and he was right, one in every corner. Food Pantry was within walking distance. International Market Place was within walking as well ( right of the hotel). They have shows on the top level and food court on different nites. Take in a luau, take the Pardise Cove Luau you can catch the bus around the corner. So much about the area to see we stayed 7 days and still not enough day to see the island. But the hotel was the best, I would stay there again! They do not bug you and helpful in every way. They will even call you a taxi when you get ready to leave... A must stay for the money! If you would like to know about the hotel or Island, I have pictures to show as well, just email me.

Great hotel before the north shore....we stayed in this hotel with our son...it had a fridge and freezer stove microwave...great for traveling with a child....our room was very quiet....the decor is not new but we loved this hotel and would go back on our next trip to hawaii we rented a car at vip ..ate at the korean restaurant downstairs from the hotel...also at the food court at the international market place..saved lots of money....the people at the front desk at this hotel are so wonderful and helpful......

Older hotel but well kept up. View from balcony is of highrises, TV is small but really not a problem for us. Room was good size and clean and housekeeping is very good. Extra towels & sand chairs in a stack by the pool- just take 'em. One way in-past the desk. Staff knows the guests and are friendly always, all look like long term people; which we see as good. Distance to Duke statue?Straight down the strret, you've hit a 5 iron that far; maybe a 6. Great location. Smoothie shop and a great BBQ place next door. Parking across street $6 @ day Value plus. Substance over style. Will be back, will recommend to friends. Request a room w/ AC. Free papers too.

Just got back from Hawaii, this is a good/cheap place to stay! When I first walked into the room, I was put off by the "look" of the room, (it's definitely older) but after a long day of being tourists, the character of the room grows on you! This Hotel is right in the middle of Waikiki, and how can you beat that! It is 2 blocks from Waikiki Beach, not only that, but the penicle of Waikiki Beach! The action around this area is almost non-stop, but because you are 2 blocks away, you tend to get somewhat less noise. Just MAKE SURE you get directions on how to get there, as well as how to get out of there, the main highways can be a bit difficult to navigate around Honolulu.

My family of 4 and I stayed there for a month. The hotel treated us like family...guest potlucks at the pool, extra TLC, etc. 2 blocks from the beach. We had a suite with a very large kitchen and the price was very reasonable for Hawaii. Loved it and would go back anytime.

The Royal Grove is a fabulous place to stay. It is extremely well maintained and the location is too good to be true. The best thing about the hotel is the incredibly friendly staff. The whole place has a very homey feel because most people who stay there have been coming back for years and years. I think that this speaks very highly of the staff.We've stayed there twice, and have already booked for next year:o)
My Wife & I stayed there 7 nights in 2000 & plan to go back in 2004. I was somewhat sceptical but to my delight found the hotel clean, friendly & the location was great.

The Royal Grove is the only place I would stay in Waikiki. It is clean with no frills, efficiently run, and blessed with genuinely pleasant and helpful staff. It is two blocks from Kuhio Beach, a short walk from the Zoo and the Waikiki Public Library, and right on the bus lines. There are several reaonable local restaurants on the same block, as well as VIP car rental office just around the corner. There's a courtyard with a clean, pleasant pool; a small paperback library; and a modest lobby with comfortable chairs. Air conditioners mask the noise of the street below. It's also painted the same pink color as the Royal Hawaiian, so it's very easy to spot.
I by myself and with my family, wife and two children, have stayed at the Royal Grove, 6 times over the years and I can only say that it becomes your "home away from home" in Hawaii.

We stayed here once a few years back and this is the only hotle in Waikiki that let us checkin at 8 am. When you arrive, jet-lagged from Tokyo at 7 am, this is much appreciated. The Sheraton Waikiki and Outrigger made us sit around in a "lounge" until well after 2 pm! Best service from a small hotel!

We have stayed at the Royal Grove for the last two summers. The hotel is no frills; but clean and comfortable. The owners - the Fong Family and the front desk staff are helpful and make us feel as part of the family when we are there. We like to use our travel dollars on things other than our hotel; so the Royal Grove fits our needs perfectly. We also like that it is very conveniently located to the bus lines, the beach and other hotels. It is just five stories; not a high rise which we also like. The Royal Grove is like our home away from home while in Waikiki. We can be to Kuhio beach in a minute. They have boards, chairs, mats to borrow. There is a small pool. The only down side that we have found is that some of the rooms can be noisy. We have met people from all over the world while staying there.The Royal Grove would not be for people who like luxurious, pampered surroundings. It is for travelers who like a comfortable bed to sleep in after a long day of experiencing Hawai`i.
